book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Introduction. In the name of Allah, and prayers and peace be upon the Messenger of Allah. To proceed: This is the second work of our project "Encyclopedia of the Scholar, the Imam, the Reviver of the Era, Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani," which we have dedicated to collecting methodological issues from the heritage of the scholar Al-Albani, in addition to his words on the major international events he witnessed. We have named it "Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events." The truth is that we do not present this work only to the people of our time, but we present it to history! The opinions and ideas contained in this book will remain - by the permission of Allah - a beacon by which generations will be enlightened as long as the heavens and earth exist. They will remain a witness to a rare experience of its kind, of a unique Imam whose like time rarely grants... He lived the concerns of his Ummah (nation) and merged with it, and his heart burned with grief over the weakness and feebleness that befell it... His eyes opened upon a lost generation of the sons of his Ummah... floundering between the darkness of doubts and desires... asking: Where is the way?!... and feeling for a glimmer of light to take their hands to where they should be, so that they may return their Ummah to where it should be! So Allah utilized him for them as an advisor and a guide, extracting the essence of decades of studying the Book of Allah the Exalted and the Sunnah of His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and contemplating the way of the Predecessors (Salaf), the People of Hadith, and the biography of the Imams of Islam throughout the ages, to enlighten the sons of his Ummah with a (Methodology) that would return them and their Ummah to a summit that the first generation had once ascended in times past, then those who came after them lost their path

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and their way, so they fell a resounding fall... Al-Albani never claimed one day that this methodology which he set for the sons of his Ummah was from the figments of his own mind. Rather, he always declared that what he dedicated his life calling to is that straight line which the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, once drew for his Companions, and that what he dedicated his life warning against are those lines which the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, drew to the side of the first line, reciting the saying of the Exalted: (And this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way)! However, this methodology which the scholar Al-Albani laid out for the sons of his Ummah had not been gathered in its scattered parts and arranged in an independent book that would serve as a primary source for knowing it and viewing it, so that remained a barrier preventing many people from knowing the reality of his methodology. Then, it was from the grace of Allah the Exalted and His favor upon us that He facilitated the means for that, so the day came when we present this methodology in a new attire, after we collected the scattered words of the scholar Al-Albani regarding methodological issues from dozens of written and audio sources, then we arranged it in a coordinated order, so that this effort reaches you, dear reader, in this form that is in your hands.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events

text: Thanks and Appreciation. I would like in this place to extend special thanks to the noble brothers who undertook, under my supervision, the transcription of audio materials from the heritage of Sheikh Al-Albani, so that I could compare them with their originals, correct them, refine them, and insert the required material in its places in the encyclopedia. And to extend thanks to the noble brother Fuad Al-Zayla'i who undertook a commendable effort, as is his habit, in coordinating the book, reviewing it, and producing it. And to the noble brother Fahd Al-Lahji who assisted me in the final review stage of the book. And all praise is due to Allah, first and last, outwardly and inwardly.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: With the Readers and To Them. I praise Allah the Exalted for the acceptance He has decreed for the first work of this encyclopedia, "Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Creed (Aqidah)," among the scholars and students of knowledge. I have received dozens of messages on my private mobile and email from various countries blessing this work and encouraging me to complete it fully. So I thank everyone who corresponded with me and encouraged me to complete this project. I also praise Allah the Exalted for the benefit that has been decreed through the first work of the encyclopedia, "The Collection of Creed," such that many brothers of different nationalities have translated scattered parts of it into several languages. I specifically mention among them my brother: Ahmed Abu Turab Al-Britani, for he had high aspirations in translating many parts of the encyclopedia into the English language, which he published on his blessed website (1). I ask Allah to bless him and his efforts. Also, parts of the encyclopedia have been translated into Indonesian, French, Spanish, Turkish, Albanian, Chinese, and others... Among the beneficial efforts for which I praised Allah for facilitating for students of knowledge and lovers of the scholar Al-Albani by documenting the issues transcribed from the tapes by minute and second, is that

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: many brothers have extracted important issues with the voice of the scholar Al-Albani from the tapes to place them in a (Da'wah Flash) accompanied by a transcript of his words benefited from my book, and translating it into other languages at times... along with other thanked efforts by the lovers of the scholar Al-Albani in spreading his knowledge and heritage by benefiting from our effort. And praise be to Allah, first and last, outwardly and inwardly. Furthermore, many of those interested in the Sheikh's heritage have asked my permission, by contacting me or writing to me, to benefit from my effort in the encyclopedia, quoting from it, translating it, and so on. So I wanted to alert here that this work is fundamentally a charitable work aiming to serve the heritage of Sheikh Al-Albani and make it accessible. So I have no objection to my effort being benefited from in any way, provided that Allah is feared in quoting the words of the scholar Al-Albani or translating them correctly. For this reason, I personally uploaded a charitable copy of the "Collection of Creed" to the internet myself. Were it not that the expenses of the project are large and there is no sponsor for it, forcing us to print it as a commercial edition in small quantities to cover the expenses, I would have preferred for the encyclopedia to be printed in charitable editions and distributed for free to students of knowledge, Islamic centers, and entities interested in the Sheikh's heritage.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: The Methodology Collection. I had explained in the introduction to the "Collection of Creed" the method I followed in compiling this encyclopedia, and I mentioned the sources I surveyed for that, elaborating on my methodology therein. It suffices me here to draw attention to some important aspects specific to the "Methodology Collection": 1 - I was about to write an introductory preface to the term (Methodology/Manhaj) and its implications, as I noticed that the term 'Methodology' is surrounded by much confusion in understanding it, especially among those who constantly mention it and attribute themselves to it!! But I decided to postpone that to the study section. 2 - There is a connection in many topics between the Methodology Collection and the Creed Collection. The Methodology Collection is considered complementary to what was mentioned in the Creed Collection regarding these topics. For example: - We dedicated the Sheikh's words on the sects opposing the creed of Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah in the Methodology Collection, while the discussion on their beliefs had previously occurred in the Creed Collection in scattered places. We cited a number of Sufi beliefs in the chapters of Tawhid (Monotheism) and Shirk (Polytheism), just as we cited a number of beliefs of the Murji'ah and Khawarij in the chapters of Faith and Disbelief, and a number of beliefs of the Jahmiyyah, Mu'tazilah, and Ash'aris in the chapters of Names and Attributes, and a number of beliefs of the Jabriyyah and Qadariyyah in the chapters of Decree and Predestination, clarifying the error of their beliefs and refuting them. So what we mentioned of discussion regarding these sects in the Methodology Collection is considered complementary to what is mentioned in the Creed Collection regarding these sects.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Also, we previously dedicated the discussion on the sources of inference (evidence) according to Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah in the Creed Collection, and this is an important aspect of the fundamentals of the Salafi Call. - Therefore, whoever wants to get a complete picture of the issues contained in the Methodology Encyclopedia should look to see if these issues are related to Creed, and complete them from there. 3 - I hesitated a lot about adding the Sheikh's words on the major events he witnessed, such as the Afghan Jihad, the Algerian issue, the Second Gulf War, and others, to the Methodology Collection or not, considering putting that in a separate book. Then I settled on adding it to the Methodology Collection because it appeared to me that the Sheikh's methodological principles were reflected in his opinions on these major events. The Sheikh's opinions on political action were reflected in his view of the Algerian issue, and his opinions on issues of Jihad were reflected in his view of the Afghan issue and the Second Gulf War, and so on.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: A Final Word. I hope that this work, which I labored to collect, arrange, and produce, will be a key to goodness for everyone who views it from the sons of our religion, whatever his methodology or orientation, and however great the distances between us and him. Nothing drove us to produce this work except mercy and compassion for people whom we reckon have not stood upon what we have stood upon of what we believe to be the truth. Here we are today presenting them with something of that, perhaps Allah will unite us on a common word... And perhaps this work will also be a key to goodness for brothers of ours who transgressed against us and against the sons of our religion, and exceeded the limits of Allah regarding us and them, and appointed themselves - without right - as judges over those who attribute themselves to Islam and the Sunnah... Even though they have undeniable efforts in spreading the correct Creed, defending the creed of Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah, and refuting deviant ideas, along with other scientific and da'wah efforts that no one denies except an ingrate, yet they followed a path that the scholar Al-Albani often warned against. Thus, they deviated with the Da'wah and led their students into a dark tunnel with no end. - They are people for whom the Salafi Da'wah, which is the green garden of Islam that we hope the people of Islam will shade themselves in from the scorching heat of Shirk, innovations, and superstitions... has transformed in the hands of these people into poisoned arrows, each of them trying to strike the liver of his brother, never missing him... - People for whom the ways of speech have narrowed, and the doors of knowledge have closed in their faces, so they resort

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: to talking about people, tracking their stumbles, trying to dig up the buried secrets of their chests, and penetrating the folds of their secrets... - They do not rest for an hour from splitting our heads and tearing our hearts with the thunderbolts of Tabdi' (declaring others innovators) which they rain down every day from the sky of their rotten methodology... - People to whom the matter of injustice has become trivial, such that you find a fair man and tell him about their affair, expose their secret to him, entertain him with their talk, and amuse him with their news, as if you are presenting something from the wonders of creatures, or a type of supernatural occurrence, or a form of the secrets of the universe... - One of them hears a word of truth from his companion, and believes it is a word of truth, but he hates him, so he hates the truth because of him, and sets out to refute him with flimsy arguments, under the claim of defending the Methodology... - If you are afflicted with a poet from among them, he begins to chant before you a poem of Tabdi', feeling as though he is making you swallow poison drop by drop, until you wish he would strike you with it all at once on the top of your head to end your life, relieving you from this torture he called poetry, and removing from your shoulder this burden he called verse... - And indeed, much of the speech they deposited in their books and treatises, and rained down on the ears of their listeners, if Allah were to transform it into something other than letters, it would fly as flies onto the faces of the readers and listeners... - If you see the ignorant among them being put forward, and the foolish among them being revered, and your soul tempts you to ask one of their followers inquiringly and disapprovingly about the dangerous secret behind this promotion and esteem, his eyes would bulge to make you feel that Allah created him in this world to scrutinize, then you feel as if an electric current has flowed from his soul to his hand, so his nerves spasm and his fingertips harden

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and his limbs freeze, to whisper in your ears saying: The brother is strong in the Methodology!! - They put forward their most ignorant one, then they tell the lie and believe it, painting him with descriptions and attributes, so he is: The Sheikh, the Allamah, the Muhaddith, the Faqih, the Usuli, the Investigator, the Scrutinizer, the..., the..., the... (How many are the names of the cat, yet how insignificant it is in itself!)... - Then their ignorant one does not hesitate to (live the role) as they say in Egypt, or (believe himself) as they say in the Levant, or (make a crowd for himself) as they say in Yemen, so he takes the lead in gatherings, declaring others innovators, declaring them sinners, cursing and insulting... - They invented principles from themselves and made them the principles of our Call, and rules from their own thoughts and named them the rules of our Methodology. If you contemplate, you find their principles in need of principles, and you find their rules hanging in the air shouting: Where are the rules?! - One of them meets with the devil of his desire on a moonless night to come out to us in the forenoon with a statement of Tabdi' marked as being by the consensus of Ahlus-Sunnah. We are baffled to know which consensus is this that describes the saying of a man or two, unless it is the consensus of our brothers from Ahlus-Sunnah in the world of the Jinn... but we hold them in too high regard for that!! - One of them, with his disciples, declared one hundred souls innovators (in a Tabdi' auction) in one hour (at a rate of one and a half men per minute)! I do not know why the Guinness Book of World Records was not contacted to record this standard-setting Tabdi' event, the first of its kind?! - If you sit with one of them, you envy Abu Al-Ala Al-Ma'arri who once said: I praise Allah for blindness as others praise Him for sight, for He has done well by me and been kind to me, as He spared me seeing the heavy-hearted and the hateful...

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: - There is no word from their opponent except that it has a female cousin and a maternal aunt with them... which the speaker hides behind the walls of his words... They alone are capable of tearing its veil and bringing it out of its seclusion... - The standard for them is what obsesses their minds, not what is the truth and reality... - They do not recall from the Arabic dictionary except: intends and wants, plans and plots... - They have not understood that the people most entitled to judge persons are the people of knowledge and complete piety, and those most insightful about the one being judged. If any of that is missing, then his judgment is itself a dispute needing someone to judge upon it... - A virtuous Sheikh draws one of them close, teaching and raising him... When his arm becomes strong, he stabs and shoots him... He surrounds him and brings him near... If he recites a rhyme, he slanders and lampoons him... - They turned to the people of knowledge and virtue with Tabdi' (declaring innovators) and Tajrih (disparagement), so one of them thinks he can, with a limping article or a crippled word, destroy something that is, from beginning to end, like a straw brought to uproot a mountain from its foundations... - Perhaps I will stop describing them at this extent, for my pen has tired of them and I have tired of them... - I have divorced their news irrevocably a long time ago, except that news reached me - by decree - that the circle - the circle of Tabdi' - has turned among their elders in our Yemeni lands and abroad. I fear most that each of them will declare himself an innovator after they have declared the world around them innovators... - Perhaps it is from the blessing of this collection, dear reader, that it contained a large number of the Sheikh's directives regarding the extremists of Tabdi', warning against their method, and clarifying their deviation of the Salafi Call from its true path. - I must not miss in this place extending thanks to our virtuous Sheikh Abu Al-Hasan Mustafa bin Isma'il Al-Sulaymani Al-Ma'ribi, may Allah preserve him, guide him, and direct his steps. Allah favored me with sitting with him and benefiting from his advice and direction at a time - and age - that is for a student

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: of knowledge a crossroads: either he chooses for himself the path of seeking knowledge, research, induction, exploration, inspection, serving the heritage of our Ummah and Imams, supporting the People of Hadith and Athar, and defending the Sunnah and its sanctuaries... Or he engages in hateful partisanship and narrow loyalties, or occupies himself with tracking people's faults and diminishing the people of knowledge and virtue, or loiters in the cafes of Tabdi', or wastes his life on websites of insults and disparagement... Not to mention his broad chest in accepting his students' disagreement with him, nay, encouraging them to do so. How often we disagreed with him - and disagree with him - even though we do not match him in knowledge, status, experience, and practice, yet he accepts that from us with his welcoming chest. How many gatherings he holds to discuss with his students some issues, ending the gathering by saying: This is your opinion and this is my opinion, or this is what appeared to me but perhaps I will reconsider the issue, in a bright image of the breadth and flexibility of the Salafi Call. Where is this compared to the method of those who appointed themselves guardians over us and our Call, and their state with their disciples is: I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the path of right conduct. I ask Allah to reward him with the best reward, to prolong his life, bless his work, knowledge, and call, preserve him from before him and behind him, grant him a good ending, and gather us with him in His Paradises. Written by Dr. Shadi bin Muhammad bin Salim Al-Nu'man in Sana'a, Yemen - may Allah guard it - on the night of Monday, the 17th of Dhu al-Hijjah 1432 AH, corresponding to November 13, 2011.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Introduction by our Sheikh Abu Al-Hasan Mustafa bin Isma'il Al-Sulaymani - may Allah preserve him - to our works. Praise be to Allah alone, and peace be upon His servants whom He has chosen. To proceed: I have looked at some parts of the "Series of Verification of Hadith Manuscripts That Have Not Been Published Before" undertaken by the blessed young man and loyal brother Dr. Shadi bin Muhammad bin Salim Al-Nu'man - may Allah preserve him and extend his life in obedience, benefit, and blessing. I praised Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, that He created among our brothers, our Call, and our students someone who carries this high ambition and noble goals. I remembered what Al-Hafiz Ibn Rajab Al-Hanbali - may Allah the Exalted have mercy on him - described the knowledge of the people of Yemen with, for he said in "The Virtue of the Knowledge of the Predecessors over the Knowledge of the Successors" (p. 57-58): "The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, testified for the people of Yemen regarding faith and jurisprudence. The people of Yemen are the least of people in speech and expansion in sciences, but their knowledge is beneficial knowledge in their hearts, and they express with their tongues the amount needed of it, and this is jurisprudence and beneficial knowledge." End quote. Indeed, whoever looks at the works of this young man whom Allah has honored with high ambition, a sharp mind, and persistent patience - and I do not purify him before Allah the Exalted - knows that he has combined two goods: blessing in knowledge, and abundance in production. Yes, how much the former left for the latter, and how great is Allah's blessing upon His servants, and how many are the good metals in this Ummah, that blessed Ummah, which is like rain; it is not known whether its beginning is better or its end.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Who would have imagined that a young man in his early twenties would carry this concern and this ambition?! I ask Allah by His Beautiful Names and Lofty Attributes to preserve him from before him, behind him, his right, his left, above him, and below him, and to divert from him the attachments, obstacles, distractions, and problems that stand between people of ambition and achieving their goals of acquiring sciences, classifying them, arranging them, refining them, organizing them into chapters, acting upon them, and calling to them. The series of verifying Hadith manuscripts that have not been published before fills multiple gaps in the Islamic library and brings closer to researchers sources whose loss or lack of discovery has caused long regret, due to what this series contains of books whose value only students of knowledge can appreciate. So far, printed from it are the book "Al-Thiqat mimman lam yaqa' fi al-Kutub al-Sittah" by Ibn Qutlubugha in nine volumes, and the book: "Qada' al-Watar min Nuzhat al-Nazar" in three volumes by Burhan al-Din al-Laqani. Now he has prepared for printing a number of books and treatises, including: "Al-Takmil fi al-Jarh wa al-Ta'dil" by Al-Hafiz Ibn Kathir Abu Al-Fida in four volumes. And "Tajrid al-Asma' wa al-Kuna min Kitab al-Muttafaq wa al-Muftariq" by Al-Khatib Al-Baghdadi, classified by Al-Fara', in two volumes. And "Miftah al-Sa'idiyyah Sharh al-Alfiyyah al-Iraqiyyah" by Ibn Ammar Al-Maliki, in one volume. His work - may Allah preserve him - is still ongoing on "Tajrid al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat" by Al-Hafiz Ibn

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Hajar, which is a refinement of Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat by Al-Safadi, with additions and rectifications by Al-Hafiz, as is known from the critical method that distinguished Al-Hafiz - may Allah have mercy on him - and it is expected to be in eight volumes. Also "Tartib Thiqat Ibn Hibban" by Al-Haythami, expected to be in ten volumes. And "Al-Kamal fi Asma' al-Rijal" by Al-Maqdisi, expected to be in ten volumes. And other works that predict a bright future of giving and unique scientific production - and we do not purify anyone before Allah -. Furthermore, if the reader were to look at the author's encyclopedic effort in the encyclopedia of the sciences of the valiant Sheikh, the Muhaddith of the Era, the Jewel of the Age, our Sheikh Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani - may Allah have mercy on him and grant him abundant reward - he would know the Yemeni favor upon the sciences of the Muhammadan Sunnah across current and future centuries. About nine volumes have been issued from this encyclopedia in the chapter of Creed, and work continues on the rest of the sciences of the Sheikh - may Allah have mercy on him - expected to reach about thirty volumes - if Allah the Exalted wills -. Not to mention the translation of some of these efforts into several languages, through the Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Studies, and Translation established by our blessed brother Abu Hafs Shadi bin Muhammad bin Salim Al-Nu'man, may Allah preserve him. I had expected that one of the senior callers in the Levant (Sham) would undertake this colossal service to the sciences of our Sheikh Al-Albani - may Allah have mercy on him -, but precedence in good deeds is not strange for the people of Yemen, as is not hidden. If these efforts referred to in this introduction indicate anything, they indicate the care of students of Sharia sciences in Yemen for the sciences of our earlier and later Imams, their eagerness for benefit and utilization from wherever it comes,

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and their lack of partisanship except to the truth - except for those afflicted with desire -. All of this is from the grace of Allah upon the Call which made knowledge the core of its essence, the artery of its life, and the sight of its eyes. I ask Allah Almighty to increase me, the author, students of knowledge, and everyone from the people of faith in determination when desires arise, and insight when doubts arise, and to treat us all with His kindness, pardon, covering, and aid. And praise be to Allah in the beginning and the end. And may Allah send prayers and peace upon our Prophet Muhammad, and upon his family and companions, all together. Written by Abu Al-Hasan Mustafa bin Isma'il Al-Sulaymani. Dar Al-Hadith in Ma'rib. 29 Shawwal 1432 AH.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Introduction by our noble Sheikh Ali Hasan Abdul-Hamid Al-Halabi - may Allah preserve him - to the Project. In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Indeed, all praise is due to Allah, we praise Him, we seek His help, and we ask for His forgiveness. We seek refuge in Allah from the evils of our own selves and our bad deeds. Whomever Allah guides, none can mislead him, and whomever He misguides, none can guide him. I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, with no partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. To proceed: I have viewed the blessed and auspicious effort undertaken by our virtuous brother Sheikh Shadi Nu'man - may our Lord the Most Merciful preserve him - in collecting, arranging, and precise recording of many of the sciences and knowledge bequeathed to the Ummah by our Sheikh, the Imam, the Scholar, the Muhaddith, the Faqih, Abu Abdul-Rahman Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani - may Allah the Exalted have mercy on him - which made accessing it closer and benefiting from it easier. This is an effort whose value is only realized by one who knows knowledge, endured the hardship of researching it, and looked into its subtleties and hidden aspects... May Allah reward him with the best reward for this distinguished scientific work, and grant us, you, and him sincerity and the Sunnah, steadfastness upon it, and meeting Allah Almighty with it...

text: Does Methodology enter into Creed or Rulings? Intervention: Here are two questions: First Question: Does Methodology (Manhaj) enter into the chapter of Creed (Aqidah) or into the chapter of Rulings (Ahkam)? Peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. The Sheikh: We are not concerned in answering this question with terminological matters that have arisen and arise especially in this time. I say as he, peace be upon him, said in the hadith of the Sermon of Need (Khutbat al-Hajah) which I mentioned previously, and in it he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, says: "And the best guidance is the guidance of Muhammad, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family," and in another narration: "And the best Hady (guidance/way) is the Hady of Muhammad, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family." So the guidance of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, must be taken as a whole; we do not differentiate between the end and the means; because the means leads to the end which Allah, Mighty and Majestic, legislated. If there are means that the Messenger, peace be upon him, clarified to the Ummah and commanded them to adopt or encouraged them towards, then it is not permissible for us to invent new means opposite to them, even if these means are from permissible matters, but we adopt them as a means to call the Ummah to Islam generally or to Islam in its details which the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, brought. We know that in this time new concepts have emerged which people adopted... to bring people closer to Islam, and they adopted these means as if they were ends they adhere to, claiming that they bring them closer to Allah. They adopt means, for example: from modern games which the lands of Kufr (disbelief) have been afflicted with; because they are the ones primarily intended by the saying of Him, the Blessed and Exalted: {They took their religion as amusement and diversion and the worldly life deluded them} [Al-An'am: 70]. Some Muslims followed the path of these people, to whom playing with these new games that came to us from the lands of Kufr, who have no religion but amusement and play, was made attractive. So some of those who belong to some Islamic parties adopted them

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: as means to bring the youth closer to Islam, from which they have unfortunately become very distant. This was not from the guidance of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. Rather, his guidance was calling the youth, the elders, and all people to worship Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, alone with no partner, and reminding them that there is another life, either lasting bliss or Hellfire and blaze; and that is according to righteous deeds or evil deeds, as the Exalted said: {As for he who gives and fears Allah * And believes in the best [reward] * We will ease him toward ease} [Al-Layl: 5-7] meaning: Paradise, {But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need * And denies the best [reward] * We will ease him toward difficulty} [Al-Layl: 8-10] which is Hell. This is how the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, used to remind his companions of Paradise and Hell, and make that a means to bring them closer to the worship of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted. Today, some means have been adopted by some people in imitation of those disbelievers whom the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, warned us against imitating in many authentic hadiths known to all those present, Allah willing. Among them is his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, as in Sahih Al-Bukhari: "You will follow the ways of those before you, span by span and cubit by cubit, even if they entered a lizard's hole, you would enter it. They said: O Messenger of Allah? The Jews and the Christians? He said: Who else among people?" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said in the authentic hadith in Musnad Ahmad and others: "I was sent before the Hour with the sword until Allah is worshipped alone with no partner, and my provision was placed under the shadow of my spear, and humiliation and lowliness were placed upon those who oppose my command, and whoever imitates a people is one of them." The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, while forbidding imitation of the disbelievers, encouraged Muslims towards something more sublime and higher than that, which is his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "The Jews and the Christians do not dye [their hair], so differ from them," meaning: their gray hair, they do not dye their hair, so differ from them. Thus the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was concerned that Muslims should not imitate the disbelievers, nay, that they should not share with the disbelievers in anything where they possess nothing but sharing. But the Messenger, peace be upon him, commanded dyeing hair to differentiate from them, meaning regarding the matter in which they cannot differ from them: gray hair,

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: For gray hair is the way (Sunnah) of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, in His creation; there is no difference in it between a Muslim and a disbeliever. Everyone who reaches a certain age among humans will be afflicted with gray hair. So he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, commanded the Muslim, when gray hair streaks him, to dye it; because the disbelievers among the Jews and Christians do not dye their hair. He, peace be upon him, said: "So differ from them." The hadiths commanding to differ from the polytheists are very, very many, and I have collected a good group of them in my book "The Veil of the Muslim Woman," so whoever wants to expand in this field can refer to it. The point is that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, while forbidding imitation, added to that encouraging opposing the disbeliever. Opposition is broader than imitation; a Muslim might not imitate a disbeliever if, for example, he goes gray, because this is from the creation of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, but he can oppose the disbeliever by dyeing his hair. Therefore, he, peace be upon him, said: "The Jews and Christians do not dye, so differ from them." If the keenness of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, reached this rank in encouraging Muslims to differ from the polytheists, then how is it permissible for some Muslims today to adopt some means that the disbelievers are upon to attract people to mosques, for example? The matter has reached such an extent with some of them that they introduced pictures into mosques, and even introduced some musical instruments in some countries in the name of softening the hearts of Muslims. Worse and more bitter than this in terms of deception upon people is what they adopted of means which they spread and many tapes were recorded with, which is what they call Islamic Nasheeds (songs). The accursed Iblis dragged them to this means at first by intonation and composing some of what they call Islamic Nasheeds with the meters sung by dissolute singers. This is how they started spreading these alleged Islamic Nasheeds. Then Satan dragged them and moved them from this first disobedience to another disobedience more heinous than the first, where they started beating tambourines and drums in what they call Islamic Nasheeds. Then Satan ascended with them until they introduced some other musical instruments which the dissolute people of the past did not know, but are rather instruments invented by the European

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: disbelievers. They introduced these Nasheeds and these instruments into the houses of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, along with pictures and video and similar means, claiming they are to attract people to obedience to Allah and worship of Allah in the houses of Allah. They have fallen into the likes of what the disbelievers fell into before. When some wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, mentioned, when they returned from Abyssinia, they mentioned to the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, a church they saw in Abyssinia and mentioned the images and pictures in it. So he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Those constitute a people who, when a righteous man among them died, built a place of worship over his grave and made those pictures in it. Those are the worst of creation in the sight of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted." Thus, mosques today have become very close to Christian churches; in terms of their decoration and ornamentation, and in terms of singing in them what they call religious songs. I fear, greatly fear, that a day will come when unveiled women are allowed to enter mosques just as Christians do exactly in churches. We ask Allah, Mighty and Majestic, to suffice us against the evil of newly invented matters. This is what is easy for me to answer regarding that question. And we ask Allah for the Muslims to return to their religion in the light of the Book and the Sunnah and what the Righteous Predecessors were upon. Yes. (Al-Huda wan-Nur /805/ 53:34:00)

text: Defining Salafiyyah and Clarifying that it is an Attribution to Infallibility. Question: Some of the sitting brothers hear about the Salafi Call by hearsay, and read what is written about it by its opponents, not by its followers and callers. It is hoped from your virtue, as you are among the scholars and callers of Salafiyyah, to explain the position of Salafiyyah among Islamic groups today? Answer: I have answered a question like this more than once, but the answer must be given since the question has been raised. So I say: I say a word of truth which no Muslim can dispute after the truth becomes clear to him: First of that: To what is the Salafi Call attributed? Salafiyyah is an attribution to the Salaf (Predecessors). We must know who the Salaf are when 'the Salaf' is uttered among Muslim scholars, and consequently understand this attribution and what is its weight in its meaning and indication? The Salaf are: The people of the three centuries (generations) to whose goodness the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, testified in the authentic Mutawatir hadith extracted in the Two Sahihs and others from a group of Companions, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, that he said: "The best of people are my generation, then those who follow them, then those who follow them." These are the three centuries to whose goodness the Messenger, peace be upon him, testified. Salafiyyah belongs to this Salaf, and Salafis belong to these Salaf. If we know the meaning of Salaf and Salafiyyah, then I say two things:

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: The First Matter: That this attribution is not an attribution to a person or persons, as are the attributions of other groups present today on Islamic earth. This is not an attribution to a person nor to tens of persons. Rather, this attribution is an attribution to infallibility; that is because it is impossible for the Righteous Predecessors to agree upon error. The same is not true for the Khalaf (Successors); for the Khalaf, no praise came in the Sharia for them; rather, dispraise came regarding their masses, and that is in the completion of the previous hadith, where he, peace be upon him, said: "Then there will come after them people who testify but are not asked to testify..." etc. the hadith. Just as he, peace be upon him, indicated that in another hadith in praise of a group of Muslims and dispraise of their masses by the concept of the hadith, where he, peace be upon him, said: "A group of my Ummah will remain manifest upon the truth, unharmed by those who oppose them until the command of Allah comes, or until the Hour is established." This hadith specified praise at the end of time for a Ta'ifah (group), and the Ta'ifah is the small group, for in the language it applies to a single individual and above. Therefore: If we know this meaning in Salafiyyah and that it belongs to the group of the Righteous Predecessors, and that they are the infallibility if the Muslim adheres to what these Righteous Predecessors were upon, then comes the second matter I indicated just now, which is that every Muslim then knows this attribution and what it aims at of infallibility, so it becomes impossible for him after this knowledge and clarification to - I do not say to disavow, this is a self-evident matter - but I say: it becomes impossible for him except to be a Salafi; because we have understood that attributing oneself to Salafiyyah means: Attributing oneself to infallibility. From where did we take this infallibility? We take it from a hadith used by some of the Khalaf to argue contrary to the truth. They use it to argue for taking the opinion of the majority, what the masses of the Khalaf are upon, when they bring his saying, peace be upon him: "My Ummah will not agree on error." It is not correct to apply this hadith to

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: the Khalaf today with the radical differences between them. "My Ummah will not agree on error" cannot be applied to the reality of Muslims today, and this is a matter known to every student of this bad reality. Added to that are the authentic hadiths that came clarifying what happened to those before us of the Jews and Christians, and what will befall the Muslims after the Messenger, peace be upon him, of division. So he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said: "The Jews split into seventy-one sects, and the Christians into seventy-two sects, and my Ummah will split or divide into seventy-three sects, all of them in the Fire except one. They said: Who is it, O Messenger of Allah? He said: It is the Jama'ah (Group)." This Jama'ah is: the Jama'ah of the Messenger, peace be upon him. It is the one for which applying the previous hadith: My Ummah will not agree on error; can be decided with certainty that the intended meaning of this hadith is the Companions whom the Messenger, peace be upon him, judged to be the Saved Sect, and whoever followed their path and tended towards them. These Righteous Predecessors are the ones whom our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, warned us in the Noble Quran against opposing, and against following a path other than their path, in His saying, Mighty and Majestic: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115]. I draw the attention of our brothers on many occasions to the wisdom of our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, conjoining His saying in this verse: {and follows other than the way of the believers} to opposing the Messenger. What is the wisdom in that, given that if the verse were without this sentence, if it were as follows: "And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination," it would have been sufficient in warning and reprimanding whoever opposes the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and judging him with an evil destiny? The verse was not like this, but rather added to it His saying, Mighty and Majestic: {and follows other than the way of the believers}. Is this superfluous? Far be it for the speech of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, to be superfluous. Therefore: What is the purpose, what is the wisdom of conjoining this sentence: {and follows other than the way of the believers} to {opposes the Messenger}?

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: The wisdom is in the words of Imam Al-Shafi'i, where he used this verse as evidence for Consensus (Ijma'), meaning: whoever follows other than the path of the Companions who are the infallibility in our previous expression, and they are the Group to which the Messenger, peace be upon him, testified as being the Saved Sect, and whoever followed their path; these are the ones whose path it is not permissible to oppose for anyone who wants to be saved from the punishment of Allah on the Day of Resurrection. Therefore He said: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115]. Therefore: Muslims today at the end of time must know two things: First: Who are the Muslims mentioned in this verse? Then what is the wisdom that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, intended by them the Companions who are the Righteous Predecessors and whoever walked their path? The explanation and answer to this question or this wisdom has preceded. The summary of that is that the Companions were close in time to receiving the revelation fresh and tender from the mouth of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, first. Then they witnessed their Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, who lived among them applying the rulings stipulated in the Quran, and the mention of many of which came in his sayings, peace and blessings be upon him. While the Khalaf did not have this virtue, of hearing the Quran and the hadiths of the Messenger, peace be upon him, directly from him, nor did they have the virtue of witnessing the application of the Messenger, peace be upon him, of the texts of the Book and the Sunnah in practical application. And among the wisdom stated in the Sunnah is his saying, peace be upon him: "News is not like witnessing," and from it the poet took his saying: And no seer is like one who heard. So: Those who did not witness the Messenger, peace be upon him, are not like his Companions who witnessed him

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani regarding Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research, Islamic Studies, Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and heard speech from him directly and saw from him practical application. Today there is a modern phrase, which some Islamic callers have excelled in, and it is a very beautiful phrase, but more beautiful than it is that we make it a reality. They say in their lectures, sermons, and guidance: We must make Islam a reality walking on the earth. Beautiful speech, but if we do not understand Islam in the light of the understanding of the Righteous Predecessors - as we say - we cannot achieve this healing beautiful speech, to make Islam a realistic fact walking on the earth. Those who were able to do that were the Companions of the Messenger, peace be upon him, for the two reasons mentioned previously: They heard the speech from him directly, so they comprehended it with the best comprehension, then there are matters there that need clarification of action, so they saw the Messenger, peace be upon him, clarify that to them in action. And I give you a very clear example: There are verses in the Noble Quran that a Muslim cannot understand unless he knows the Sunnah that clarifies the Noble Quran, as He, Mighty and Majestic, said: {And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them} [An-Nahl: 44]. For example, His saying, Exalted is He: {[As for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38]. Now bring the Sibawayh (master grammarian) of this time in the Arabic language to explain this noble verse to us: {The thief} who is he? Linguistically, he cannot define the thief. And the hand, what is it? The Sibawayh of the end of time cannot give the answer to these two questions: Who is the thief deserving of hand amputation, and what is the hand that should be amputated regarding this thief? In the language, a thief is one who steals an egg, he is a thief. And the hand is this; if cut here or here or in any place, it is a hand. But the answer is in... the previous verse: {And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them} [An-Nahl: 44]. The answer is in the clarification. So there is a clarification

text: Is it permissible to oppose the consensus of people in a certain time if it contradicts what the Salaf were upon? Intervention: To what extent is it possible to object to the jurists of consensus? The Sheikh: The answer preceded just now. Knowledge is "Allah said, His Messenger said"... "The Companions said"; it is not by deception. Knowledge is not your setting up disagreement foolishly... between the Messenger and the opinion of a jurist. So how about if there isn't the opinion of a jurist, but rather it is the general public, and "O people follow the people," as if it were revealed in the Book of Allah. So the agreement of a group of people on understanding a text from the Book of Allah, and from the hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, these people generally should not oppose them. But for people to come and agree on a modern opinion not received from the three centuries witnessed for by goodness in the authentic Mutawatir hadith, which is his saying, peace be upon him: "The best of people are my generation" - and what is famous on people's tongues: "The best of centuries is my century" is a narration error, rather the established wording in the Two Sahihs and others is: "The best of people are my generation, then those who follow them, then those who follow them" - so the issue that people are upon in a certain time, if it conforms to what the Righteous Predecessors were upon, then it is as we said in our speech just now about Consensus, and we mentioned the saying of Him, the Blessed and Exalted: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as

text:
Advice on the importance of adopting the methodology of the Salaf and an explanation of the danger of deviating from it, by giving examples from the chapters of Creed.

Intervention: Some people might be ignorant of advice related to our world and our Hereafter, his world and his Hereafter. What do you advise us, O my teacher?

The Sheikh: I advise with a brief, summarized word: that we seek beneficial knowledge coupled with righteous action, because that cannot be except with these two conditions: beneficial knowledge and righteous action. Righteous action means: what is known to everyone intuitively, so it does not need explanation except perhaps in some aspects and areas. As for beneficial knowledge, this is what is hidden from many people; because knowledge is what is derived from the Book of Allah and from the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, while relying on what our righteous Salaf were upon. Because they received the Sharia, Book and Sunnah, fresh and tender as the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, uttered it, without addition or subtraction in terms of narration, and without misunderstanding of the text from the Quran and Sunnah. That is why our call, which we harp on always and forever, is: that we call for acting upon the Book and the Sunnah, and upon the methodology of the righteous Salaf. Why do we say on the methodology of the righteous Salaf? To repel the deviation in understanding that may have afflicted the Book and the Sunnah. Due to this deviation, many Islamic sects came into existence, as Islamic history testifies and as the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, prophesied -

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
in the authentic Hadith in which he said: 'The Jews split into seventy-one sects, and the Christians split into seventy-two sects, and my Ummah will split into seventy-three sects, all of them in the Fire except one.' They said: Who is it, O Messenger of Allah? He said: 'It is what I and my companions are upon.' Therefore, scholars agreed to term this sect, out of the seventy-three sects, the Saved Sect (Al-Firqah Al-Najiyah). So the Saved Sect, firstly: is one only, with no second. Then it is: out of seventy-three sects; seventy-two sects are in the Fire and one is in Paradise.

Today, we live in the midst of ancient and modern sects and numerous parties. Some of the ancient sects, their names have vanished but their traces remain. For example, the Mu'tazili logic and the Mu'tazili school of thought, we hardly hear a mention of it these days, but it developed and sometimes appeared under the names of Islamic sects and Islamic schools of thought that are considered and recognized by the majority of Muslims, and sometimes as modern opinions but connected by a strong link to those ancient Mu'tazili opinions. As for the first instance I referred to just now, which exists under names recognized by Muslims, for example, the Ash'aris and the Maturidis. If we exclude from the Islamic world the sects known for deviating from the Sharia, such as the Shia, for example, the Zaydis, and the Khawarij, and limit our discussion to those who are named or call themselves Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah (People of the Sunnah and the Community), then Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah today are three schools regarding beliefs (Aqeedah), and four schools regarding jurisprudence (Fiqh). As for the first three schools, they are: the Maturidis, the Ash'aris, and Ahlul-Hadith. These are three sects related to Creed only within Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah. As for the four schools, they are known to everyone in jurisprudential matters: Hanafi, Maliki, Shafi'i, and Hanbali. If we return to the first three schools, the Maturidis

text:
and the Ash'aris, we find in these two schools a lot of what belongs to the schools, opinions, and ideas of the Mu'tazila. Nevertheless, they are present and spread within the Ash'ari school and the Maturidi school. The most important thing related to what I say exists of Mu'tazilism in the two mentioned schools: the Maturidi and the Ash'ari, the most important thing that can be mentioned now is a principle among principles and a rule among rules, which is: that an authentic Hadith (if it is Ahad/singular) does not establish creed. This is the opinion of the Mu'tazila, but the Ash'aris and Maturidis adopt this opinion as a rule and principle.

The second thing: The Mu'tazila were known among Ahlus-Sunnah truly for interpreting (Ta'wil) the verses of Attributes and the hadiths of Attributes. Interpretation (Ta'wil) is the brother of Negation/Suspension (Ta'til). What is meant by Ta'til is: denying the thing, denying the reality. So when there is a verse, or an authentic Prophetic hadith, and it has a clear, explicit indication, they suspend this indication and bring a meaning that does not immediately come to mind for that Quranic text or Prophetic hadith. This means: they did not follow the Book nor the Sunnah. However, we cannot say: they did not follow the Book and Sunnah by denying them [outright], but rather by circumventing them and exiting their explicit indication in the name of Interpretation (Ta'wil). That is why I said Ta'wil is the brother of Ta'til. We strike a common example: If an Arab man says: 'The King came,' what immediately comes to his mind and to the minds of those addressed by his speech is that the King's servant came? He said 'The King came,' so the listeners do not understand from his speech that he means: 'The King's servant came,' nor do they understand from it that 'The King's minister came.' So if an Arab man spoke this Arabic phrase, this Arabic sentence 'The King came,' and one of the listeners said: 'He means: The King's servant,' this person has suspended (negated) the speech of this speaker.

The Sheikh: Yes. So how about if the suspended speech is the speech of the Lord, Blessed and Exalted?! So the Mu'tazila come, and the Maturidis and Ash'aris follow them in that, so they interpret some Quranic verses and Prophetic hadiths with such an interpretation about which we rightly said: It is the brother of Ta'til (Negation). In the noble verse: {And your Lord comes, and the angels, rank upon rank} [Al-Fajr: 22]. 'Your Lord comes,' and there is no resemblance [to creation], just as we said previously 'The King came.' No, 'The King did not come, who came is the King's servant, the King's minister.' There is a difference between the King's servant and his minister, of course. Even so, if it is interpreted as the King's minister, it is invalid (Batil) and idle (Atil), and if it is interpreted as the King's servant, it is even more idle. Yes. So their saying in interpreting the saying of our Lord, Mighty and Majestic: {And your Lord comes, and the angels, rank upon rank} [Al-Fajr: 22]. 'Your Lord comes' means: 'Your Lord's command,' or 'A creation from your Lord's creation,' or something like that is possible, but not Him, nor His Self. Where did this problem come to them from? Or where did this Ta'til come from?! From drawing an analogy between the Creator and the created, from drawing an analogy between the Absent (Unseen) and the Present (Witnessed). They say: It is not permissible to describe Allah with movement. We do not describe Allah with movement; because He was not described with that. Neither He described Himself with that, nor did His Prophet describe Him with that; but He described Himself that He came, meaning: on the Day of Resurrection. So we say He came, and we do not say that He came means: He moved. They refuse to believe in the explicit Quran. Similarly, for example, regarding this meaning: The known and famous Hadith, rather it is a Mutawatir Hadith to us due to its many authentic paths: 'Our Lord descends every night to the lowest heaven.' The true Ahlus-Sunnah, who are Ahlul-Hadith: believe in the previously mentioned verse on its apparent meaning. 'Your Lord comes': Your Lord came. 'Our Lord descends': Our Lord descends. As for

the Mu'tazila, and the Ash'aris followed them in much of what they followed them in: No, our Lord does not descend. Just as they said: He does not come, they also said He does not descend. Then: What is the meaning of 'Our Lord descends'? Meaning: His mercy. This is interpretation (Ta'wil). This Ta'wil is Ta'til (Negation). This Ta'til necessitates denying legal realities related to the Divine Attributes. Our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, when He describes Himself in His Book, or on the tongue of His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, it is only to make His servants know Him, Blessed and Exalted; because He is absent from us [Unseen], and we cannot see Him except on the Day of Resurrection, God willing. So when we come to the verses of Attributes and hadiths of Attributes, and bring for them meanings other than the apparent, clear meanings from the Quranic or Hadith texts, this means: that we have denied these Divine Attributes. 'Your Lord comes' - Your Lord did not come. 'Our Lord descends' - Our Lord does not descend. Glory be to Allah! If there was a text that He does not come and does not descend, we would believe. But the texts are to the contrary. So how do we describe our Lord with what He did not describe Himself with, and declare Him far above what He described Himself with? This is Ta'til. And this is what some of the Sunni Islamic schools fell into, as we said, such as the Maturidis and Ash'aris.
That is why we said: We call to following the Book and the Sunnah, and upon the methodology of the righteous Salaf, so that we do not fall into such deviations which the Mu'tazila started, then many of those who belong to Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah followed them in it. Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah today, in the convention of the present age, and in Al-Azhar Al-Sharif, and Islamic universities, etc., are Ahlul-Hadith, the Maturidis, and the Ash'aris. Okay, these are three schools in Creed. How can there be three schools in Creed? In matters of the Unseen? They say: Their difference is a mercy. This could have been possible, and this has been said regarding Rulings (Ahkam). Their difference is mercy in rulings, meaning: there is ease. As some ignorant people say: That on the Day of Resurrection, he stands at the beginning of the Sirat (Bridge)... terrors, as if they are the ones holding people to account. The man comes

for example, a Hanafi in school, prayed in a certain way [that might be invalid in his school], but it is valid in another school. The second Imam tells him: Come, easy, your prayer is valid according to my school. And so on. This is manifest error.
So I said: It can be said: That difference in branches (Furu') contains ease. And they built upon that this superstition we mentioned related to the Sirat. Even so, difference is not a mercy even in branches. So how can we say: Three schools in Creed where it is impossible to imagine two forms in Creed? In some legal rulings, it is possible there are two faces. Meaning: As Sheikh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah, may Allah have mercy on him, expresses, he says: Difference is of two types: Difference of Contradiction, and Difference of Variety.
Difference of Contradiction: So-and-so performed ablution and touched a woman. What is the ruling on his ablution? An opinion: His ablution is broken. And an opinion: His ablution is not broken. This is a difference of contradiction. Both opinions cannot be correct in the reality of the Sharia. Rather, one of them is correct. What is correct? The people of knowledge know it, and the people of knowledge are those who derive knowledge from the Book and the Sunnah. This is difference of contradiction; both opinions cannot be correct.
Difference of Variety: Imam Al-Shafi'i says: The opening supplication [of prayer]: 'I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth...' to the end. Imam Abu Hanifa says: 'Glory be to You, O Allah, and with Your praise.' The Muhaddithun: 'O Allah, distance me from my sins...' to the end. Is there conflict or collision? There is no conflict or collision. If you open with 'I turned,' it is permissible. 'Glory be to You,' permissible. 'O Allah distance,' permissible. And there are many other supplications I mentioned in 'The Description of Prayer.' This is difference of variety.

As for Creed (Aqeedah), it is impossible to imagine difference in any way whatsoever. Meaning: Our Lord either descends or does not descend, comes or does not come, rose over the Throne or did not rise over the Throne, and the like. Despite this, three schools were found in Creed. How can these three schools in Creed be conceived as truth? And our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, says: {So what is there after the truth except error?} [Yunus: 32].
Therefore; in order to be safe from falling into such difference, and safe from falling into such deviation from the Book and Sunnah in understanding: It is not [just] belief in the Book and Sunnah. All Islamic sects believe in the Book and Sunnah, but many of them do not believe in the Book and Sunnah [truly]. They believe in it in wording, but do not believe in it in meaning. So what is the benefit of believing in the wording without believing in the meaning? So you realized how they believe in the wording? But they do not believe in the meaning.
Therefore, to avoid falling into such deviation, we call to following the Book and the Sunnah, and upon the methodology of the righteous Salaf. How can we know what our righteous Salaf were upon, whether related to Creed, or related to Fiqh, or related to behavior?
The way by which we know what the Messenger, peace be upon him, was upon: is the same way by which we know what the righteous Salaf were upon. Meaning: briefly, the way of Narration (Riwayah), the way of Hadith, and receiving narrations related whether to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, or to the righteous Salaf, or by way of narrations and Hadith.
This path, the masses of Muslims have deviated from today, and centuries before today. Their masses used to rely in understanding the Book and Sunnah on their own opinions, and they did not feel at all inside themselves that they needed to seek help in understanding the Book and Sunnah through the traditions (Athar) of

the righteous Salaf. They did not feel this. But we, by the grace of those people of knowledge who preceded us, became aware of this important point, which is: the necessity of understanding the Book and Sunnah according to the methodology of the righteous Salaf. Among the evidence for that is His saying, Blessed and Exalted: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115].
Here is a very precise and subtle point in the noble verse: Our Lord mentioned 'the way of the believers' as a conjunction to opposing Allah and the Messenger. He said: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him} [An-Nisa: 115]. He did not suffice with this opposition, but conjoined to it His saying: {and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115].
I wonder, what is the point of mentioning 'the way of the believers'? If the verse were hypothetically: 'And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination,' would it fulfill the purpose that the verse fulfilled with the completion: {and follows other than the way of the believers}? We say: No. Therefore: Here is a profound point in Allah, Mighty and Majestic, mentioning the sentence 'and follows other than the way of the believers' as a conjunction to the saying of the Lord of the Worlds: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115]. Why did He mention this sentence? It becomes clear to you now why? Meaning: [Connection] is by following the way of the believers who followed him with excellence, peace and blessings be upon him. Otherwise, if we did as the Mu'tazila and Khawarij did, insisted on our own views and imposed our understandings, rather our desires, on the texts of the Book and Sunnah, we would have gone far astray, and we would have been among those who opposed Allah and the Messenger. In the name of what? 'This is how we understand.' This is the reason for the deviant sects falling into opposition to the Sharia in many Creeds, let alone

jurisprudential rulings. I usually give a simple example; to clarify the importance of this restriction we benefited from the previous verse, and from the first Hadith: 'What I and my companions are upon.' I give a simple example: A verse in the Holy Quran, one of the clearest verses in explaining the Divine intent, which is His saying, Blessed and Exalted, describing the people of Paradise in Paradise: {Faces, that Day, will be radiant * Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 22-23].
What was the stance of the Mu'tazila and Khawarij regarding this verse, while it is explicit that among the blessings of Allah, Blessed and Exalted, upon the believers in Paradise, indeed it is the greatest blessing Allah bestows upon the people of Paradise: that they see their Lord on the Day of Resurrection. So when they see Him, Blessed and Exalted, they forget all the bliss of Paradise. Yes.
What did the Mu'tazila and Khawarij do regarding this verse? Did they deny it? No, they did not deny it; because if they denied it, they would have exited the religion as a hair is pulled from dough. But they suspended (negated) it, distorted its explicit indication. {Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 23], they said: 'Looking at the *bounty* of their Lord.' Nothing wrong with it, 'looking at the bounty of their Lord.' They estimated a deleted possessive noun (Mudaf Mahdhuf). As we said just now: To clarify how the Arabic language should be understood, let alone the Divine Speech based on the Arabic language? 'The Prince came,' 'The King came.' Is it permissible for us to understand 'The Prince's or King's servant came'? No. My brother, he tells you: 'This is a known matter in Arabic language, estimating a deleted possessive noun.' Here is a research among the people of knowledge, they say: Estimating a deleted possessive noun is permissible when there is evidence necessitating that, otherwise the Arabic language would be disabled. I say: 'Ahmed came.' Yes. Is it understood 'His son came'? 'Ahmed came' - 'His son came'? My brother, where did you get this interpretation (Ta'wil) from? There is no answer

that disables the Arabic language. So here, this is what the Mu'tazila and others did in interpreting the texts of the Book and Sunnah. Yes.

The Sheikh: They understand the truth, but the truth did not agree with their desires. Therefore, they tell you there is a necessity for interpretation. What is its proof? It did not enter his mind. The meaning of this: We do not say they are not believers absolutely, but we say: with all boldness that their faith is deficient and weak; because Allah, Mighty and Majestic, says in the beginning of Surah Al-Baqarah: {Alif, Lam, Mim * This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah} [Al-Baqarah: 1-2]. Who are they? {Who believe in the unseen} [Al-Baqarah: 3]. The first attribute of the pious: those who believe in the unseen. Okay. Among the unseen: {Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 23]. It does not need philosophy. They persisted in using human reason, like: human powers, can you remove the mountain from its place? No. Human power is limited. Likewise sight is limited, hearing is limited. Likewise what? The mind is completely limited. Everything, meaning: Man was created weak. So when they hear the verse: {Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 23], surely if we said: {Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 23] it means: We confined Him in a direction, we put Him above, we put Him in front, etc., from these doubts they derived from what they witness around them as created beings. But the Creator, they forgot that He described Himself with two attributes: one positive, and the other negative.
Positive: An attribute existing in Him. Negative: Exaltation of Him, Blessed and Exalted. So He said: And He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

Intervention: {There is nothing like unto Him} [Ash-Shura: 11].

The Sheikh: {There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing} [Ash-Shura: 11].

{There is nothing like unto Him} [Ash-Shura: 11]. Exaltation; that anything that crosses your mind regarding the attributes of Allah, Mighty and Majestic, where the matter confuses you if it were like our attributes, you immediately say 'There is nothing like unto Him.' But is He merely a meaning existing in the mind with no reality and no existence?! Far be it from Him. Meaning: We can now imagine the Anqa (Phoenix). The Anqa is an ancient imaginary Arabic name, a large bird Sinbad the Sailor talks about, in the story of One Thousand and One Nights and the like. That it is a large bird, meaning: the eggs that come out are like a dome. And he tells the story, in it is amusement and it is all imagination upon imagination. The Anqa: A name without a body, a name in the mind, a meaning existing in the mind. But outside the mind, meaning: in reality, it has no truth.
So our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, who has all attributes of perfection, and is free from all attributes of deficiency, is He like this, a meaning existing in our souls and has no reality existing outside this universe, outside this mind?! Allah is greater than that. Rather He created the heavens and the earth. So He has all attributes of perfection. He is an Essence existing in reality, and having all attributes of perfection. Since the matter is so, what are His attributes, Mighty and Majestic? There is no room for us in the mind to describe Him from ourselves. Rather, He has spared us the burden of stripping our minds by describing Himself to us in the Book and in the Sunnah.
Among these attributes: {Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 23]. That the believers, as one of the jurist poets said, we can say:
The believers see Him without how... and without likeness or striking of an example.
Yes. So seeing Allah is established in the Hereafter. The Mu'tazila denied it, the Khawarij denied it due to the lack [in their view] of texts from the Book and Sunnah. No, the texts exist, but they distorted them and negated their meanings. So then: They did not benefit anything from their belief in these texts while denying the realities of

their indications. Therefore: We must believe in the text in wording and meaning. The text is preserved. How do we know the meaning? Here is the heart of the matter as it is said: By returning to what the righteous Salaf were upon. The Quran is interpreted first by the Quran, then by the authentic Sunnah, then by the Salafi traditions. So do we find among the righteous Salaf an interpretation of this verse: {Faces, that Day, will be radiant * Looking at their Lord} [Al-Qiyamah: 22-23] meaning: 'at the bounty of their Lord'?! Never. Every tradition coming from the Salaf agrees with the apparent meaning of the verse first, then with the authentic, explicit Hadiths indicating that the verse is on its apparent meaning which every Arab understands if he is not afflicted by whim, not afflicted by partisanship or detestable factionalism.
There is another verse; He said: {For those who have done good is the Best (Reward) and Extra} [Yunus: 26]. The interpretation of this verse came in the authentic Hadith in Muslim: {For those who have done good is the Best} [Yunus: 26] meaning: Paradise. {And Extra} [Yunus: 26] meaning: Seeing Allah in the Hereafter.

Intervention: Did they interpret it?

The Sheikh: They interpreted it as something else, seeing blessings and the like of what was mentioned previously. This is called Ta'til (Negation).
In short, and perhaps I took longer than the questioner wanted with the question, in short I say: May Allah have mercy on Ibn al-Qayyim who said:
Knowledge is: Allah said, His Messenger said... The Companions said; it is not by deception.
Knowledge is not your setting up disagreement foolishly... Between the Messenger and the opinion of a jurist.
Nor is it the denial of Attributes and negating them... Warning against Ta'til (Negation) and Tashbih (Likening).
This is knowledge: Allah said, the Messenger of Allah said, the Companions said.
