Today, all Islamic sects take two from this speech: 'Allah said' and 'The Messenger of Allah said,' but they twist and turn around 'Allah said' and 'The Messenger of Allah said,' and bring you a doctrine for which Allah has sent down no authority. Sufficient for you as an example of that: The new sect, which is the Qadiani sect who are called Ahmadis. These are the latest Islamic sects that have an entity, figures, prominence, and a widespread call in Europe and America in the name of Islam. These are Muslims who pray the five prayers, and make pilgrimage to the Sacred House of Allah, but they deny legal realities stated in the Book and Sunnah, which no one preceded them in saying. Not like the Mu'tazila and the Maturidi Ash'aris. For example: They deny that there is a creation called the Jinn, even though there is a surah in the Quran named Surah Al-Jinn. Okay. Do they deny the Quran? Do they deny the Surah? No. But they say to us: You did not understand the meaning of Jinn. Like 'Ins' (Humans) and 'Bashar' (Humans), do these two words indicate one named entity or two? No, one named entity. They then brought a third name. 'Ins,' 'Bashar,' and 'Jinn' are three names applied to one named entity, which is: Humans.
When you bring them a verse in the Quran: {You created me from fire and created him from clay} [Al-A'raf: 12], he says to you: This is not real fire, nor real clay, rather this is a metaphor, a metaphor. And when you bring him the authentic Hadith in Muslim: 'Allah created the Angels from light, and created the Jinn from fire, and created Adam from what has been described to you,' he says to you: This is an Ahad Hadith (singular narration), Ahad Hadith Ahad, a Hadith that is not Mutawatir (consecutive) meaning. An Ahad Hadith does not establish creed. And this deviation, which is: that an Ahad Hadith does not establish creed, unfortunately is not a Qadiani doctrine. The Qadianis were preceded in this deviation by centuries. But they were not preceded in interpreting Jinn as Humans or Bashar.

The Sheikh: I remember well since maybe ten years or more: We were in Mina during Hajj, and on one of the beautiful nights of Mina, the atmosphere there was calm, and our Lord manifesting in it upon His servants. I sat talking with some pilgrims there; there were some from Egypt, some from Syria... etc. When an Egyptian Azhari man entered upon us, he sat down after greeting. He sensed that the one speaking was in a special direction, meaning: broadly speaking, what they call Wahhabi, meaning, and we say: Salafi. So he wanted to raise a problem, which is, he says: That the Wahhabi group are Anthropomorphists (Mujassimah).

They say: That Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is in the Heaven and rose over the Throne. I listened to him in order to return to him. He finished speaking. I said to him: O Sheikh, {The Most Merciful rose over the Throne} [Taha: 5], is this human speech or Allah's speech? He said: No, Allah's speech. I said: I heard you say: The Wahhabis say that. This is the speech of the Lord of the Worlds. What did the poor man say? He said: True. This is the speech of the Lord of the Worlds, but the meaning is not as they say. What do they say about the verse? {The Most Merciful rose over the Throne} [Taha: 5] meaning: Rose above (Ista'la). I said to him: Okay, what is the meaning? Is there a meaning other than this? He said: No. This means: That we have confined our Lord in a place. And here is the point and the subtle issue comes. I said to him: O Sheikh, you understand the group wrongly. They declare Allah free from place, and those who oppose them are the ones who put Allah in a place. He said: How? I said to him: Is 'place' created (Hadith) or eternal (Qadim)? He said: No. Created; because it is from 'Kana Yakunu' (to be/exist). {His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is} [Ya-Sin: 82]. We said to him: Okay. Now we are sitting here in Mina, are we not in a place? He said: Yes. We said to him: And what is above us? He said: The lowest heaven. I said to him: A place? He said: Yes. And above the lowest heaven, without prolonging, we marched to the seventh heaven. What is above the seventh heaven? He said: The Throne. We said to him: Okay. What is above the Throne? Here is a joke. He said - and here is the point - he said: The Cherubim Angels (Karubiyyun).

Intervention: Yes.

The Sheikh: The Cherubim Angels... a transmitted expression, transmitted but it is not correct. I ignored the subject. I said to him: What are the Cherubim Angels? He said: They are angels our Lord created who are above the Throne? He said: Yes. I said to him: Is there a verse that He is above the Throne? In 'The Most Merciful rose over the Throne,' is there a verse that the Angels

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
are Cherubim? He said: No. I said to him: Okay. Is there a Hadith? He said: No. I said to him: Yes, but where did this creed come to you from? He said: Al-Azhar Al-Sharif that taught us. I said to him: Glory be to Allah. Here is the point: I said to him: Glory be to Allah, Al-Azhar Al-Sharif establishes that the Authentic Hadith with proven chain from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, does not establish creed. Okay. And now, neither a verse nor a Hadith, where did you get this creed from?! In any case: This is a parenthetical sentence regarding him. I want to continue the conversation with him regarding 'The Most Merciful rose over the Throne.' We said to him: Okay. We overlook now this creed which you admitted has no basis neither in the Book nor in the Sunnah, but it is an Azhari creed. We concede for the sake of argument that above the Throne are Cherubim Angels. And above the Cherubim Angels, what is there? He said: There is nothing. We said to him: Okay. I forgot to mention something important. I said to him: When I asked, 'Place' is derived from 'Kana Yakunu' (to be)... etc? He said: Yes. I said to him: Is the universe limited or unlimited? He said: Limited. We proceeded in the discussion until we reached the Throne and he came with the superstition of the Cherubim Angels, and I went along with him. Then I said to him: Suppose there are Cherubim Angels, so what is after that? Is there anything there? Did the universe end? He said: The universe ended. So: There is no place left? There is no place left. So: When we say: The Most Merciful rose above the Throne, why do you accuse us that we put Him in a place? There is no place here, O people, by our admission, by everyone's agreement that the universe is limited and the end of the universe after which nothing exists is the Throne. And our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, is above the Throne, above all creations. As the jurist poet also said:
And the Lord of the Throne is above the Throne but... without description of settlement and contact.
For He is Rich (Free of need) of the worlds. But there is no escape rationally and legally from saying: That Allah, Mighty

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
and Majestic, is above all creations; because He is Rich (Free of need) of the worlds. Or we say: That He is in all creations, entering into them, and as they say: mixing like what? Water with ice. Some extremist Sufis said: And Allah is like the what?

Intervention: Except sleeping in his church.

The Sheikh: No, no. Like water in ice or anything meaning. The summary:

Intervention: Like ice in water.

The Sheikh: Yes.

Intervention: Like ice in milk.

The Sheikh: The important thing.

Intervention: Or like milk in water.

The Sheikh: The important thing: Either we say: That Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is above all creations, or we say: inside them, or we say: As I heard one of my Sheikhs in Damascus, and on the pulpit, and on the greatest day, Friday, saying: Allah is neither above nor below, neither right nor left, neither in front nor behind, neither inside the world nor outside it, neither connected to it nor separated from it. This description, if it were said to the most eloquent of Arabs in speech and expression: Describe for us the non-existent! He would not be able to describe it with more than what these people described their Deity! Allah is neither above nor below, neither right nor left, neither in front nor behind, neither inside the world nor outside it, neither connected to it nor separated from it. This is the non-existent. This is the non-existent.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
Therefore, I was very impressed by a word from one of the intelligent princes. Ibn Taymiyyah, may Allah have mercy on him and reward him with good on behalf of Islam, struggled in the way of defending the doctrine of the Salaf a great struggle. And as you know, the people of innovation always rise against the people of Sunnah, and especially in old times and in the time of Ibn Taymiyyah, all the Sheikhs were against him. So they complained to the Prince in Damascus and asked him to gather us with him in order to establish the proof against him before you. So the Prince invited them. The discussion began on some points of Creed, among them: That Ibn Taymiyyah says: Allah, Mighty and Majestic, has the attribute of Highness (Uluw) above all creations. And they say: No, Allah is in every place, like you hear in this time on the slightest occasion, he tells you: Allah exists in all existence! What is the meaning of Allah exists in all existence? Among existence are sewers, toilets, bars, inns, and taverns, etc. Allah exists in all existence.
The summary: The discussion took place between Ibn Taymiyyah and the Sheikhs. Ibn Taymiyyah established the proof against them with speech like this which you heard and more. What did this intelligent, wise Prince say? He is not a scholar, but he heard the debate between Ibn Taymiyyah and the majority of the Sheikhs. So he said about the Sheikhs: 'These people have lost their Lord.' This is correct speech; because it means: neither above nor below, neither right nor left, etc. These are people who lost their Lord, they do not know their Lord whom they worship. But when you prostrate you say: Glory to my Lord the Most High. You do not know this 'my Lord the Most High' is in every place. What is the meaning of Glory to my Lord the Most High? {The Most Merciful rose over the Throne} [Taha: 5] meaning: Rose above/Exalted. Therefore, it is very, very necessary that we stick to this methodology which is acting upon the Book and the Sunnah and upon the methodology of the righteous Salaf. That is why the people of knowledge said:
And all good is in following who preceded ... And all evil is in the innovation of who came later.
(Al-Huda wan-Nur / 161/ 35: 49: 00)

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
Establish the State of Islam in Your Hearts

The first question, O our teacher: The questioner says: The call of the Book and Sunnah is a call of knowledge and action. What is the reality of this statement in front of the practical reality, and the hoped-for aspirations?

The Answer: The truth is as stated in the question. However, I said just now, commenting on the hadith of that Bedouin who said: By Allah, I will not add to them nor subtract, and I continued my speech and said that among the obligations is avoiding prohibitions, and that a person must combine performing obligations and avoiding prohibitions. I said during this speech: And to do of that what he can. And if he can add to that some other acts of obedience and worship which are not obligatory, then that is better and more lasting.
The point: {Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity} [Al-Baqarah: 286].
And people today, in reality: And I mean by people those who care about their religion, and adhere to the rulings of their Sharia, and farewell to those others who are not in the first category of people adhering to the Sharia rulings. They are confused about what or how to proceed, and how to work for Islam while Islam today is ruled by non-Islamic laws, and by states that do not rule by what Allah revealed. So what is the work?
We say: We have a brief word, and this research is long-tailed. We say a very brief word: We read it from one of the Islamic preachers, may Allah have mercy on him: And it is to me as if it were from the revelation of Heaven, and there is no revelation after the Messenger of Allah, but there is inspiration. That

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
word is the one that says: Establish the state of Islam in your hearts, it will be established for you on your land.
Today there are very many groups: Every group claims that it works for Islam, and works to establish the rule of Islam, and the Islamic system on earth. And some of them, nearly a century has passed for them, then nothing but cheers and shouts. What is the reason, I wonder? The reason is that we do not start from where the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, started. And some of these groups do not think at all about refining the soul and reforming individuals and laying the foundation upon which the state is built, or by which the Islamic society is realized.
We all know that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, was sent among a deeply ignorant Jahiliyyah nation, committing various sins and transgressions. Yet he remained for about more than ten years, rather exactly thirteen years, calling to Monotheism (Tawhid), to the worship of Allah alone having no partner. And he was not struggling (Jihad), nor fighting, nor prohibiting wine, and gambling, and killing the innocent soul without right, etc. Rather, that they worship Allah and avoid Taghut (false deities) for thirteen years like this.
Then the Messenger, peace be upon him, migrated from Mecca to Medina, and there the rulings began to descend in some detail. And the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, began founding the Muslim state after he had found the individuals and raised them, peace and blessings be upon him, under his eye, and perfected their discipline and was confident of his raising of them. So he became certain, feeling that they would ransom him with everything, with themselves and their wealth, and with every dear thing to them. After that, the battle began between him and the Arabs, and between the Jews, and this biography is long, you know it. The point: That the Messenger, peace be upon him, the first thing he started with was establishing the base of Islam which is: The testimony that there is no deity but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah.
Many Islamic groups today are keen on establishing Islamic rule, but the saying of that Arab poet applies to them:

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
Sa'd watered them while Sa'd was wrapped up ... This is not how camels are watered, O Sa'd.
Everyone who opposes the methodology of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family - and now I say: after I clarified to you the meaning of Sunnah: everyone who opposes the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and you have known the meaning of Sunnah: the methodology which the Messenger, peace be upon him, walked upon - will never succeed as long as life lasts. Will never succeed; because he did not walk the path which the Messenger, peace be upon him, enacted for us. He said in the first Hadith: 'I left among you two matters, you will never go astray as long as you hold fast to them: The Book of Allah and my Sunnah.'
So those who want to establish the rule of Allah on earth, if they do not walk the path which the Messenger, peace be upon him, walked, they will never reach their goal at all. Rather, the more time passes for them, the further they get from the goal they set before their eyes. How not, when the general Islamic world today, and among them individuals who belong to many of those groups, do not yet know the meaning of La ilaha illa Allah. They do not know this testimony, this good word. And Allah, Mighty and Majestic, says in the Noble Quran: {So know that there is no deity except Allah} [Muhammad: 19].
So if this Divine Command: is to be directed to the Ummah of the Messenger, peace be upon him, in the person of the Messenger. Who is the address to? 'So know' is an address to an individual, but in reality, it is an address to the Ummah of the Messenger, peace be upon him; because Allah, Blessed and Exalted, when He chose His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, as a Messenger to the worlds, a mercy to all of them, undoubtedly he [the Prophet] knows the meaning of Tawhid, the meaning of La ilaha illa Allah. So when He says: 'So know that there is no deity except Allah,' it is from the chapter of, although this might not be fitting, but it's okay, it's from the chapter of speech 'To you [I speak] O neighbor [daughter-in-law], but listen O neighbor.' So this address is not for the Messenger in intent and aim. In wording it is for him, but in intent and aim for whom? For the Ummah of peace and blessings be upon him and his family.
The Ummah of the Messenger now reaches millions upon millions. I do not mean them by this speech of mine, but rather I mean

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
by this speech the groups that work to establish the rule of Islam on earth. Has this Ummah known, has it complied with this Divine Command which was directed to the Ummah entirely in the person of their Prophet, peace be upon him? I say with regret: No. Most of them do not know the meaning of this good word. They say it without doubt, and he who came under the strike of the sword said it, but does he know? Allah knows best. Even so, when this man said it, and the Muslim did not trust when he saw him say it out of fear (Taqiyyah), did not trust this word so he struck him and killed him. But the Messenger, peace be upon him, who came with a Sharia that proceeds on the apparent aspects of matters said to him: 'Did you tear open his heart?' So it is not permissible to apply rulings like this on the hidden aspects of matters; because no one knows them except Allah, Mighty and Majestic. But the Muslim who hopes first for salvation from eternity in the Fire due to associating partners with Allah, Mighty and Majestic - and this is not only what these people hope for, but they hope to establish the rule of Allah on earth. These people should truly be: the elite of Muslims, the elite of the Islamic Ummah which was addressed by His saying: {So know that there is no deity except Allah} [Muhammad: 19] in understanding, action, and character. So where are these people while they are far, very far from understanding the word of Tawhid, let alone the details of this Sunnah regarding which we mentioned two Hadiths: 'Whoever turns away from my Sunnah is not of me.' 'I left among you two matters, you will never go astray as long as you hold fast to them: The Book of Allah and my Sunnah, and they will not separate until they return to me at the Basin.'
Therefore: We who belong to numerous groups, all covered by the circle of Islam, must agree on a common word. What is this common word? The word is not a word uttered by one of us, then he does not know its significance nor its content. Rather we agree on a word

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
common [between us] that we worship none but Allah and associate nothing with Him and do not take one another as lords instead of Allah. That we worship none but Allah. Is there in much of the Muslim Ummah which was addressed by that noble verse anyone who worships other than Allah? Islamic lands are filled with Muslims worshiping other than Allah. But most people do not know. But most people do not know and do not thank the Lord of the Worlds who sent to them this Noble Prophet and left them on the White Path from which no one deviates except he who is destroyed. So a common word: Returning to the Book and the Sunnah in understanding and action. Without that, there is absolutely no life for Muslims. This is what we must work on. We must not rush things, and do, or have applied to us that joke which is narrated about that shepherd who was herding the sheep of the village people. He sat one day in his humble tent, and had hung beneath it the pot filled with a little ghee which he collected from the sheep. So he sat one day at noon resting and began thinking that tomorrow my wealth will increase, and I will marry and our Lord, Mighty and Majestic, will grant us children and they will become my helpers. And if one of them does not listen to my words, by Allah I will do and do and raise this stick and hit him. And nothing went but the stick hitting the jar above his head and the ghee spilled all over the ground. So this one is thinking in fantasy, and he has to do what Allah obligated upon him of His obedience and within the limits of what he can.
We are now rushing things, thinking how to establish the Muslim State? How to get rid of this injustice and this humiliation surrounding us from every side, while the small state which that wise man ordered us saying: Establish the state of Islam in your hearts, it will be established for you on your land. This small state, after we establish it in our hearts, then how do we establish this lofty edifice, this great state which needs millions of Muslims with general Islamic culture in Islam as we said just now: in understanding and application. Then it needs specific types

who gathered from the knowledge that Muslims need today in the present age what realizes the Communal Obligation (Fard Kifaya) in the expression of Jurists.
We ask Allah, Mighty and Majestic, to inspire us with our guidance, and to facilitate for us the path which if we walk it, we refine ourselves and become a good brick for establishing the rule of Allah on earth.
(Al-Huda wan-Nur / 190/ 37: 31: 00)

The Questioner: A Hadith in 'Muslim': 'A group from the West (Gharb) of my Ummah will not cease to be dominant until the Day of Resurrection'?

text:
What is meant by the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs?

The Question: Our Sheikh, the Hadith of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: 'Follow those after me: Abu Bakr and Umar,' and the Hadith: 'Stick to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs.' We want an explanation for this Hadith, and especially this phrase: (Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs). What is intended by it? Of course in many cases: in the case where it agrees with the texts, and in the case where it contradicts the texts, and in the case if disagreement occurs between them, and so on?

The Answer: There is no doubt that the command in the first Hadith: 'Follow those after me: Abu Bakr and Umar,' there is no doubt that they are the people whose companion is not miserable, and that they are the second role model after our Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. The reason for that is very clear to anyone who knows the history of these two great men; as they were the closest people to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, in following, connection to him, and learning from him. So if a person wants to give a fatwa on an issue... by an opinion, whether this opinion stems from himself, or from others among the people of knowledge, and it was contrary to what is established from the two Caliphs mentioned in the Hadith, Abu Bakr and Umar, there is no doubt that their opinion takes precedence over the opinion of others; due to that special status they have with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family.
As for his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, in the Hadith of Al-Irbad bin Sariyah: 'So stick to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Mahdi Caliphs after me, bite onto it with molars' ... to the end of the Hadith, indeed

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
many people misunderstand this Hadith. They think that the meaning of the Hadith: (So stick to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Caliphs) means: the Sunnah of one of the Caliphs. Here, without doubt, is a deleted possessive noun (Mudaf Mahdhuf). I wonder, is the estimation of this deleted noun 'one of the Caliphs,' or is its estimation 'all of the Caliphs'? There is a very big difference between these two estimations. Because the first estimation: 'and the Sunnah of one of the Rightly Guided Caliphs,' means: that it is sufficient that one of the Rightly Guided Caliphs stated an opinion or exercised Ijtihad, and the Messenger, peace be upon him, orders Muslims to take it, and considers exiting from it misguidance and innovation in religion. Whereas the other opinion or estimation, which is the Sunnah of the collective Rightly Guided Caliphs, the matter is completely different.
There is no doubt that the agreement of the Rightly Guided Caliphs on something is almost impossible to be an error in itself, contrary to if one of them was unique in an opinion without the others. Then the big difference appears between the meaning of each of the two estimations. There is no doubt nor suspicion in my mind that the second estimation is the one that agrees with some other legal texts, among them His saying, Exalted is He: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115]. Allah, Mighty and Majestic, says: {and follows other than the way of the believers}. Is it the way of one of the believers? Likewise: 'The Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs,' all four of them and not one of them. Then factual history indicates that it is very far-fetched that the Prophet, peace be upon him and his family, would order Muslims to follow one of the Rightly Guided Caliphs, especially if it became clear later that it was an Ijtihad from him, and the evidence or reality indicated that success did not accompany it.
We said just now regarding the Hadith: 'Follow those after me,' we said there is no doubt that a Muslim must emulate these two noble Companions and prioritize their opinion over his own. But does he prioritize the opinion of one of them over his own? This is a point of discussion; because opinion may be correct from the predecessor or correct from the successor. So if

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
the correctness is from the predecessor, then the error is from the successor, and vice versa exactly.
Here, for example: Some examples: It has been established with certainty that Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, used to forbid Mut'ah of Hajj (Tamattu'), bearing in mind that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, performed Tamattu' and ordered Tamattu', and became angry at those who did not respond to his command.
I say: He did and ordered, looking in this expression at the fact that Tamattu' is of two types: Tamattu' known in Fiqh books as: Qiran, and Tamattu' known in them as Tamattu', but Qiran itself contains Tamattu' (enjoyment) as well. Therefore, it was a way to reconcile some Hadiths, some of which say the Messenger performed Qiran and some say: performed Tamattu'. Since Tamattu' existing in the minds of many people, ancient and modern, is that which occurs between Hajj and Umrah, separating by decomposition (Tahallul) - so he performs Umrah and decomposes, then performs Hajj. This is the Tamattu' known in Fiqh books. So when they hear from the Hadith of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, in the Two Sahihs: That the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, performed Tamattu', and likewise Imran bin Husain says: 'The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, performed Tamattu' and we performed Tamattu', then a man said with his opinion what he wished.' Let this matter not be confusing, nor let the Hadith of the Messenger's Qiran conflict with the Hadith of his Tamattu', peace be upon him; because every Qiran is Tamattu', and not every Tamattu' is Qiran. What is the aspect of enjoyment (Tamattu') for the Qarin? That is that he enjoys the virtue of Umrah without tightening a saddle for it... a journey. So this is enjoyment. But the complete enjoyment is to separate between Umrah and Hajj.
The point: That Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, forbade people from performing Tamattu' after the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, even though the Messenger, peace be upon him, actually performed Tamattu' - and you knew that I mean by Tamattu' the Qiran - and ordered Tamattu' when he ordered his companions after they performed Tawaf of Arrival, and stood on Marwa

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
addressing them, he ordered them to decompose, and to make it an Umrah. So a sayer said, who is Ibn Ju'sham, what is his name?

Intervention: Malik bin Ju'sham.

The Sheikh: The important thing, I don't think Malik. The important thing is one of the Companions said: O Messenger of Allah! Is this Umrah of ours for this year of ours or for eternity? He said: 'Rather for eternity of eternity, Umrah has entered into Hajj until the Day of Resurrection,' and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, interlaced his fingers. Despite that, when he ordered them, peace be upon him, to decompose and make it an Umrah, some of them hesitated, and did not hasten to execute his command, peace be upon him. So he became angry, peace be upon him, and entered upon some of his wives angry, and she was the lady Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her. She said: Who angered you, O Messenger of Allah?!

Intervention: Umm Salama, O Sheikh.

The Sheikh: Yes.

Intervention: Umm Salama.

The Sheikh: No, I don't think Umm Salama has a relation to the Umrah of Hudaybiyyah. As for here in the Farewell Pilgrimage, the story is with Aisha. Then the Messenger, peace be upon him, returned to say to them: 'O people! Decompose (make Halal), for were it not that I drove the sacrificial animal (Hady), I would have decomposed with you.' Why did his companions, peace be upon him, hesitate in the Farewell Pilgrimage? Because they saw him ordering them with something while he was not doing it. So they thought that this command was not a command of obligation and necessity, but rather a command of choice, evidenced by - so it arose in their minds - that he is still in Ihram. So the Messenger, peace be upon him, clarified the reason to them, and if the reason appears, wonder ceases. So when he said to them, peace be upon him: 'Decompose, O people, for were it not that I drove the sacrificial animal, I would have decomposed with you,' Jabir said - and he is the narrator of the story of the Prophet's Hajj, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, may Allah be pleased with him and his father - he said: So the people decomposed, and the incense burners smoked, and they approached women.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
Despite all these things, Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, used to forbid people from performing Tamattu'. Among the wonders that make a Muslim keen on adhering to the Sunnah, and not adhering to the opinions of men; because which man is more knowledgeable (Faqih) than Umar bin Al-Khattab? Despite that, he fell into such opposition, where he said justifying the prohibition of enjoying Umrah until Hajj (Tamattu'), he said: One of them decomposes and goes to Mina while his organ is dripping [seminal] fluid. The exact same thing which some of those who held back from rushing to respond to the Prophet's saying denied when he said to them what he said; Umar returned to that. So glory be to my Lord, He did not make anyone infallible in legislation except the Prophets and Messengers. Therefore, infallibility, as he said peace be upon him, is holding fast to the Sunnah. This is one known about Umar bin Al-Khattab. The reality is that he finds supporters even to this time. Despite contradicting very, very many Hadiths, you find some people saying: Ifrad (Singular Hajj) is better. With the Prophet's command to decompose and his anger at those who refrained from decomposing and similar emphasized sayings. And we mentioned just now his saying: 'Umrah has entered into Hajj until the Day of Resurrection.' Many people still hold onto the saying of the permissibility of Singular Hajj (Hajj Mufrad), and find a basis for themselves. But this basis is flimsy when we return to the likes of his saying, peace be upon him: 'I left among you two matters, you will never go astray as long as you hold fast to them: The Book of Allah and my Sunnah...' to the end of the Hadith.
And another thing whose bitterness Muslims tasted in this time, while before that all Muslims were upon it, which is that Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, made divorce by the word 'three' count as three. If a man said to his wife: 'You are divorced thrice,' she became irrevocably separated from him (Baynuna Kubra) according to what Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, enacted in his time. So she is not lawful for him afterwards until she marries a husband other than him. This ruling proceeded in the four schools of thought until less than half a century of...

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: time ago. When complaints began to multiply before Islamic judges regarding the frequent occurrence of separation which has no solution except after she marries another husband, they looked and found this problem existing. So they found no solution for it except by returning, I do not say to the Sunnah, but rather by returning to the one who was holding fast to the Sunnah. And the difference for us is very substantial, because those who solved the problem of the frequency of divorce among Muslims in this era resorted to opinions, some valid and some not, not on the claim of following the most correct, but following what suits the time. What suits the time today, that divorce by the utterance of three is one, is more correct than saying as they used to say before that it is three. Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, exercised Ijtihad in this issue as he did in the first issue. But I differentiate between his Ijtihad here and his Ijtihad in the first issue. The first issue I find no face (justification) for it. The other issue I find a face for it from the perspective of observing the change of rulings with the change of time. That is among what is clear in the Hadith that says that Umar made divorce by the utterance of three count as three, that he drew attention to why he did that? The answer: To discipline those who overuse divorce and multiply it, and oppose the Sharia in the manner of pronouncing it. The Sharia says in the Noble Quran: {Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment.} [Al-Baqarah: 229], {And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him.} [Al-Baqarah: 230]. The meaning of the noble verse: Legal divorce is two times. Each time holding in kindness or releasing with goodness. Divorce is two times means: once, once. Not 'two times' [at once]. No. Divorce is two times, time after time. In each time either holding and taking back, or releasing with goodness. So he who says to his wife: 'You are divorced thrice,' has combined what Allah separated, and tightened what Allah made easy. Our Lord said each time holding in kindness or releasing with goodness. He

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: did not give himself latitude. He said to her: Go, you are divorced thrice. And some fools say: Whenever a Sheikh returns you, you are forbidden to me. From these exaggerations and nonsense. The Wise Lawgiver is of utmost wisdom. Divorce is two times, in each time holding in kindness or releasing with goodness. So if he divorces her once then reconsiders and takes her back, this is one divorce. If he divorces her a second time and reconsiders also and takes her back and holds her, this is the second. But if the third occurs, she slips from his hand, and might be the share of another. So she is not lawful to him afterwards until she marries a husband other than him. When people opposed the Law of Allah, or began opposing the Law of Allah in the time of Umar, he said: I see people have hastened a matter in which they had respite/patience (Anah), so I see that I should make it three against them. Then it appeared to him [good] so he enforced it as three. This is clear evidence that he did that as Ijtihad. And this Ijtihad is a temporal ruling suitable for the situation wherein those people were hastening the execution of divorce at once, while our Lord made it three. But with great regret, this Umari Sunnah, which observed a temporal interest, became a continuous Sunnah until a near time. While the Hadith of Ibn Abbas in Sahih Muslim is explicit to the contrary: Divorce in the time of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and in the time of Abu Bakr and the caliphate of Umar in the beginning, and a part of the beginning of Umar's caliphate, was considered one divorce. Then it appeared to Umar [to change it] as we mentioned just now. So: We can say: The Sunnah of the Messenger, the Sunnah of Abu Bakr, and the Sunnah of Umar in the beginning of his caliphate are all agreed that the triple divorce in one utterance is one divorce. But Umar exercised Ijtihad and saw fit to invalidate that habit by making it three against them as a punishment for them. It was incumbent upon the scholars who came after him to return to the Sunnah, the Sunnah of the Messenger and Abu Bakr and Umar in the beginning of his caliphate. But for a wisdom Allah wants, this ruling continued until about a quarter of a century ago roughly. So some Islamic judges who did not have the idea of acting upon the Book and Sunnah, but rather wanted to address people's issues and problems, began... They found that Ibn

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Taymiyyah, may Allah have mercy on him, used to issue fatwas, and his books are still very clear, that this divorce is a single divorce. They said: We solve the problem by relying on Ibn Taymiyyah's fatwa. While the duty upon them was to return to the Sunnah. So then: Umar bin Al-Khattab, who is one of the Rightly Guided Caliphs, held this opinion. So the Messenger does not mean: 'So stick to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs' meaning: one of them. But rather the collective of them, similar to what we mentioned regarding His saying, Exalted is He: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115], meaning: follows the way of other than all believers. Otherwise the matter would be a problem; if someone opposed a Muslim, it would mean he opposed Allah and His Messenger. Likewise the Hadith: 'Stick to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs - all of them, collectively - bite onto it with molars, and beware of newly invented matters...' to the end of the Hadith. This is my answer regarding these two Hadiths. (Al-Huda wan-Nur / 288/ 32: 00: 00)

truth.' So if you present in your mind this legal fact that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, does not speak from himself, he speaks from his Lord. text:
Regarding the Hadith of the Victorious Sect (Al-Ta'ifah Al-Mansurah)

Intervention: The Messenger, peace be upon him, said: 'A group of my Ummah will not cease to be upon the truth... dominant over others,' and in a wording: 'conquering others.' If one of these said: We are not dominant over others, nor are we conquering others, nor are we established over others, yet the Messenger says until the Hour is established.

The Sheikh: The issue, may Allah bless you, is relative. The narration Sheikh Ali mentioned here is completely embodied: 'they fight.' We are not fighting actually. This does not need discussion at all. But that does not mean that they are not upon the truth, except from this aspect, except from this aspect. And if we stand now to look at the fact that they are not upon the truth from this aspect, we must contemplate: Does the Victorious Sect, which is upon the truth until the Hour is established, in a circumstance like this circumstance, become fighting, meaning: actually bearing arms, and fighting enemies whether they are inside or outside, can this be achieved overnight? Of course the answer according to all rational people will be no. So: If the matter is so, we imagine that this sect either notices its shortcoming from this aspect, or acknowledges that it is not falling short; because it is taking the means that can lead it to realizing this description in it. Then if it is so, does it exit from being the Victorious Sect? Meaning: Either it takes the means to become fighting, or it does not take them. If it takes them, there is no blame on it at all; because as we said just now, it is walking in

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani on Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
this path. And if it does not take them, it is undoubtedly falling short from this angle, right?

Intervention: Yes.

The Sheikh: So now the Muslims, as you know and witness, if we believe that this path which we walk in, in terms of firstly what we call in two words 'Purification then Education' (Tasfiyah thumma Tarbiyah), can this description be realized in the Victorious Sect without this path? Either we say it can, yet we do not do it, so we are not the Victorious Sect. Or we say: It is not possible except to start from here. Then it is very clear that we are not tasked now, considering that we are the Victorious Sect, to bear arms while we do not know how to use arms, nay we do not know how to manufacture arms, nay we do not know where to get arms from. No one says: That we must remain on this. As long as the preliminaries that should lead us to this final stage, which is the ideal attribute for the Victorious Sect, as long as we cannot reach it intentionally [immediately], but rather according to the way of Allah's Sunnah in His creation, then it does not harm us then that this attribute, the attribute of Muslims fighting those who oppose them, is not manifest now. If we leave this side after this clarification, we say 'Standing' (Qaimah): Here 'Standing' can now be interpreted as [standing] with Proof (Hujjah). And we do not doubt that this, praise be to Allah, is standing, especially in the present era, that people have begun to return and come back to their senses, to the call of truth, the call of the Book and Sunnah, after they were previously turning away from it in aversion. So I believe that the Hadith of the Victorious Sect has no problem in it, and that the description mentioned in it applies to Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama'ah truly, except the attribute of fighting.

Hadith, he said to them: 'And this is Mu'adh bin Jabal saying: They are in Al-Sham (The Levant).' This is an authentic narration. This is raised but its chain is weak. This and that, meaning: this weak narration and that authentic stopped narration, do not negate that the Victorious Sect could be in some Islamic lands, and not confined to Al-Sham. text:
Who is the Victorious Dominant Sect?

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: 'A group of my Ummah will not cease to be dominant upon the truth until the Hour is established.'

I say: The Imam titled for it with what we mentioned, then he cited quotes from a number of Imams stating that the Victorious Sect are the People of Hadith (Ashab al-Hadith). Then he said: Some people might find strange the interpretation of these Imams for the Dominant Sect and the Saved Sect as being Ahlul-Hadith. There is no strangeness in that if we remember the following:

First: That Ahlul-Hadith, by virtue of their specialization in studying the Sunnah and what relates [to it] of knowing the biographies of narrators and the defects (Ilal) of Hadith and its paths, are the most knowledgeable people entirely of the Sunnah of their Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, his guidance, his character, his battles, and what is connected to him, peace and blessings be upon him and his family.

Second: That the Ummah has divided into sects and schools of thought (Madhahib) that did not exist in the first century. Each school has its principles and branches, and its Hadiths which it uses as evidence and relies upon. And that the adherent to one of them is fanatical for it and holds onto everything in it, without paying attention to other schools. And looks, perhaps he finds in them Hadiths which he does not find in his school which he imitated. For it is established among the people of knowledge that in every school there are Sunnah and Hadiths not found in the other school. So the adherent to a single school goes astray inevitably from a great portion of

text:
the Sunnah preserved within other schools. Ahlul-Hadith are not like this, for they take every Hadith whose chain is authentic. In whatever school it is, and from whatever sect its narrator was, as long as he is a trustworthy Muslim. Even if he was a Shiite, or Qadari, or Khariji, let alone being Hanafi or Maliki or other than that. Imam Al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him, explicitly stated this when he addressed Imam Ahmad saying: 'You are more knowledgeable about Hadith than me. So if a Hadith comes to you authentic, inform me of it so I can go to it, whether it is Hijazi, Kufi, or Egyptian.' So Ahlul-Hadith - may Allah gather us with them - are not fanatical for the saying of a specific person no matter how high and elevated he is, except Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. Contrary to others who do not belong to Hadith and acting upon it, for they are fanatical for the sayings of their Imams - and they forbade them from that - just as Ahlul-Hadith are fanatical for the sayings of their Prophet!! So no wonder after this explanation that Ahlul-Hadith are the Dominant Sect and the Saved Sect, rather the Middle Nation, witnesses over creation.
I admire in this regard the saying of Al-Khatib Al-Baghdadi in the introduction of his book 'Sharaf Ashab Al-Hadith' (The Honor of the People of Hadith) in support of them and refuting those who opposed them: 'If the person of blameworthy opinion busied himself with beneficial sciences, and sought the Sunan of the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds, and followed the traces of the Jurists and Muhaddithin, he would find in that what suffices him from other than it. And he would suffice with the tradition (Athar) over his opinion which he sees. Because Hadith includes knowledge of the principles of Tawhid, and the clarification of what came regarding the aspects of promise and threat, and the Attributes of the Lord of the Worlds - Exalted above the sayings of the atheists - and informing about the description of Paradise and Hell, and what Allah prepared in them for the pious and the wicked, and what Allah created in the earths and heavens and the types of wonders and great signs, and the mention of the Close Angels, and the description of those arranging [in ranks] and exalting. And in

Whoever plots against them Allah breaks him, and whoever opposes them Allah forsakes him. He who abandons them does not harm them, nor succeeds he who separates from them. What is meant by adhering to the Jama'ah (Community)

Intervention: The brother questioner asks: He says: There are several Prophetic Hadiths containing the command to adhere to the Jama'ah. What is the understanding of these Hadiths in light of reality?

The Sheikh: The answer is with the well-known Hadith in the Sunan, which is his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: 'The Jews split into seventy-one sects, and the Christians split into seventy-two sects, and my Ummah will split into seventy-three sects, all of them in the Fire except one. They said: Who is it, O Messenger of Allah? He said: It is the Jama'ah.' This is the answer. But this answer raises a question, so the answer must be detailed. If we understand the Jama'ah intended by this Hadith is the answer to the question posed just now. The interpretation of this answer, which is the Jama'ah, came in another narration, which is his saying, peace be upon him: 'It is that which is upon what I and my companions are upon.' So then look, O lost Muslim in the midst of these groups existing today among Muslims in every country, let alone the entire Islamic world. Look, whoever is upon the Book and the authentic Sunnah in creed and action, worship and behavior, then you must be with this group, no other at all. And this is among the meanings of His saying, Exalted is He, in the Noble Quran: {Be with the truthful} [At-Tawbah: 119]. It is not permissible for any Muslim youth to be partisan or form a block or pledge allegiance to a group among these groups existing on the face of the earth; because Allegiance (Bay'ah) in Islam is only for a man who is the only one pledged allegiance to, and he is the only one who manages the affairs of Islam and Muslims and rules them by the Book of Allah and the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. And with great regret, this person does not exist today, therefore there is no

publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
existence of a person to pledge allegiance to today; because Allegiance is only to the Caliph of the Muslims. But {Be with the truthful} [At-Tawbah: 119]. Here is a group, and here is a group, and here is a group, in this country, in the neighboring country, in the town far from you. Groups you consider upon the Book and Sunnah, and their deeds upon the Book and Sunnah, and their morals likewise. Then you must be with them; because they are the Jama'ah and they are the ones intended finally by his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, in the authentic, rather Mutawatir Hadith from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: 'A group of my Ummah will not cease to be dominant upon the truth, unharmed by those who oppose them until the Hour is established' or 'until the command of Allah comes.'
So you must stick to the group (Jama'ah) which is upon the Book and Sunnah, and beware of deviating from it as came in the authentic Hadith: 'For the wolf eats from the sheep that strays.' It is not fitting for a Muslim youth to be heedless, afflicted by living with a group for a long time then not increasing in knowledge, nor increasing in Fiqh, nor increasing in worship nor good behavior. This means he lives in manifest loss.
Therefore, a Muslim must choose whoever authenticated this meaning you heard in the Hadith of the Saved Sect, to be with the Jama'ah in the concept explained in the other narration which is upon what the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and his companions were upon. It is not hidden from any human that this group cannot be so except with knowledge, and knowledge is the Book and Sunnah. So whoever has no knowledge of the Sunnah has no knowledge of the Book; because the Quran and Sunnah are two matters that must not be separated as came in the authentic Hadith: 'I left among you two matters, you will never go astray as long as you hold fast to them: The Book of Allah and my Sunnah, and they will not separate until they return to me at the Basin.'
(Al-Huda wan-Nur / 358/ 44: 00: 00)

text:
Clarifying the Salafi Methodology (Understanding of the Salaf  the Victorious Group  the Saved Sect)
Shaykh: Indeed, all praise is for Allah. We praise Him, seek His help, and seek His forgiveness. We seek refuge in Allah from the evils within ourselves and from our bad deeds. Whoever Allah guides, none can misguide; and whoever He allows to go astray, none can guide. I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger.

O you who believe! Fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims. [l Imrn: 102]

O mankind! Fear your Lord who created you from a single soul, and created from it its spouse, and spread from the two of them many men and women. And fear Allah through whom you ask one another, and (honor) the ties of kinship. Indeed, Allah is ever watching over you. [An-Nis: 1]

O you who believe! Fear Allah and speak words that are upright. [Al-Ahzb: 70]

He will rectify your deeds for you and forgive your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly achieved a tremendous success. [Al-Ahzb: 71]

To proceed: The best speech is the speech of Allah, and the best guidance is the guidance of Muhammad , and the worst of matters are newly invented ones; every innovation is misguidance, and every misguidance is in the Fire.

And now: I begin my words with what has been authentically narrated from Umar ibn al-Khattb    that he said: We are a people whom Allah has honored through Islam. So whenever we seek honor through anything other than it, Allah will humiliate usor we will become humiliated.

And you know that the Islam intended by Umar ibn al-Khattb    in this noble statement is the Islam which Allah revealed to the heart of Muhammad ...

They said: 'Who is it, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: It is the Jama'ah (the Group/Community). Meaning the Jama'ah of Muhammad, may Allah bless him and his family and grant them peace, to whom the meaning of his saying, upon him be blessings and peace, in the well-known authentic Hadith is directed first and foremost: My nation will not unite upon misguidance. The first intended by this Hadith is the nation of the Companions of the Messenger, may Allah bless him and his family and grant them peace, for they are the ones who did not unite upon misguidance. As for those who came after them, among them are those who deviated from the straight line which the Messenger, upon him be peace, drew as an illustration and practical application, as is derived regarding the illustration from the Hadith narrated by Al-Hakim in Al-Mustadrak from Abdullah bin Mas'udmay Allah, the Exalted, be pleased with himthat the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family and grant them peace: drew a straight line on the ground one day, then he drew short lines around this straight line, then he, upon him be blessings and peace, recited over that straight line: {And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way.} [Al-An'am: 153]. And he, upon him be blessings and peace, said while pointing to the straight line: This is the path of Allah, and pointing to the short lines around it, he, upon him be peace, said: These are ways, and at the head of every way among them is a devil calling people to it. text:
Are the Victorious Group (At-Ta'ifah Al-Mansurah) and the Saved Sect (Al-Firqah An-Najiyah) one and the same? 
Intervention: Yesterday there were discussions with Khalid about the Saved Sect and the Strangers (Al-Ghuraba)... but I do not know if the research was followed up first regarding the Victorious Group and the Saved Sect: are they one, or is there a relationship of generality and specificity between them, or are they distinct? What is your opinion on this? 
The Sheikh: The research was not completed... rather I was insisting on our brother, this Khalid, not to mix the subject with our subject. Our subject was between the Saved Sect and the Strangers. As for the discussion about the Victorious Group, the discussion did not take place. I believe that the Victorious Group is either victorious through proof and argumentas is the nature of this Victorious Group always and foreveror it is victorious through Jihad and fighting, as is stated in some narrations as you may recall with me. So in that case, the Victorious Group itself: sometimes those within it are attached to the Saved Sect, and sometimes they are attached to the Strangers (1). (Al-Huda wan-Noor / 609/ 16: 22: 00)
foot_note: 1. (1) It appears to me that the correct phrasing is that the Saved Sect is sometimes attached to the Victorious Group if it is manifest with the sword and spear, otherwise it is attached to the Strangers if it is victorious through proof and explanation.

text:
The difference between the Victorious Group and the Saved Sect. 
[The Imam said]: As for what one of our brother preachers raised these days regarding the distinction between the Victorious Group and the Saved Sect, it is an opinion of his that I do not see as far from the truth. The transmission from the Imams of Hadith has already been presented regarding the interpretation of the Victorious Group: that they are the People of Knowledge of Hadith and the People of Athar (Traditions). By necessity, you know that not everyone from the Saved Sect is from the People of Knowledge in general, let alone from the People of Knowledge specifically. Do you not see that the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, are the ones who represent the Saved Sect, and for that reason, we were commanded to hold fast to what they were upon? Yet, despite that, they were not all scholars; rather, the majority of them were followers of their scholars. So, between the 'Group' (Ta'ifah) and the 'Sect' (Firqah), there is a clear relationship of generality and specificity. However, despite that, I do not see great benefit in debating this issue back and forth, out of concern for the Call (Da'wah) and the unity of the word. As-Sahihah (1/ 2/932).

text:
How do we understand Salafism? 
Question: Virtuous Sheikh! How do we understand the Salafi Da'wah (Call) as preachers? 
The Sheikh: Explain the question to me so I can answer. 
Intervention: I meant as preachers; because, as you know, preachers today are many, especially those who claim Salafism, and perhaps problems arise between them regarding the understanding of certain issues. So there must be a general understanding of the Salafi Da'wah as an introduction to the Da'wah. 
The Sheikh: The answer to this question was a long lecture just yesterday in Jerash, or rather north of Amman with the brother... there is a detailed tape on this, and perhaps there are also multiple tapes. So I will summarize the answer based on that, and I say: Salafi preachers must always and forever focus on defining to all peoplewhether they are preachers or those being preached tothe reality of the Islamic Salafi Da'wah, which is distinguished in its reality from all other calls that attribute themselves to Islam as a whole. All Islamic calls, old and new, adopt the Book and the Sunnah, except for those who deviated from some groups in the present era and individuals in ancient eras who used to declare that their call was based on the Book only, without the Sunnah. This, undoubtedly, we do not need to prolong speech about; because it is a matter agreed upon that whoever restricts their understanding of Islam to the Quran is not a Muslim; because the Quran itself commands Muslims to obey Allah and His Messenger, and to seek judgment

text: from Allah and His Messenger. So this point, we do not need to delve into, especially since those who belong today to this methodology that opposes the Book and the Sunnahand they are those called the Quraniststheir misguidance is clear. However, all other groups that meet with us in being within the circle of Islam, and adopt the Book and the Sunnah with us, it is obligatory upon Salafi preachers specifically to clarify to these people that the Salafi Da'wah is distinguished from all other calls in that it understands the Book and the Sunnah according to what the Pious Predecessors (Salaf Salih) were upon, from the Companions, the Successors (Tabi'in), and those who followed them. As came in the Mutawatir Hadith from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, who said: The best of people are my generation, then those who follow them, then those who follow them. So we add to the Book and the Sunnah the methodology of the Pious Predecessors. This addition is not an innovation as many people might imagine, but rather it is textually stipulated in the Book and the Sunnah. As for the Book, it is His saying, the Most High: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115]. And as for the Sunnah, there are two famous Hadiths. One of them is the Hadith of the Saved Sect, which is well-known and there is no need to recite it verbatim, but we cite the witness from it, which is his saying, peace be upon him, when he was asked about the Saved Sect, so he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, answered by saying: It is that which I and my companions are upon. And the other Hadith is the Hadith of the Rightly Guided Caliphs, which is his saying, peace be upon him, in the Hadith of Irbadh bin Sariyah: So hold fast to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Mahdi Caliphs after me... to the end of it. So in this Hadith is the clarification of the 'way of the believers' which was mentioned in the previous verse: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115].

text: Therefore: Preachers must focus on this distinguishing addition of the Call of Truth, which manifests the Saved Sect over the other sects, which is that they must be upon what the Pious Predecessors were upon. But this requires something I did not mention yesterday, and it is mentioned in many recordings: that applying this rule to the methodology of the Pious Predecessors requires Salafi preachers to be concerned with knowing the Salafi Athar (narrations/traditions) just as they are concerned with knowing the Prophetic Hadiths; because knowing these Athar is what achieves for them the practical and correct application of this methodology. And these Athar, just as is the case with Hadiths, contain the authentic and the weak; likewise, the Athar contain the authentic and the weak. Therefore, here one must pay attention to what I will say. Many of the books of scholars, like Fath al-Bari by Al-Hafiz Ibn Hajar Al-Asqalani and those who came after him, when they use some Athar as evidence, they do not scrutinize their chains of narration (Isnads). Here lies a very clear error; because if we want to say that such-and-such Companion or such-and-such female Companion used to say such-and-such or do such-and-such, and we consider that as a clarification of a verse in the Book of Allah or a Hadith in the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, then the meaning of that is we must be certain of the authenticity of that Athar or those Athar. This is what the Muslim Salafi preacher should be knowledgeable about first, and base his call and clarification of what he is upon secondly. Then, the Salafi Da'wah is distinguished not just by mere calling, but practically, that it seeks to understand Islam correctly from all its aspects, not from some aspects that some groups concern themselves with to the exclusion of other aspects, calling the former matters 'priorities'. And the matter in this division of Islam or knowledge of Islam might lead them to make it into two parts: a kernel (Lub) and a shell (Qishr). So they concern themselves, in their claimwhile the reality is that they

text: do not even concern themselves with this part they called the kernelthey concern themselves with it without concerning themselves with the other part. And I draw attention to a scientific truth: if the Muslim is clear about it, it becomes evident that there is absolutely no room for a scholar researching the Book and the Sunnah to divide Islam into kernel and shell. This, if it were possible, would only be possible for someone who encompassed Islam in knowledge, and this is almost impossible; because Allah Almighty says: {And they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills} [Al-Baqarah: 255]. Therefore, the duty of the Muslim preacher is to convey Islam to people as a whole within the limits of his knowledge, and not to claim the division mentioned earlier: kernel and shells; because Islam is all good and blessing. And if this division were accepted, we would say that the shell is necessary to preserve the kernel, as is the case and matter we see in our daily lives, where we eat many fruits and produce, and for them to be good for us, we must preserve them with their peels/shells. This is by way of example and approximation. But in reality, we do not accept this naming, to say that Islam is kernel and shell. However, we say there are things that must be known first, then must be acted upon second. And there are other things that must be known as knowledge by a group of people who are the People of Knowledge, and this is what is called by scholars 'Fard Kifa'i' (Communal Obligation). Then, from the practical side as well, its performance is obligatory upon a group without being obligatory upon every individual Muslim. Then, from what came in the Sunnahand with this I conclude the answer to this questionis that what is not obligatory may be an aid to one who may have fallen short in an obligatory duty. I mean by that the well-known Hadith from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, that he said: The first thing for which the servant is held accountable on the Day of Resurrection is the prayer. If it is complete, he has succeeded and prospered. And if it is deficient, he has failed and lost. And it came in another Hadith: If it is deficient, Allah Almighty says to His angels: Look, does My servant have any voluntary deeds (Tatawwu'), so complete for him his obligatory duty with it.

text: Therefore: The voluntary act which is not obligatory, a Muslim should not be negligent of it under the claim that it is not obligatory; because this claim would only be accepted if we accepted for the sake of argument that the Muslim, when he performs what is obligatory upon him, performs it in the most perfect manner, and not in the deficient manner which the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, pointed to in the Hadith known among scholars as the Hadith of 'The One Who Prayed Badly' (Al-Musie' Salatahu). Wherein the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was sitting with his companions in the mosque when a man entered and prayed, then came to the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and said: Peace be upon you, O Messenger of Allah! So he, peace be upon him, said: And upon you be peace, go back and pray, for you have not prayed. And so on, briefly, three times he repeats the prayer, and each time the Messenger, peace be upon him, says: Go back and pray, for you have not prayed. Finally, when the man realized he did not know how to pray better, he said: By Allah, O Messenger of Allah! I do not know how to do better than this, so teach me. So he, peace be upon him, said to him: When you stand for prayer, perform ablution as Allah commanded you, then call the Adhan, then the Iqamah, then face the Qiblah, then say Takbir... to the end of the Hadith. So, I wonder, are the general worshippers today certain and reassured within themselves that they pray a complete prayer such that they will not need, on the day deeds are weighed in the Scale of Justice, that they will not find deficiency in their prayers? We, as we witness in the mosques and outside the mosques, most people pray yet do not pray. Therefore, it appears to you very strongly the necessity of caring for the Sunan (plural of Sunnah/voluntary acts); because they are like a reserve for the spiritual life of faith, just as in the material human life here; as these Sunan are a cause to complete the deficiency that may occur in the obligatory duty. This deficiency is of two types: a deficiency in quantity and a deficiency in quality. Meaning: a man might miss three prayers without a legal excuse, so he is not only sinful but has also lost a great reward. This is the first deficiency, the deficiency of quantity. And the other deficiency is in quality, which the Hadith of 'The One Who Prayed Badly' guided you to; for he prays but falls short in its pillars, let alone its form.

text: So this Hadith comes, which is his saying, peace be upon him, in what he narrated from his Lord, Blessed and Most High, that He says to His angels: Look, does My servant have any voluntary deeds, so complete for him his obligatory duty with it. Meaning: whether it was a deficiency in quantity or a deficiency in quality. Therefore: Islam must be understood and learned from all its aspects without differentiation as we said earlier in our expression: what is obligatory or voluntary, and in their expression: kernel or shell. Then after that, people must rise to perform what they can of the first section, which is the individual obligations. I say this because many people today among those who share with us in the Call to the Book and the Sunnah, then separate from us by not caring for the Salafi Athar and the Salafi Methodologymany of these people concern themselves with the call for when the Muslim State is established. And this establishment is an obligatory matter, there is no doubt, about which no two differ. But what is the way to establish the Muslim State and achieve ruling by Islam, Book and Sunnah? Is it through ignorance of Islam, or is it through understanding it completely and then calling to act upon it as the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, began; where he began by teaching people Tawhid (Monotheism), the correct Creed? Then after that, as you knowand this does not need prolongationthe legal rulings began to follow successively through prayer, through fasting. The last thing to be obligated, as you know, was Hajj to the Sacred House of Allah, then the other rulings of prohibitions, forbidden things, legal punishments (Hudud), and the like. Therefore: The Da'wah must be as a whole, and the application is according to ability, and the preparation for establishing the Muslim State is by acting upon what we have learned of our true religion. This is what is available to me to answer this question. (Al-Huda wan-Noor / 620/ 42: 00: 00)

text:
Reconciling between the Hadith My Ummah is like the rain and the Hadith The best of people are my generation. 
Intervention: How do we reconcile between the Hadith My Ummah is like the rain and the Hadith The best of people are my generation? 
The Sheikh: Where is the contradiction so that we say 'reconcile', O my brother? The likeness of my Ummah is like the rain, it is not known [where] the good isthe 'Good' here is a noun, not a superlative noun (Ism Tafdil). As for there: The best (Khayr) of people, meaning: The 'best' (Akhyar) of people. There is no disparity between the two matters. This is from one angle. And before I move to another angle, is this answer clear or is there ambiguity? 
Intervention: Clear, clear. 
The Sheikh: As long as the answer is clear, then I have... 
Intervention: ... An-Nawawi said: Because the Companions are the best of the Ummah. 
The Sheikh: And I say with him that the Companions are the best of the Ummah, but where is the contradiction between: The best of people are my generation and: The likeness of my Ummah is like the rain, it is not known [where] the good is? Here "Good" is not a superlative noun. Clear? 
Intervention: Clear. 
The Sheikh: Good, this is firstly.

text: And secondly: There, one era is preferred over another. The Hadith: The best of people prefers one era over another. So where is the contradiction? There is no contradiction in any way whatsoever. Please go ahead. (Al-Huda wan-Noor / 622/ 08: 43: 00)

text:
Advice from the Sheikh to a Christian man who embraced Islam to care for knowing the purified Islam. 
[The Sheikh said directing advice to a Christian man who embraced Islam recently]: I want to say regarding the brother, we told him he has his reward twice. This is what our Prophet, peace be upon him, declared in the authentic Hadith narrated by Imam Al-Bukhari in his Sahih: Three are given their reward twice... and he mentioned among them: And a man from the Christians who believed in me and submitted (became Muslim), so he has his reward twice. This means that he was a believer before in the Sharia of Jesus, peace be upon him, then when the truth became clear to him that what Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, brought is the truth as well, he believed in him, so his reward is written for him twice. It is not the case for one who was from the Christians as an atheist, neither Christian nor Muslim, then became Muslim; this one has his reward once. But the one who was actually a Christian, despite the deviation in it, and is a believer, he has his reward twice. I say 'despite the deviation in the Christians'; because the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, when he spoke this Hadith and said: He has his reward twice, he meant the Christians who were in his time, peace and blessings be upon him. And the Christians about whom Allah Almighty said in the clear Quran: {They have certainly disbelieved who say, "Allah is the third of three."} [Al-Ma'idah: 73]. And these are the ones whose slaughtered meat was made permissible for us. Therefore, a Muslim should not doubt and question about these Christians saying: 'They say the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit are one God.' We say: They were likewise in the era of the Prophet, peace be upon him, and they are the ones meant by the Lord of Mankind in the previous verse: {They have certainly disbelieved who say, "Allah is the third of

Therefore: Any man from the People of the Book who submits (becomes Muslim) and believes in Allah and His Messenger has his reward twice: once for his previous faith with all its flaws and faults, and another time for his subsequent faith which is all truth with no falsehood in it. So we ask Allah first for steadfastness for you, then uprightness on the truth. And this obligates youand the Religion is sincere adviceto be keen on learning the correct Islam. And I say with regret: 'the correct Islam'; because what befell those before them has befallen the Muslims. What befell the Jews and Christians of division in religion has befallen the Muslims. And this is the confirmation of the saying of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: You will surely follow the ways of those before you, handspan by handspan and cubit by cubit, until even if they entered a lizard's hole, you would enter it. They said: The Jews and Christians, O Messenger of Allah?! He said: Who else?! Meaning: They are the ones who have the power and the state on that day. So this news has come true in most Muslims today: 'You will surely follow the ways of those before you handspan by handspan' to the end of it. So the Muslims have divided. Therefore, since Allah Almighty has blessed you with the Greatest Guidance, which is the first onethat Allah Almighty saved you from polytheistic idolatrous Christianity to Islam, which first commands people to worship Allah alone with no partner, then commands all Muslims to believe in all the laws that were before Islam. Not like the Jews who believe only in the Torah, and not like the Christians who believe only in the Torah and the Gospel despite the distortion, change, and alteration in them. Muslims are commanded religiously to believe in everything Allah sent down before, and in every Prophet or Messenger sent before. So as long as our Lord Almighty guided you to this Islam which contains the creed of Tawhid first, then bearing witness to the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, that he is truly a Messenger and Prophet, then you have nothing left but to continue the path and know what the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, brought regarding matters in which people differed. So that you know there are schools of Hanafis, Shafi'is, Malikis,
