Why did Our Lord Almighty repeat the verb regarding obedience to the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and did not repeat the verb in the obedience to those in authority? So He said: {Obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you}. He did not say 'Obey Allah and the Messenger', He said: {Obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you}. He did not repeat the command for obedience a third time, so He did not say 'and obey Allah and obey the Messenger and obey those in authority among you', no. The subtle point is that obedience to the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, considering that it is revelation from the heavens, does not accept error. So whoever obeys the Messenger has certainly obeyed Allah. Therefore He said: {Obey Allah and obey the Messenger}. As for those in authority, their obedience is due to their obedience to the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. If they obey the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, it becomes obligatory upon us to obey them. And if they do not obey the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, it is not obligatory upon us to obey them. And there is a very famous Hadith: There is no obedience to a creature in disobedience to the Creator. It has an occasion: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, sent a reconnaissance party (Sariyah)meaning a small armyone day, and appointed a commander over them, and commanded the subordinates to obey this commander. So the commander wanted to test the members of his army: do they obey him or not? So he commanded them to bring firewood which they gathered from the desert. So he commanded them to gather firewood and they gathered it. Then he said to them: Gather around it, so they gathered. Then he said to them: Light the fire, so they lit it. Then he said to them: Throw yourselves into it. So they paused, and looked at one another. They said: By Allah, we did not believe in the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, except to flee from the fire; shall we throw ourselves into the fire? He said: By Allah, we will not do so until we ask the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. So they asked the Messenger, peace be upon him, and told him the story. [He said]: By the One in whose Hand is the soul of Muhammad! Had you thrown yourselves into it, you would not have come out of it until the Hour is established. There is no obedience to a creature in disobedience to the Creator. The witness, therefore: Obedience to parents is like obedience to those in authority. These are obeyed in obedience

Regarding the specification of the number in the Hadith of the Sects. 
Intervention: Virtuous Sheikh, does the Hadith that came mentioning the number of sects, the famous Hadith which contains: that the Ummah will split into seventy-three sects, did this Hadith come to limit the sects [literally], or did it come as a statement of multitude and for what will happen of division and fragmentation among Muslims at the end of time? 
The Sheikh: I believe firstly that this question does not imply a great matter beneath it; because whether it is for multitude as came in the question or for threat, this is a matter of the Unseen (Ghayb). And the duty of the Muslim is to believe in the matters of the Unseen without expanding on them. Let us assume we were in the era of the Companions, were there seventy-three sects? No. Go down to the Successors, no. To their followers, no. Therefore: What would be the position of the Muslim on that day? Would he ask such a question, saying: Is this number for multitude or for threat? What do you think his position would be? 
Intervention: I think that since he sees that this matter is verified in the era of the Companions... the evidences that appear are contrary to that, that this matter happens at the [time of] strangeness of Islam? 
The Sheikh: It is this, but this is not the answer to the question, may Allah bless you. On that day if he asks, would he ask: Is this for multitude, meaning: it does not imply limitation? Or is the origin in numbers limitation, and it does not imply multitude in the sense: that it is possible to be more than that, but it is not possible to be less than that unless it is proven practically and actuallyand this is what I meanno

text: Advice to Muslims - Our Sheikh, to complete the good words you have graciously spoken, what do you advise the Muslim who loves to preserve the religion and faith he is upon? Meaning, there must be advice; the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, advised his Companions. So if you would honor us with advice to guide us in the time we live in, of tribulations (fitan), trials, slips, and the like, and may Allah bless you. The Sheikh: In any case, if you recall a Hadith, remind us of it, and may Allah reward you with good. Otherwise, what I mentioned just now from the Verse and the Hadith of Abu Bakr is sufficient, Allah willing, as an answer to what you asked, with another addition, which is what we always and forever dwell upon: That the Muslim continues in seeking beneficial knowledge coupled with righteous deeds, and that he remembers the wisdom that was reported in some Hadithseven if they are weak Hadiths in terms of their chain of narration, yet in terms of their meaning, they contain profound wisdomamong them is: 'Blessed is he whose own fault occupies him from the faults of people.' Because I see, truly, that many of our brothers, students of knowledge, concern themselves with others more than they concern themselves with their own selves. Therefore, I mention this wisdom, and I do not say this Hadith: 'Blessed is he whose own fault occupies him from the faults of people.' And I do not mean, naturally, that his preoccupation with his own fault and his holding himself to account should also occupy him from directing his advice to his brothers, no. But I do not want the Muslim student of knowledge to reverse the matter, becoming occupied with guiding people and instructing them, then forgetting himself { ... Upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided ... } [Al-Ma'idah: 105]. With that, I return the ball to you; perhaps there is a Hadith in your mind about this, so remind us of it, and may Allah reward you with good.

So if some people are concerned with the call to Tawheed, and this is their duty, that does not mean that they do not call to every aspect of the aspects of Islam. But this means that the caller must be upon knowledge of all... or at least of most of the chapters of Sharia. And those arising today who belong to what are called 'Callers' (Du'at), then differ in the path that should be taken in the Call, and as you heard in the questionalthough this question is not very clear; because there is not much difference between one plan and anotherbut what must be is that all the calls that we hear the voice of in all Islamic lands must be upon a common word, which is: That we call to Allah based on the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and upon the methodology of the Righteous Predecessors, while urging people to be keen on action more than... on speech. And all of this, the detailed discussion on it has preceded, so we suffice with this word. (Rihlat al-Noor 42 B/00: 01: 13)

text: Is Salafiyyah a Party? Interjection: Virtuous Sheikh! I heard from you that you do not see [the validity of] partisanship (Hizbiyyah), yet what we know is that you are among the most prominent leaders of the Salafis. So is there a difference between you and the organized Salafi groups...? The Sheikh: There is no doubt that there is no partisanship in Islam, and that Muslims must be one block, and on the heart of one man, and that it is not permissible for them to separate into groups, sects, and factions, each group among them having a head whose command they follow and whose directives they adopt. So we do not call to forming blocs, nor to partisanship, nor to gathering [in a partisan way]. Rather, we call all Muslims to the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and upon the methodology of the Righteous Predecessors... upon the methodology of the Righteous Predecessors. This is our call to all Muslims in all lands of the world. And the difference between our call and the call of otherswhether his call was originally Salafi then he became partisan and formed a bloc, or the other blocs or other groupsis that the Salafi Call gathers all Muslims and accommodates all of them, unlike any other group or party; for their party does not accommodate all the other parties and blocs. And as it was said: 'And this difference between us suffices you... And every vessel exudes what is within it.' (Rihlat al-Noor 16 B/00: 36: 48)

text: What is the Saved Sect? Interjection: Virtuous father, may Allah preserve you! What is the Saved Sect, and what are the fundamentals of the call of the Righteous Predecessors? The Sheikh: The Hadith came as an answer to this question in the books of Hadith such as Sunan At-Tirmidhi and others, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, that he said: 'The Jews split into seventy-one sects, and the Christians split into seventy-two sects, and my Ummah will split into seventy-three sects, all of them are in the Fire except one.' They said: 'Who is it, O Messenger of Allah?' He said - in a narration -: 'The Jama'ah (The Group/Community).' Meaning: The group of the Messenger, peace be upon him, i.e., the Companions. And the evidence for this is the other narration: 'He said: It is that which is upon what I and my Companions are upon.' So the Saved Sect is the one that adheres to the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and the Sunnah of his Companions, especially the Sunnah of the Righteous Caliphs, which he, peace and blessings be upon him, commanded in the Hadith of Irbad ibn Sariyah, where this noble Companion, who is from the People of the Suffah, said: 'The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, admonished us with an admonition that caused hearts to tremble and eyes to shed tears. So we said: Advise us, O Messenger of Allah. He said: I advise you to fear Allah, and to listen and obey even if an Abyssinian slave is appointed over you. And indeed, whoever among you lives long will see much difference. So upon you is my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Righteous Guided Caliphs after me; bite onto it with your molars. And beware of newly invented matters, for every newly invented matter is an innovation (Bid'ah) and every innovation is misguidance.' So in this Hadith, there is a specification of the Sunnah of the Righteous Caliphs to be followed after the Sunnah of the Prophet...

The wisdom in that is what I mentioned just now. Therefore, Imam Shafi'i argued that it is not permissible to contradict the way of the believers, and this contradiction only happens by some people being stubborn and interpreting some texts from the Book and the Sunnah without seeking help in understanding those texts from what our Righteous Predecessors were upon. Therefore, we know with certainty that the reason for the division of Muslims into seventy-three sects, one of which is the Saved Sect, is that; because it adhered to the Book and the Sunnah and upon the methodology of the Righteous Predecessors. And that is only because a part of them do not return to the Sunnah, so they reject authentic Hadiths, and a part of them interpret the Hadiths with other than what our Righteous Predecessors understood. We will not go far to strike for you some examples from the beliefs of these apparent old sects, but we strike for you an example with the deviation of some Muslims today, a very dangerous deviation that is Disbelief (Kufr) itself and Apostasy (Riddah) itself. Namely, a sect known as the Qadianis, and they call themselves Ahmadis. Those who know their history and their activity in calling to their Islam would be amazed at how they empty themselves with this activity in calling to their religion while they claim their religion is Islam. There is no doubt nor uncertainty that they testify that there is no deity but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and they pray, fast, perform Hajj, and pay Zakat, meaning: they perform the five Islamic pillars. But despite that, they are not Muslims. Why? Because they came to some Quranic verses and interpreted them according to their whims and did not interpret them according to the way of the Muslims. So they followed other than the path of the believers, so the saying of the Lord of the Worlds applied to them: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115]. These believe that Allah the Mighty and Majestic did not seal Prophethood with Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, but rather prophets will come after him. And indeed, they claimed that Allah sent a prophet to them from India from a village called Qadian, and the name of that alleged prophet is Mirza Ghulam Ahmad Al-Qadiani. So they believe that this is a prophet after our Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. So did they disbelieve in the Quran? Did they disbelieve in the Hadiths of the Messenger, peace be upon him, while they are in the Verse and the Hadiths all agreed that there is no prophet after him? No...

They did not disbelieve in his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: 'There is no prophet after me,' but they also interpreted it with other than what the Muslims received. Regarding the previous Verse, His saying Almighty: {but [he is] the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the prophets} [Al-Ahzab: 40], they said: The meaning of Seal of the prophets is: i.e., the Ornament of the prophets, like the ring (khatam) on the finger; it does not mean that no prophet comes after him. And when they addressed the authentic Hadiths: 'There is no prophet after me,' they said: The meaning of no prophet after me is: no prophet with me, and there was no prophet with him, but 'after him' means: after his death, a prophet comes, and one has indeed come. Thus: From such a modern example, it becomes clear to you that it is not sufficient for the Muslim to understand the Quran and the Hadith of the Messenger, peace be upon him, separately from the understanding of our Righteous Predecessors of the Quran and the Sunnah. From here, the profound wisdom appears in mentioning the Verse 'the way of the believers', and the Messenger mentioning the Companions and the Righteous Caliphs, so that the Muslim does not deviate in understanding some texts from the Book and the Sunnah and go far astray. He did not say: 'What I am upon' only, because the Companions are the ones who transmitted to us what the Messenger, peace be upon him, was upon and clarified it with a clarification that left no one after that to come and philosophize and interpret some texts according to their whims. So they denied the existence of this creation despite the Quran explicitly stating that in more than one verse, and the Surah mentioned just now is sufficient. Did they deny the Surah? text: The Correct Methodology in the Salafi Call Interjection: Virtuous noble father! We hope from you that you clarify to us what is the correct methodology in the Salafi Call, especially in this time when tribulations (fitan) have increased and knowledge has decreased, and what is the difference between organization...? We hope for clarification and may Allah reward you with good. The Sheikh: As for the Call (Da'wah), it is not upheld except by people of knowledge who stand for justice. As for what has spread in this time that many people who have not been given except a share of knowledge that is hardly worth mentioning name themselves 'Callers to Allah' (Du'at), this is, in my beliefand perhaps you will be surprised, but I bear the responsibility of what I sayfrom the innovations of the present era. From the innovations of the present era is that it is now rumored among people that there are thousands of Callers, yet they are not upon knowledge, neither of the Book nor of the Sunnah nor of the traditions of the Salaf, nor even of the established traditional schools of thought (Madhhabs) today. Rather, they know some simple rulings and perhaps some verses and some Hadiths that the least knowledgeable of people can deliver, then they set themselves up as Callers. So if they are asked about a certain issue, they become confused and cannot answer, or they may answer with extreme ignorance, and this is from the bane of the present era. And the matter does not stop at these emerging youth, but we may find great men who were not given that plentiful share of knowledge, yet they became famous as Callers. To what? To Islam, while they fight Islam by fighting the Sunnah, without which a Muslim cannot understand the Book of Allah except through the path of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. So how can one be a Caller to Islam who is ignorant of the Sunnah as a science, and then who fights it in some of its aspects, at least in belief? This one is not fit to...

If he is not a worker [of good] and knowledgeable, he will not be a worker of righteousness. And one who lacks a thing, as it was said of old, cannot give it. For the call to Allah Almighty, even if it is one hundred percent correct, if it is not coupled with the action of this Caller, it will not have the desired effect on the masses of people; because people care about following the example of people of knowledge and virtue in their actions more than their words. This is what relates to the path of calling to Allah. As for what is called today 'Organization' (Tanzeem), organization has two forms: There is no doubt that any work intended to be benefited from must have organization, such as lessons that may be given, for example, in some schools or in some universities; this is organization. Because if that is not done, the matter of education becomes chaos. There is no objection to this organization in the way existing today in the modern era, just as something like that existed in the past where study circles existed in all mosques that were in the lands. And I personally caught up with the largest mosque in Syria, which is known as the Umayyad Mosque, the Mosque of Banu Umayya; I caught up in it multiple circles morning and evening. This one teaches Tafsir, and that one teaches Hanafi Fiqh, and that one Shafi'i Fiqh, even though there was only one lesson a week in Prophetic Hadith, and so on. text: Are there Guardians over the Islamic Awakening? Interjection: Some claimants of knowledge from the scholars try to appoint themselves as guardians over, as you said, the Islamic Awakening. For he who lacks a thing cannot give it, as we said. So the Awakening will remain walking... very slowly until Allah, Blessed and Exalted is He, destines for it someone who takes its hand and guides it to the path that the entire Ummah must tread in fulfillment of His saying, Blessed and Exalted is He: {If you support Allah, He will support you} [Muhammad: 7]. And there is no doubt that the Muslims' support of Allah is only for His religion and acting upon His rulings. And that is not possible except by two things that we have long called all Muslims to apply, which is what I call: Purification and Education (At-Tasoiyah wat-Tarbiyah). So if there is no purified knowledge taken from the Book and the Sunnah, it will not benefit except a little. Then this knowledge, if it benefits, it only benefits if it is coupled with action. Otherwise, the knowledge will be a calamity upon its owner, as is known from the evidences of the Sharia, such as His saying Almighty: {O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do? * Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do} [As-Saff: 2-3]. So the rising of some people from those who belong to knowledge while they are not upon correct knowledge, this does not benefit anything. And we struck an example in the meeting that was held yesterday of that scholar who was chosen for a high position, just as he gave a fatwa that foreign maids are in the status of captives (Sabaya) for whom it is permissible to see women in their clothing in their homes, even though free disbelieving women...

text:
Salafiyyah: Knowledge and Action
Shaykh: Indeed, all praise is for Allah. We praise Him, seek His help, and seek His forgiveness. We seek refuge in Allah from the evils within ourselves and from our bad deeds. Whoever Allah guides, none can misguide; and whoever He allows to go astray, none can guide. I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, without partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger.

O you who believe! Fear Allah as He should be feared, and do not die except as Muslims. [l Imrn 102]

O mankind! Fear your Lord who created you from a single soul, and created from it its spouse, and spread from the two of them many men and women. And fear Allah through whom you ask one another, and (honor) the ties of kinship. Indeed, Allah is ever watching over you. [An-Nis: 1]

O you who believe! Fear Allah and speak words that are upright. He will rectify your deeds for you and forgive your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly achieved a tremendous success. [Al-Ahzb: 7071]

To proceed: It is obligatory upon every Muslim to worship Allah, Blessed and Exalted, with both beneficial knowledge and righteous action. And perhaps all of youor most of youknow that beneficial knowledge is only that which is taken and derived from the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah , then from what has come to us from the righteous predecessors (al-salaf al-slih); for they are the people whose company does not bring misery to anyone who sits with them. The command to follow the Book, the Sunnah, and the righteous predecessors has come to us in many authentic narrations

Perhaps we will limit ourselves to reminding of one Hadith among them, which is the Hadith of Irbad bin Sariyah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, gave us a sermon by which our hearts were filled with fear and eyes flowed with tears. We said: O Messenger of Allah, advise us. He said: I advise you to fear Allah, and to listen and obey, even if an Abyssinian slave is appointed over you. For whoever among you lives [after me] will see great difference. So, adhere to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs after me. Bite onto it with your molar teeth. And beware of newly invented matters, for every newly invented matter is a Bid'ah (innovation), and every Bid'ah is misguidance. In this Hadith, as you heard, there is a command for something in addition to the Book and the Sunnah, and that is following the Sunnah of the Rightly Guided Caliphs after the Noble Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. This is only because the Rightly Guided Caliphs received knowledge, the Book, and the Sunnah directly from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, without any intermediary, and they understood this Sunnah and the Holy Quran as the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, taught them. Therefore, every seeker of knowledge should not forget this noble Prophetic command to follow the Rightly Guided Caliphs, and attached to them are those who were people of knowledge from the other Companions. Since the matter is such, our call and our knowledge must be derived from the Book, the Sunnah, and the practice of the righteous Salaf (predecessors). For this reason, Ibn al-Qayyim al-Jawziyya, may Allah have mercy on him, says: Knowledge is: 'Allah said', 'His Messenger said' ... 'The Companions said', it is not camouflage/distortion. Knowledge is not that you set up a disagreement foolishly ... between the Messenger and the opinion of a jurist. No, nor is it the denial of Attributes and negating them ... out of caution against Ta'teel (negation) and Tashbih (anthropomorphism). This is what relates to beneficial knowledge, which must be the goal of every student of knowledge, and his goal should not be seeking traditional knowledge based on sectarian fanaticism; this one is a Hanafi,

text: and that one is Maliki, and the third is Shafi'i, and the fourth is Hanbali. These Imams, there is no doubt or uncertainty that we revere them and esteem them with their due respect. Therefore, we follow their path upon which they set out and walked, which is nothing but similar to the righteous Salaf as we mentioned earlier. However, we are not fanatically biased towards one of them over the other. This is beneficial knowledge, meaning: that which is derived from the Book, the Sunnah, and the practice of the righteous Salaf. As for action, the Muslim must be sincere in it to Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, seeking neither reward nor gratitude behind it... seeking neither payment nor vanity nor a position nor anything similar. rather, he performs the righteous deed for Allah, the Blessed and Exalted, just as He, the Mighty and Majestic, said in the Holy Quran: {Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."} [Al-Kahf: 110]. The scholars of Tafsir (exegesis) and Fiqh said regarding this last sentence of the noble verse: {let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone}; they said: The deed is not righteous unless it is in accordance with the Sunnah, and it is not accepted by Allah, even if it is in accordance with the Sunnah, unless it is purely for the Face of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted. The verses and Hadiths regarding this meaning are many, very many. Suffice us, before these questions, is this brief word. It summarizes that every Muslim must perfect the pursuit of knowledge in the light of the Book, the Sunnah, and the practice of the righteous Salaf, and that he should not seek from his righteous deeds anything except the Face of Allah, the Blessed and Exalted. This is what Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, has facilitated regarding this request. (Silsilat al-Huda wa an-Nur (188) / 00:00:03)

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
The Salafi Call is in Turmoil

Intervention: What is your Eminence's opinion on... the Salafi Call in general, and in Kuwait, Egypt, and Saudi Arabia specifically?

The Sheikh: I say that the Salafi Call now, unfortunately, is in turmoil. I attribute the reason for this to: the haste of many Muslim youth to claim knowledge. So, he dares to issue Fatwas, and to declare things prohibited (Haram) and lawful (Halal) before he knowssome of them, as we have heard often, do not know how to read a verse from the Quran properly even if the Noble Mushaf is in front of him, let alone that he often makes grammatical errors in reading the Hadith of the Messenger, upon him be peace and blessings. The well-known proverb in some countries applies to him: "He became a raisin before becoming a sour grape." You know 'Hisrim' (sour/unripe grape)? Is this word used by you? The grape, when it begins, becomes a green berry, and this is 'Hisrim', and the 'Hisrim' is very sour. So, before he became a 'Hisrim', he made himself like a raisin, meaning: like the grape that ripened and became a raisin. Therefore, the obstinacy of many of these people and their haste in claiming knowledge and writing, while they have barely walked halfway down the path of knowledge, is what has made those who ascribe themselves to the Salafi Call, unfortunately, into sects and parties. Therefore, the remedythere is no remedy for it except that these Muslims fear their Lord, the Mighty and Majestic, and that they know that not everyone who begins seeking knowledge can put himself forward for Fatwa in prohibiting and permitting, and in authenticating and weakening Hadith, except after a long life spent practicing

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
during this life on knowing how Fatwa is issued and how deduction is performed from the Book and the Sunnah. In this regard, it is necessary for these preachers or Salafis to abide by the third constraint that I previously mentioned during the talk about beneficial knowledge and righteous action. We have said that beneficial knowledge must be upon the methodology of the righteous Salaf. So when many of the Islamic preachers today deviate from abiding by this third constraint which Imam Ibn al-Qayyim, may Allah have mercy on him, pointed to in his previous poetry, when he said:
'Knowledge is: Allah said, His Messenger said ... The Companions said, it is not camouflage.'
Not turning to what our righteous predecessors were upon returns people, after they had agreed, to the division that distances them from each other just as it distanced many Muslims before, making them sects and parties, each party rejoicing in what it has. This is my opinion on this reality. So, if they are sincere, as we hope, they must hold fast to the correct scientific principles, and he who has not reached the rank of correct knowledge should not dare [to speak]; he should hide from that and entrust knowledge to its scholar. In this regard, there are some narrations that were reported in the books of Hadith. I think Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla, may Allah have mercy on him, who is among the senior scholars of the righteous Salaf, said: I realized in this mosqueand perhaps he was referring to the mosque of Medinahe narrated [from] a certain number of Companions, I forgot the number, that one of them, if he was asked...
Intervention: Seventy.
The Sheikh: And perhaps it is so. The important point: I realized in this mosque seventy of

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: the Companions; one of them, if asked about an issue or requested for a Fatwa, would wish that another one of the scholar Companions present would take care of it. The reason for that is: they feared falling into error and thus leading others into error. So, one of them would wish not to bear this responsibility and that someone else would bear it. As for now, the phenomenon is completely the opposite, with deep regret. This goes back to a clear reason that I mention always and forever: it is that the openness we feel now towards the Book and the Sunnah and the Salafi Call is a recent matter. Not a long time has passed since this openness, which they call "The Awakening" (As-Sahwah), not a long time has passed for these people to harvest the fruit of this awakening or this openness within themselves. Meaning: that they be educated/cultivated on the basis of the Book and the Sunnah, and then consequently overflow with this correct education based on the Book and the Sunnah onto others around them, the nearest then the nearest. The reason is that the effect of this Call has not appeared; because it is new to this era in which we live. Therefore, we find the phenomenon opposite to what we mentioned earlier from what Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Layla narrated about those Companions who used to be pious about being asked, and wished that others would be asked. They only answered the question because of their knowledge that it is not permissible for them to conceal knowledge, but in the depths of their hearts, they wished that others would handle it. As for now, you find in many Salafi societies, let alone others, someone is asked who is thought to be more knowledgeable than those present, and suddenly you find so-and-so starts talking while he is not the one asked, and another starts talking while not asked. What pushes these people? It is the love of appearance... it is egoism. "I am here," meaning: I have knowledge, Masha'Allah (as Allah willed) upon me. This indicates

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: that we were not educated with a Salafi upbringing (Tarbiyah). We grew up on Salafi knowledge, each according to his effort and striving for this knowledge, but as for upbringing/cultivation, we have not acquired it yet as a Salafi Islamic society. Therefore, these groups, blocs, and partiesin every party, we find such division; its cause is nothing but the lack of correct Islamic upbringing. For about twenty years I have been saying: The remedy for this Ummah, for its glory to return to it and for its state to be realized for it, there is no way to that except by starting with what I summarize in two words: Tasfiyah (Purification) and Tarbiyah (Education/Cultivation). Unlike many groups that strive to establish the Muslim State, according to their claim, by laying their hands on power/rule, whether that is by a peaceful path as they say through elections, or that is by a bloody path like military coups and bloody revolutions and the like. We say: This is not the path to establish the State of Islam on the land of Islam. Rather, the path is the path of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, who called in Mecca, as you know, for thirteen years, then completed the call in Medina. There he began, after he had purified for himself from those who followed him and believed in him men whom the blame of a blamer would not overtake in [the cause of] Allah, he began laying the foundations of the Muslim State. And history, as they say, repeats itself. So there is absolutely no wayand I am certain of what I say, and the realistic experience for nearly a century indicates that there is absolutely no room for realizing a correct Islamic renaissance, and behind it establishing the Muslim State, except by achieving these two goals: Which is Tasfiyah (Purification), which is a metonym for correct knowledge. And Tarbiyah (Education): which is that the human is raised upon this correct knowledge... upon the Book and the Sunnah.

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: We are now in a scientific awakening, but we are not in an educational awakening. Therefore, we find many individuals from some preachers from whom knowledge is benefited, but character is not benefited; because he raised himself on knowledge, but he was not in a righteous environment in which he was raised since the softness of his nails (childhood). Therefore, he lives and exists carrying the morals he inherited from that society in which he lived and was found, which is a society that is undoubtedly not an Islamic society. However, he was able, by his person or by the guidance of some people of knowledge, to incline towards a correct scientific direction, but the effect of this knowledge did not appear in his character... in his behavior... in his actions. This phenomenon which we are now in the process of talking about, its cause is: that we have not matured scientifically except for a few individuals. And secondly: The individuals, more than that, were not raised with a correct Islamic upbringing. Therefore, you find many beginners in seeking knowledge appointing themselves as a head... head of a group or head of a party. And here comes an ancient wisdom to express the effect of this appearance, which says: "Love of appearance (prominence) severs the backbones." So, the causes of this return to the lack of correct upbringing upon this correct knowledge. (Silsilat al-Huda wa an-Nur (188) / 00:13:27)

text:
Reconciling the two Hadiths: "The likeness of my Ummah..." and "The best of people..."

Intervention: How do we reconcile between these two Hadiths: The first Hadith: The saying of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him: My Ummah is like the rain, it is not known whether its beginning is better or its end, and his saying: The best of people is my generation?

The Sheikh: The first Hadith does not contradict the other Hadith: The best of people is my generation to the end of it. For this Hadith favors the first generation over the second, and the second over the third. However, the second Hadith, which is his saying, peace be upon him: My Ummah is like the rain, it is not known whether the good is in its beginning or in its end, contains nothing but that goodness may be in the end of the Ummah like the rain; it may not be known if the good is in its beginning or its end. As for regarding the Salaf (predecessors), goodness was known in them, rather it was known regarding them that it is the best goodness found on the face of the earth according to the order mentioned in "The best of people." As for the other Hadith: My Ummah is like the rain, it is not known whether the good is in its beginning or in its end, it is only a glad tiding from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, that there may be goodness in the end of the Ummah, and it does not negate that there is goodness in the beginning of the Ummah, for the Mutawatir (consecutively recurrent) Hadith which I pointed to earlier has proven that. He only wants to inject spirit [of hope] into the Ummah, and to cut off despair of mercy from them, so he says: That goodness may be in the end of this Ummah just as it was in its beginning. And the Hadiths that explicitly state something like his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: A group of my Ummah will not cease to be dominant upon the truth; those who oppose them will not harm them until the command of Allah comes or in a narration: "until the Hour is established", this is proof that goodness is continuous in the Ummah and is not cut off, but it is not like the goodness that was in the beginning of the Ummah

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: in the three generations. Likewise is his glad tiding, peace and blessings be upon him, to this Ummah regarding the emergence of the Mahdi and the descent of Jesus (Isa), peace be upon them both, at the end of time, such as his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: The world will not pass away until a man takes charge who matches my name with his name, and his father's name with my father's name; he will fill the earth with equity and justice just as it was filled with tyranny and injustice. And like his saying, peace be upon him, regarding the descent of Jesus: How will you be when Jesus, the son of Mary, descends among you and your leader is from among you. And likewise the Hadiths that came regarding Jesus specifically, peace be upon him, and in some of them that the prostration in those days will be better than the world and what is in it. So: His saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: My Ummah is like the rain, it is not known whether the good is in its beginning or in its end only means that goodness is not cut off from this Ummah, even if it was more abundant in the first centuries. And this amount is sufficient. (Fatawa Jeddah Ahl al-Hadith wa al-Athar - 3/ 00:55:03)

Are there groups that call to Allah upon the Book and the Sunnah?

Intervention: ... calling to Allah via the Book and the Sunnah ...

The Sheikh: Praise be to Allah, this exists in many countries, in Syria, in Oman, or in this country specifically, and in Egypt, India, and Pakistan, Masha'Allah (as Allah wills). But we ask Allah to gather all Muslims upon one word. (Liqa'at al-Madinah for the year 1408 AH (3) / 00:00:06)

Be a man who knows men by the truth, not one who knows the truth by men

[The Imam said after pointing out a mistake of Imam al-Tabari in some of his speech]: I said this; while I know his knowledge, his virtue, and his worth. However, the worth of the speech of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, is greater to me than any person after him. So be a man who knows men by the truth, and not one who knows the truth by men. And Allah is the One sought for help. As-Sahihah (7/ 2/962).

text:
Who are the Strangers (Ghuraba)?

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: Indeed Islam began as a stranger and will return as a stranger as it began, so Tuba (glad tidings/a tree in Paradise) is for the strangers. It was said: Who are they, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Those who rectify [matters] when the people cause corruption. [The Imam titled this section saying]: Who are the Strangers for whom is Tuba. As-Sahihah (3/ 267).

Ahlus-Sunnah mention what is for them and what is against them

[The Imam said] What is incumbent upon Ahlus-Sunnah is that when they refute the people of innovation, they mention what is in their favor and what is against them, then they clarify the correct position from that. As-Sahihah (2/ 721).

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events

text:
The Methodology of the Salaf is Safer, More Knowledgeable, and Wiser

The Imam said: The methodology of the Salaf is safer, more knowledgeable, and wiser, and not the opposite, contrary to what became famous among the later scholars of Kalam (Scholastic Theology). Ad-Da'ifah (11/ 1/507).

Salafism and Intellectual Invasion

On the authority of Abu Hurairah who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: Iraq will withhold its Dirham and its Qafiz, Sham (the Levant) will withhold its Mudd and its Dinar, and Egypt will withhold its Irdabb and its Dinar. And you will return from where you began, and you will return from where you began, and you will return from where you began. The flesh and blood of Abu Hurairah bore witness to that. (Reported by Muslim)
The Imam said: The meaning of the Hadith is that the Non-Arabs (Persians) and the Romans will seize the lands in the end of times, so they will prevent Muslims from obtaining that. And it was said: Its meaning is that the disbelievers upon whom is the Jizya (tribute) will have their power strengthened in the end of times, so they will refuse what they used to pay of Jizya and Kharaj (land tax) and other than that. The commentator said: "And all of that has been found in this present time in Iraq,

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
and Sham and Egypt, and the Romans, meaning the Christians, seized most of the lands in this thirteenth century [Hijri]."
I say: And they have withdrawn, praise be to Allah, from the mentioned lands, so Syria, Iraq, and Egypt became independent. However, the disbelievers have left behind in these lands from their culture, laws, and customs, that from which the lands still complain of its evils and woes, as if they were still in them, or worse than that. For division, disagreement, and partisanship have crept among their inhabitants, and military coups have multiplied within them. And Allah knows when tranquility will return to them, and there is no way to that except by returning to the Sharia: The Book and the Sunnah. Tahqiq Mukhtasar Sahih Muslim (p. 533).

Stopping at the Evidence is not Rigidity

The Imam said: Stopping at the evidence is not rigidity (Jumud), rather it is the duty of every scholar... "Tahqiq Islah al-Masajid" (p. 23)

Advice to the Ummah to Return to the Book and the Sunnah

Sawt al-Arab (Voice of Arabs): What do you advise the Ummah with in the current period of its life?
A _ I advise it to return to adhering to its religion, the Book of its Lord, and the authentic Sunnah of its Prophet, and to act upon its rulings in all fields of life, and to adorn itself with its virtues and morals, and to present everything it adopts as religion to the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Messenger. So, it should hold fast to what agrees with them, and discard what contradicts them. For the matter is as the great Imam Malik bin Anas said,

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
the Imam of the Abode of Migration (Medina): "Whoever introduces an innovation into Islam seeing it as good, has claimed that Muhammad betrayed the Message. Read the saying of Allah, Mighty and Majestic: {This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion}. And the latter part of this nation will not be rectified except by that which rectified its first part." "Sawt al-Arab Asks and the Muhaddith of Sham Answers" (Question number 10).

Salafism and Movements of Violence

Intervention: There is a question, may Allah reward you with good! You have always, may Allah reward you with good, been forbidding these hasty, enthusiastic youth from the actions they were doingactions in the West Bank which they say are martyrdom operations. Of course, the actions seemed to be imagined, and we seek refuge in Allah, that these tribulations might occur in this country. So what should the youth do at this time, may Allah reward you with good, in such circumstances?

The Sheikh: The advice is the same, as he, peace be upon him, said regarding the time of all tribulations: Be like the saddle-blankets (Ahlas) of your houses (1). Whenever the tribulation intensifies, this noble Prophetic command becomes stronger: Be like the saddle-blankets of your houses. Unfortunately, it is observed in the Islamic world that regarding this thing which is hummed about frequently and for which we raise our heads high, which is the Islamic Awakening (Sahwah), we notice that in this awakening there is something of arrogance, following of desires, and distancing from seeking correct knowledge and patience upon it. Therefore, we find in these youth, by whom the referred-to awakening is represented, a deviation from a very, very important matter,

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: which is proceeding from correct knowledge and not proceeding from personal earthly divisions. So you find in many countries movements resembling revolutionary movements, if we do not say bloody ones, which Islam did not know before and Islam does not recognize afterwards; because Islam is but a religion of invitation (Dawah) as He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: {Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best} [An-Nahl: 125]. Many of these youth do not distinguish between one situation and another, and between one era and another. They do not distinguish between the Islamic State being established on its leg (firmly) and strong in its rule and its launches, and what is the reality today in the entire Islamic world, with deep regret, where the warning of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, to his Ummah applies perfectly to the Islamic world today: that it would deviate from the Sharia of its Lord and boast about its large numbers without fulfilling the good expectations of it. That is his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: The nations will soon summon one another to attack you as people when eating summon one another to their platter. They said: Is it from a small number of us on that day, O Messenger of Allah? He said: No, rather you will be many on that day, but you will be scum/foam like the scum of the torrent. And Allah will surely remove the fear of you from the chests of your enemy and will surely cast Wahn (weakness) into your hearts. They said: And what is Wahn, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Love of the world and hatred of death. These youth do not distinguish between the Islamic State being established, having its Muslim ruler who judges by Allah and His Messenger and does not judge by Taghuts (false idols/tyrants) and earthly laws, and between being as he, peace be upon him, said in this authentic Hadith: You will be many on that day, but you will be scum like the scum of the torrent. We have been afflicted in our present era with many movements, if we do not say Islamic revolutions, which arose in some countries out of a desire to reform the existing conditions caused by these

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: governments that rule by other than what Allah revealed. So they want to reach the realization of Islamic rule and the establishment of the Islamic State through the method of bloody revolutions. And this, without a doubt, as I said at the beginning of this speech, is something Islam did not bring, nor does Islam recognize it at all. Therefore, these movements, if we do not say revolutions, did not benefit the Islamic world in anything; rather, they harmed it with great, severe harm, setting the Call back, Masha'Allah, by many years. Therefore, we advise always and forever that Muslims must be concerned before anything else with rectifying themselves according to the limit of His saying, Blessed and Exalted: {O you who have believed, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided} [Al-Ma'idah: 105]. The masses of Muslims have abandoned this divine command, only at the very least, and have started busying themselves with the communal obligation (Fard Kifayah) over the individual obligation (Fard Ayn), and busying themselves with the communal obligation before its causes and circumstances are prepared. The individual obligation: Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided, Upon you is yourselves, those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided. You find in the entire Islamic world that those who carry out these movements based on haste in the matter and lack of preparation for it are only some enthusiastic youth who have not known Islam in its principles and rules taken or derived from the Book of Allah and from the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. Therefore, the consequence, with deep regret, is harm to the Islamic world, realizing the wisdom that was taken from texts of the Book and Sunnah, that wisdom which says: Whoever rushes a thing before its time is afflicted by being deprived of it. I have mentioned in more than one session, and perhaps one of them was a session in this very place, that when Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, addresses people with His saying: {And prepare against them whatever you are able of power

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy} [Al-Anfal: 60], He directed this address not to the general public, but to the specific people, who are the true believers. {And prepare against them} [Al-Anfal: 60]. Intuitively, no one who has been given anything of understanding and jurisprudence in the language, let alone the Book and Sunnah, would have it cross his mind that the address in His saying {And prepare} is directed to the disbelievers. No one understands this. But I know this and I say what is like the sun in the clear day intuitively as a prelude to the other understanding as well, which may not cross anyone's mind, even if it is slightly more hidden than the first. So I say: His saying, the Exalted: {And prepare}, just as it is not an address to the disbelievers, it is not an address to the hypocrites who display Islam and conceal disbelief in Allah and His Messenger. This is the second matter. And the third: which is more hidden than the previous two matters: It is not intended by this command the corrupt (Fussaq) among the Muslims. {And prepare} - it is not intended by this command the corrupt of the Muslims and their sinners. Rather, what is intended by this command are the true believers. And I do not doubt that such believers have an existence in every time and in every place, even if in varying proportions of many and few. That is indicated by his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: A group of my Ummah will not cease to be dominant upon the truth; those who oppose them will not harm them until the Hour is established. So, the first thing that comes to mind is that intended by this command directed in the previous verse {And prepare} are the believers. And I do not say: "So pay attention, they are these believers"meaning: I will say finallyrather, the intended are these believers [only] if they are united/agglomerated and not divided. At the very least, they should not be divided in their bodies and in their lands. Meaning: It is not sufficient for them to be united in their ideas and in their creeds and understandings upon the Book and the Sunnah, as is

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
our call since more than half a century. It is not sufficient meeting upon this thought and upon this creed only; rather, they must also be gathered in one place and be as if they were one man and upon the heart of one man. Does this, as far as you know, have existence in your time?
Intervention: No...
The Sheikh: The answer, with deep regret, is: No. Then how can these simple people rush, who gather together some youth enthusiastic for their Islamit may be very superior enthusiasm, but in terms of knowledge and in terms of action... Yes. So I say: These people may be enthusiastic with the utmost enthusiasm, but their hearts have not yet been filled with this faith which pushes firstly to being one hand as I mentioned earlier, then after that, it might be possibleand I say while meaning what I sayit might be possible that they realize this Quranic command {And prepare against them whatever you are able of power}. They might be the opposite of that; they might be in a situation where the disbelievers surround them from every side and do not leave them room to carry even a simple, easy weapon from the old weapons like arrows, spears, and swords and the like, let alone these modern weapons without which it is impossible today to fight the disbelievers. So, we summarize from what preceded that His saying, the Exalted: {And prepare against them whatever you are able of power} [Al-Anfal: 60] to the end of the verse, contains an explicit command to prepare material weaponry, but it contains an implicit command, which is that the first weapon of this material weaponry is the weapon of Faith (Iman), which if it settles in the heart, one will not care about the debris of the world, its glitter, and its adornment. And if they are like that, it is possible for them then to be those about whom the Messenger of Allah said

book_title: Comprehensive Heritage of the Scholar Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: - peace and blessings be upon him and his family: Twelve thousand will not be overcome due to fewness (1). So twelve thousand does not mean: that they be scattered like this, individuals in this country and individuals in another country, and a third and fourth and so on. Rather, they must be upon the heart of one man, having prepared within themselves the correct Faith based on the Book and the Sunnah, then applied this noble verse {And prepare against them whatever you are able of power}. On that day, it is obligatory upon these Muslims to declare it openly, and on that day, it is possible to realize the Islamic Rule which has a head (President/Imam) who commands and forbids, so he must be obeyed in what he commands and forbids except in disobedience to Allah, the Blessed and Exalted. As for his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. If they say it, they have protected their blood and their wealth from me except for its right, and their reckoning is with Allah. This sayingwe must be awarewas only issued by the Muslim Ruler who had no equal and will never have an equal in the world at all, namely the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. Then, this is only issued by those who deputize for him among the Muslim Rulers. So, we must distinguish between a situation like the situation of Muslims today, scattered and fragmented as the Prophet, peace be upon him, mentioned in the previous Hadith, [and] when they become upon the heart of one man as we mentioned. On that day, they will choose a man from among them whom they pledge allegiance to upon Islam, and pledge allegiance to upon death. This man, with this group, are the ones who have the right, religiously and Islamically, to fight those around them if they do not respond to their call, the call of Truth. Therefore, among the obscene errors is what occurred far away and what occurred nearby in Algeria, for example, of the revolution in which some of them rose up, so the consequence was like those other consequences to which we pointed earlier.

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events

text: Therefore, I advise all the youth, no matter what tribulations (fitan) arise from some states, whether they are states that are Islamic in name, or have deviated from Islam greatly or slightly, and whether tribulations erupt internally or come from outside; I advise that they stick to their homes, except in one case: when one of us is attacked in the very heart of his home while he has kept away from tribulations in response to the command of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, mentioned previously. On that day, he has the right to defend himself. As for throwing himself into the midst of the dispute and the tribulation existing between one faction and another, or one state and another, then here applies his saying, peace be upon him: Be like the mats of your houses. This is what I have as an answer to that question. (Al-Huda wan-Nur / 354/ 40: 00: 00)

text:
Salafism and the Importance of Knowledge
Question: What is the way to apply the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, in our reality and in our business?
The Sheikh: All of this is tied to studying knowledge in the correct manner from the Book of Allah and from the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah. This is the duty of the people of knowledge. If one is capable of understanding the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, then this is his duty, and it is not permissible for him to study Islam through any other path due to the multitude of verses that have come commanding us to return to the Book and the Sunnah, and some of them have been mentioned previously. As for the one who is not able, Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity. We mentioned previously the verse: {So ask the people of the message if you do not know} [An-Nahl: 43], and the people of the message are the people of the Qur'an in understanding, action, and application. So whoever is able to understand but then does not act, there is no doubt he is sinful. Otherwise, what is the purpose of sending down the Book upon the heart of the Messenger, peace be upon him, and Allah's command to him in the Qur'an to explain to the people what was sent down to them? Is it not to act upon it?! There is no doubt and no uncertainty. And there is no doubt and no uncertainty either that the way to act upon the Book and the Sunnah is knowledge, for knowledge usually precedes action. For example, if any person wants to perform an act of worshipyou want to pray, and you know that you must perform ablution (Wudu)if you do not learn Wudu, you will not pray, and if you pray [without learning], you will not perfect the prayer. So it is a very self-evident matter that knowledge of obedience and worship precedes the worship. If you are commanded to pray, you are commanded to know the method of prayer, to learn the method of prayer,

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
and likewise all acts of worship, and likewise all of the Sharia. So undoubtedly, he would be sinful, but not all Muslims, because seeking knowledge is divided into two parts: Individual Knowledge (Fard 'Ayn), which is obligatory upon every Muslim. An example of this is: a poor man must pray, but Zakat is not obligatory upon him, nor is Hajj. So, he must know the method of prayer so that he performs it well and it is accepted by Allah, Blessed and Exalted, but he does not have to know the rulings of Zakat and the rulings of Hajj. However, if his wealth reaches the threshold (Nisab) and a year passes over it, it becomes obligatory for him to know what Zakat is due upon him, and so on. The second type of knowledge is Communal Knowledge (Fard Kifaya), which is that there be among the Muslims people who gain understanding of the Book of Allah in all rulings of the Sharia, so that if a questioner asks about a rare issue, for example, there will be an answer available because he has gained understanding of the Book of Allah and the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. From here, the danger of turning away from studying the Book and the Sunnah becomes clear, because issues arise in every time and every place, and a person cannot give an answer if he is restricted to one of the schools of thought (Madhabs) and is not learned in the Book of Allah and the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. I do not know, so as not to go too far, perhaps I have hovered in the answer around your question. Your question was: Are they sinful? Undoubtedly, those who are able to study the Book and the Sunnah and then turn away from it or them are sinful. As for the incapable, Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity.
Interjection: The one who does not apply [it]?
The Sheikh: Pardon, what I understand from you is: are you asking now about application or about knowledge?
Interjection: Knowledge, then application comes [next].

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
The Sheikh: So: Now we have left the scientific aspect. Now you are asking: a person among people who cannot apply [the religion]. The answer is easy, but often the question is unrealistic. It is said: He cannot pray, for example. If we accept this for the sake of argument, we say: Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity; he does not pray. But is it true that he cannot pray?! It is not true, but in his imagination, he [thinks he] cannot pray. I know many sick people who are consistent with prayers during their health, but when they are confined to their beds, they stop praying. What is wrong with you, so-and-so? "By Allah, I cannot perform ablution, my clothes are dirty... etc." Well, pray within the limits of your ability; Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity. Therefore: the statement of this human that he cannot pray is incorrect. So now, if you really want to pinpoint this aspect, you must give an example. What is the legal ruling that you imagine the one charged with it cannot perform? Whatever this ruling is, if the claim is truemeaning, you say: "He cannot"then we say: The obligation falls from him, because he cannot. But I fear what I fear is that an example is circulating in your mind similar to the example I gave just now, that Zayd among people does not pray claiming he cannot pray. No, I say HE cannot pray due to his ignorance. Here it goes back to... the necessity of knowledge. Otherwise, he is able to pray, as came in the authentic Hadith in Sahih Al-Bukhari from the Hadith of Imran bin Husain who said: I had hemorrhoids, so I came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and he said: Pray standing; if you are not able, then sitting; if you are not able, then on your side. So: He was able to pray, but [only] after he knew the method of prayer for the one who cannot pray standing. So, can we now understand from you an example regarding your question?
Interjection: For example, an employee in a company, [and there are dealings with banks and usury...].

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
The Sheikh: Did you see how the example clarifies issues? This example is like my previous example. You now say "forced." Is he forced to work in this company? You will say intuitively: No. Is he forced to work in all companies? He will say this, and you said before: No, he is not forced. Therefore: The question is built upon one who is not forced. We have a proverb in the Levant (Sham): "He who does not want to see a horrific sight of death should not sleep among the graves," for if he sleeps among the graves, he will see a horrific sight of death. So if he enters a company that does not adhere to the rulings of the Sharia, he will expose himself to things in which he disobeys the Sharia. But is he forced? He is not forced to work.
Interjection: ...
The Sheikh: This is a second discussion, but are you convinced by my statement that Zayd among people is not forced to work in such-and-such company? I will strike an example for you related to it, and I was asked quite recently, related to prayer: People, during the days of the week, he allows themmay he be thankedto pray Dhuhr, for example, where they work, but he does not allow them to go to the mosque. You, no offense, might think this is an example that he cannot pray Friday prayer. But I look at the issue fundamentally: Is it obligatory upon him to work in this company that does not allow him to respond to the command of Allah when he hears the saying of the Mu'adhin on Friday: "Come to prayer, Come to success"? Is he unable to work except in this company, and consequently cannot pray the Friday prayer? The answer: No. What is built upon corruption is corrupt. His work in this companyespecially if he knew beforehand that the employees there are not free in their worship, then it became clear to him after a month or two, taking a salary for a month or two, etc., that he is forced to obey this disbeliever and not obey the Lord of the Worlds in what He commanded him regarding prayerthis, O brother, it is not correct to say that he is not

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: able. The one who is not able is [due to] the ability that has departed from him, like the one we gave as an example previously, the paralyzed person who cannot stand and pray. Correct, he is not able. But this one goes and engages in all the causes that stand between him and obedience to Allah, among them being that he enters a job that prevents him from performing obedience. So he says then "he cannot." No, he can, but he preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter. That is why I was cautious about that question, because it is raised often, that "one is not able." I imagine in many cases that the questioner is able, but the questioner, because he is not knowledgeable in Islam and the Law, imagines truly with all purity of soul that he is not able. But the one knowledgeable in the Book and the Sunnah clarifies the subject to him, and lo and behold, he is able. Therefore, I answered you in advance: if the question is in its place, "Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity." But when we are in a realm where there is a way out from the claimed inability, then he must take the way out, and not throw himself into what he knows will cause him to fall short in performing what Allah Almighty has obligated upon him. (Al-Huda wan-Nur / 40/ 29: .. : .. )
