Salafism and the Importance of Knowledge
..
Interjection: What is your opinion, our Sheikh, to give general advice to the preachers, meaning, advice on how to call to establishing a correct scientific methodology in Jordan?
The Sheikh: It is obligatory, before anything else, upon our brothers who are keen on following the Book and the Sunnah to study them a precise scientific study that contains awareness and correct understanding, and contains deliberation in not adopting personal opinions from those who see themselves as having become students of this noble knowledge. It is obligatory, in addition to thiswhich is the study of this knowledgethat every student be keen to act upon what he knows, so that his knowledge does not become a proof against him on one hand, and so that Allah, Blessed and Exalted, may benefit the people with his knowledge. Then, a third matter should be noted in that, which is: if we want to invite people to what Allah has bestowed upon us of guidance and light, we must be gentle with them, not be harsh with them, and not appear before them as being distinguished above them by this knowledge. We must consider the people, all the people whom we see far from the guidance of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, we must consider them as sick people. There is no doubt that spiritual sickness is more severe and harmful to its owner than physical bodily sickness. And if it is assumed for the physical doctor to be gentle with the patientto the point that many say some patients are cured merely by hearing a kind word from their doctorthen it is more appropriate, and even more so, that the student of knowledge who undertakes guiding people and directing them to follow the Sunnah, and to follow what our righteous predecessors were upon, be gentle in inviting them, kind in dealing with them. And if the Prophet, peace be upon him

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and his family, would disapprove of Sayyidah Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, when she was harsh in returning the greeting to that Jew who entered upon the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and twisted his tongue with the greeting, saying: "As-Sam 'alaykum" (Death be upon you). So his greeting was not clear that it was the greeting of Muslims, nor was it clear that it was a supplication for deathwhich is "As-Sam"upon the Master of Messengers, and he did not pronounce it eloquently and explicitly. Naturally, he does not dare to address the Messenger, peace be upon himwhile the state belonged to him on that dayby saying: "As-Sam 'alayk" (Death be upon you), meaning: death. But also, because of the humiliation, malice, and disbelief in the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, that was in his heart, he did not proceed to cast upon him, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, "As-Salam" (Peace), which is a name from the names of Allah Almighty, as came in the authentic Hadith. Rather, he mumbled it and wasted it, saying: "As-Sam 'alaykum." It is a self-evident matter that this was not hidden from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, so he returned the greeting to him with brevity, the utmost brevity, by saying: "Wa 'alaykum" (And upon you). As for Sayyidah Aisha, being behind the curtain, she had barely heard this twisting of the greeting by that Jew when she said: "And upon you be death, the curse, and wrath, O brothers of apes and pigs." When the Jew left, the Messenger, peace be upon him, said: "What is this, O Aisha?" She said: "O Messenger of Allah, did you not hear what he said?" He said to her: "Did you not hear what I said, O Aisha?"and here is the witnessGentleness is not in anything except that it adorns it, and violence is not in anything except that it disgraces it. If the Messenger, peace be upon him, says this to the one who addressed the Jews with that harsh tone, and she is Sayyidah Aisha, and she had a right to that because she understood from the Jew that he was praying for death upon the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family; then what should be our stance with our brothers who share with us at least in the two testimonies of faith? There is no doubt that we must be gentle with them and not be harsh upon them.

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: For this reason, it was from the commandment of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, to Muadh ibn Jabal and Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with them both, that when the Prophet, peace be upon him, sent them as callers to Yemen, he said to them: Go and comply with each other, and make things easy and do not make them difficult. So all of this makes us pay attention to be tolerant and easy-going with people in our call. And as I say on this occasion, and I often say: our call, praise be to Allah, is the call of truth, and people are heedless of the truth, and the word of truth is naturally heavy upon people. It is enough of a burden on people that we invite them to this truth which is heavy upon them; the weight of the word of truth is sufficient for them. That is what should deter us and prevent us from increasing the burden upon them by using a harsh style in our invitation of them to the truth. Because if the harshness of the style is added to the severity of the truth and its weight upon peopleif the harshness of the truth and its weight upon them, which is truth, is joined with calling peoplewe should not add to this weight another weight which is not truth. In that case, this second weight acts as a barrier preventing people from accepting the truth which is heavy by its nature, as He, the Exalted, said: {Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word} [Al-Muzzammil: 5]. For this reason, it was from his words, peace be upon him, regarding Muadh in the story of his prolonging the recitation in the Isha prayerthat prolongation which drove one of the Ansar to cut his prayer behind him, pray alone, and go off to his house, leaving the congregation. When the news reached Muadh, he was severe in attacking this Ansari, to the point that he was saying about him: "He is a hypocrite." Muadh, may Allah be pleased with him, used this word proceeding from a general principle, the general principle that Ibn Masoud speaks about in his long Hadith in "Sahih Muslim": No one would stay behind from the congregational prayer except a hypocrite. Likewise, there is another Hadith: The one who is in the mosque and hears the Adhan and then leaves is a hypocrite. Muadh used this

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: general application regarding that person and he was mistaken; because this man did not leave following his desire, but rather for an excuse he explained to the Messenger, peace be upon him, when he complained about Muadh to him. So the Messenger, peace be upon him, sent for Muadh, as is known, and the Messenger, peace be upon him, said to him: Are you a trial-maker (Fattan), O Muadh? Are you a trial-maker, O Muadh? Are you a trial-maker, O Muadh? It is sufficient for you to read "By the Sun and its brightness" (Ash-Shams) and "By the night when it covers" (Al-Layl) and similar Surahs. If one of you leads people, let him lighten [the prayer] to the end of the Hadith. So the witness is that cruelty and harshness harm the call. Unfortunately, we notice in many of our brothers that the newer one is to the call, the harsher he is in it; because he imagines that harshness is beneficial in the call. The reality is that it harms. Sufficient for you in this regard is His saying, Almighty and Majestic: {And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you} [Al Imran: 159]. I also see fit to mention that today we are afflicted with the opposite of what we were afflicted with in the previous past centuries. In the previous centuries, we were afflicted with the stagnation of scholars, let alone the students of knowledge, let alone the common people; we were afflicted with stagnation on sectarian imitation (Taqleed). This stagnation continued over the Muslims for long centuries. Now, there is a group, a blessed awakening to return to the Book and the Sunnah, and there is no doubt it has yielded its produce and ripe fruits. But we now complain of the opposite of that matter which we used to complain about before. We used to complain of stagnation, so now we complain of [unbridled] setting loose. Now everyone who hears the word "Book and Sunnah," while he understands nothing of the Book and Sunnah except some phrases and some words he hears from some preacherswhich might be words of truth, or might contain some errorhe thinks that he has thereby become a scholar who is permitted to say: "I see such-and-such," and "My opinion is such-and-such," and "I see this saying as wrong." He interferes in every big and small matter, while he does not do well in reading a [single] Hadith... and this has its dangers. If the matter revolvesthis is my personal opinionif the matter revolves between following one of the four followed schools

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: followed [schools] and stagnation upon them, and between every Muslim becoming a claimant of knowledge, a claimant of Ijtihad (independent reasoning), then there is no doubt that remaining upon what the fathers and grandfathers were upon of following the Madhab and not relying on the opinions of the ignorant ones who have not studied knowledge, that is better. This is from the chapter of: "Have mercy, some evil is lighter than others." It is true that some wise men or writers from the Iraqis said a very beautiful word, but it has a beautiful correction. He said: "For me to strive (make Ijtihad) and err is dearer to me than to imitate and be correct." He said: "I only said 'dearer to me' and not 'better', because for me to strive and err is dearer to me than to imitate and be correctpardon, dearer to me than to strive and be correcthe said: I did not say 'better' because error is not better than correctness." Therefore, we must advise our brothers who share with us in the Call and adopting the Book and the Sunnah not to be deceived by themselves and not to be deceived by some information they took from others, which was not through their personal study. For this opens a door upon us regarding others that we have no capability to repel, because others argue against us saying that you allow those who do not knowthey say where we are in the Levant (Sham): "The Alif from the stick (Bastiyya)" (meaning they can't distinguish the letter Alif from a long stick), and in some countries here they say: "He doesn't know the five from the obliteration (tamsa)." This is undoubtedly a fault taken against the Salafi Call. But undoubtedly, the Salafi Call does not acknowledge building personal opinions that stem from people who are not students of knowledge, even if they were students of knowledge but have not yet matured in knowledge. Therefore, we propose to these people that they not rely on their opinions and that they seek help from the people of knowledge; because the Noble Qur'an, as you know, made Muslims into two parts: a scholar, and a non-scholar. And this was the case in all previous eras, especially in the first century, the most luminous century, which is the century of the Messenger, peace be upon him, and his era.

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: For people were of two types: a scholar, and a non-scholar. This is what Allah Almighty meant by His saying: {So ask the people of the message if you do not know} [An-Nahl: 43]. Ibn al-Qayyim and others say: The scholars among the Companions who used to give fatwas to the people barely reached the number of two hundred persons, two hundred scholars. The thousands upon thousands and thousands upon thousands were notas is the case with the millions, rather than thousands, due to the multitude of Muslims, masha'Allah, today on the face of the earthit was not that these thousands upon thousands of Companions, each one would give an opinion, give a view. Rather, they used to apply His saying, the Exalted: {So ask the people of the message if you do not know}. Based on this verse, we must spread this truth among our Salafi youth and make them live by it, such that it is before their eyes always and forever: Are you a scholar? You strive, you understand the Book and the Sunnah? You are not a scholar. Then it is not your duty to say: "I see such-and-such," and "I strove and saw such-and-such," whether that is in authenticating a Hadith while he is not from the people of Hadith, or in deriving a ruling while he is not from the jurists (Fuqaha). So he must, then, realize this verse {So ask the people of the message if you do not know}. Because those who dare to give fatwas while they are not people of knowledge and fatwa, their likeness is as the likeness of that man whom the Messenger, peace be upon him, prayed against that Allah Almighty destroy him because he gave a fatwa due to which he caused the death of an innocent Muslim soul. You know this Hadith which Abu Dawood narrated in his Sunan (1): That the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, sent a military expedition. When they fought the disbelievers and evening came and then morning rose upon them, one of them stood up having had a wet dream, and on his body were many wounds. So he asked those around him if they could find a concession for him not to wash (perform Ghusl)? They said: You have no choice but to

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: wash. So he washed and died. When his news reached the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, he prayed against him, saying: They killed him, may Allah kill them. Why did they not ask when they were ignorant? For indeed, the cure for ignorance (Al-'Ayy) is asking. This Hadith must always and forever be present before the eyes of students of knowledge so that they do not dare to give fatwas and be afflicted, for example, by what afflicted that man whom the Messenger, peace be upon him, prayed against that Allah Blessed and Exalted fight him. Daring to give fatwas, it appears from the preceding speech, returns its evil consequences upon the Mufti first, and upon the one given the fatwa second. Thus, if this meaning settles in the students of knowledge who have not reached the knowledge of the Book and the Sunnah and tracking the sayings of the Imams and weighing and preferring between thembut rather merely say "I see such-and-such" and "I understood such-and-such"[if they realize this], these people, to relieve themselves of the two calamities I pointed to first: that they fall into error themselves, and that they cause others to fall into error. That is by asking the people of knowledge, and it is not upon them afterwards whether the one who gave the fatwa was wrong or right. Because if he was right, then excellent; and if he was wrong, then his sin is only upon the one who gave him the fatwa. So instead of bearing the burden himself because he gave a fatwa without knowledge and implicated the one he gave the fatwa to without knowledge, let him place the sin on another if he gave him a fatwa without knowledge. This does not mean that our youth should not investigate in their questioning of the people of knowledge to distinguish between a scholar and a scholar, between a claimant of knowledge and a true scholar, and between a scholar of a Madhab and those ignorant of the Book and the Sunnah. This is another issue. The important thing is that he asks one whose knowledge he trusts, and whose religion he trusts. At that time, he will not fall into the problem that the one who gave the fatwa fell into, that he must wash; and due to his ignorance of the Sunnah, he did not give him the fatwa of the permissibility of Tayammum because water harmed him, and indeed it harmed him and was the cause of his death. So this is a word, and perhaps I have prolonged it. I hope from Allah Almighty that He grants us success to act upon beneficial knowledge, and that He makes us know our own selves, and that He does not make us among those deceived by them; for vanity is a destruction beyond which there is no destruction. (Al-Huda wan-Nur /181/ 51: 16: 00)

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text:
Whoever holds fast to the Sunnah, Allah will never waste him
The Imam said: It is obligatory upon you, O Muslim, to believe that Allah hasin everything He legislated for His servants of commands, prohibitions, and permissionsa wisdom, rather a profound judgement. He who knows it knows it, and he who is ignorant of it is ignorant of it. It appears to some of them, and is hidden from others. Therefore, the duty of the true Muslim is to hasten to obey Allah, and not to hesitate in that until the wisdom becomes clear to him, for that contradicts faith which is absolute submission to the Wise Lawgiver. Therefore, He, Almighty and Majestic, said in the Noble Qur'an: {But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission}. Upon this, our righteous predecessors lived, so Allah honored them, and opened for them the lands and the hearts of the servants. The latter part of this nation will not be rectified except by that which rectified its first part. Indeed, Abu Bakr As-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, had the winning shaft (precedence) in it, and he was a righteous example for others, as indicated by his magnificent stance in the story of the Treaty of Hudaibiya, in what Sahl bin Hunaif, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated, saying: "O people! Accuse yourselves. We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, on the day of Hudaibiya, and if we saw fighting, we would have fought"that was during the peace treaty that was between the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and the polytheists"So Umar bin Al-Khattab came and went to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and said: O Messenger of Allah! Are we not upon the truth and they upon falsehood? He said: Yes. He said: Are not our dead in Paradise and their dead in the Fire? He said:

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Yes. He said: So why do we give humiliation in our religion and return while Allah has not yet judged between us and them? He said: O Son of Al-Khattab! I am the Messenger of Allah, and Allah will never waste me. He said: So Umar went offhe could not remain patient out of rageso he came to Abu Bakr and said: O Abu Bakr? Are we not upon truth and they upon falsehood? He said: Yes. He said: Are not our dead in Paradise and their dead in the Fire? He said: Yes. He said: So why do we give humiliation from our religion and return while Allah has not yet judged between us and them? He said: O Son of Al-Khattab! Indeed, he is the Messenger of Allah, and Allah will never waste him. He said: Then the Qur'an was revealed to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, with (Al-Fath / The Victory). So he sent for Umar and recited it to him. He said: O Messenger of Allah? Is it a victory? He said: Yes. So his soul was pleased and he returned. Narrated by Al-Bukhari (3182 - Fath) and Muslim (5/ 175 - 176) and the context is his, and Ahmad (3/ 486). And in a narration by them from him: O people, accuse your opinion... and it is by Saeed bin Mansour (3/ 2/374) and Ibn Abi Shaybah (15/ 299). Al-Hafiz said (13/ 288): It is as if he said: Accuse the opinion if it opposes the Sunnah, as happened to us where the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, commanded us to decompose [from Ihram], but we loved to continue upon Ihram and we wanted fighting to complete our rituals and conquer our enemy, and what appeared to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, of what happened in the outcome was hidden from us. The most magnificent example I came across in the biography of his companions, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, indicating their preference for obeying him, even if that was contrary to their desire and personal interest, is the saying of Zahir bin Rafi who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, forbade us from a matter that was beneficial for us, but obedience to Allah and His Messenger is more beneficial for us. He forbade us from sharecropping (Muhaqala) with the land, renting it for a third or a quarter or named food.

text:
Importance of adding the constraint of the understanding of the Salaf to the Book and the Sunnah
The Sheikh: Before I present to you what Allah facilitates for me of improvising a word about the Call which Allah, Blessed and Exalted, sent Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, with, I see it incumbent upon me to mention an etiquette from the etiquettes of scientific gatherings which masses of people, and among them some students of knowledge, have violated. For we find in many gatherings where a wide scientific circle is held, as was the case when we entered this blessed place, God willing, where it was assumed that people sit at the edges of this spacious place. There is no harm in sitting in such a seating in other than a scientific session. As for the scientific session, its etiquette is joining together, gathering, and clumping so that the Muslims gathering to seek knowledge are not distant with their bodies from one another; because the apparent is the title of the hidden, as came in many hadiths from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. Among these hadiths related to the etiquette of sitting in seeking knowledge is that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, entered his mosque one day and saw people scattered in separate circles, so he said to them: Why do I see you in separate groups ('Izzin)? meaning: separated. And this Hadith is in the Sahih of Imam Muslim. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, drew the attention of those sitting in the Prophetic Mosque on that day not to have multiple circles, and to unify the scientific circle, and for some of them to gather with others,

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Nay... The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, was concerned with gathering people and warned them against separating in their bodies and figures even if they were in the open or the desert. Imam Ahmad narrated in his Musnad from the Hadith of Abu Tha'labah Al-Khushani, may Allah Almighty be pleased with him, who said: When we used to travel with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, we would disperse in the mountain passes and valleys. So he said to us one day: Indeed, this dispersion of yours is from the work of Satan. They were not in a scientific session, but rather on a trip in the wilderness; they used to disperse, each taking a side under shading trees or a moist valley or the like. So he, peace and blessings be upon him, disapproved of that dispersion and said: Indeed, this dispersion of yours is from the work of Satan. Abu Tha'labah, may Allah Almighty be pleased with him, said: So after that, when we camped in a valley, we gathered together, such that if we sat on a carpet, it would hold us. They responded to Allah and the Messenger when he called them, so they would not separate in their dwellings while they were travelers; they used to gather. What is the secret in the Prophet's care, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, in gathering people, and not allowing them to separate in their bodies even in the desert? What is the secret? I previously indicated that, but an indication in many cases does not substitute for an explicit phrase. Rather, an explicit phrase sometimes needs explanation, commentary, and clarification, so I must provide some of this. I said previously: Because the apparent is the title of the hidden, meaning: if Muslims separate in their outward appearances, that is a cause and a motive for them to separate in their hearts. This is what the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, used to declare when he stood for prayer, and he would not enter into it except

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: after he commands the straightening of the rows, as is known to everyone. But few are the people who know firstly what the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, used to say to the people when he commanded them to straighten the rows. He, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say: You must straighten your rows, or Allah will surely alter between your faces (hearts). And this Hadith, with deep regret, is from the practical Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, from one angle, and the verbal Sunnah from another angle. That is because he used to straighten the rows and urge them to care about straightening, and warn them against misalignment, and inform them that this misalignment is a cause for separation between their hearts: You must straighten your rows, or Allah will surely alter between your faces. We see today that most Imams of mosquesI do not exclude from them the Imams of the Sacred Mosque and the Prophetic Mosque, let alone other mosquesall of them have failed to care about straightening the rows, and warning people against misalignment in straightening them. You barely hear from the best of them [anything but] one who says: "Straighten up right and left," and the matter ends. As for the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and his companions the Righteous Caliphs after him, they used to care a very, very great deal. So one of them would not say the opening Takbir (Takbirat al-Ihram) until he was reassured that the people responded to the command to straighten the rows, on one hand. And [on the other hand], the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and likewise his companions after him, were not content with just the word: "Straighten... Straighten," nor saying only to this one "move forward" and to that one "move back." Rather, he, peace be upon him, and his noble companions used to present before that incentives and encouragements so that people would respond to the call of the Messenger, peace be upon him, in straightening the row. In addition to the previous Hadith: You must straighten your rows, he, peace be upon him, used to say: Straighten your rows;

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: for the straightening of the rows is from the perfection of the prayer and in a narration: from the goodness of the prayer. Both narrations are authentic. And his command, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, for a thing implies that this thing is obligatory to apply and implement; because Allah Almighty said regarding His Prophet, peace be upon him: {He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allah} [An-Nisa: 80]. And He said: {So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment} [An-Nur: 63]. For this, attention should be paid that people straighten up in prayer and be close in the scientific gathering outside of prayer in response to the command of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. And in some of these commands is the justification for that; because rectifying the outward appearances is a legal cause for rectifying the inward states. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, mentioned this meaning also in some authentic Hadiths which you must have heard often, but I believe that few scholars remind you of the wisdom that was mentioned or indicated in the Hadith that you always heard, which is his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: Indeed, the Halal is clear, and the Haram is clear, and between them are ambiguous matters which many people do not know. So whoever guards against doubtful matters has sought to clear his religion and his honor. Beware, for every king has a sanctuary. Beware, for the sanctuary of Allah is His prohibitions. Beware, for whoever grazes around the sanctuary is bound to fall into it. Bewareand here is the witnessindeed there is a morsel of flesh in the body; if it is sound, the whole body is sound, and if it is corrupt, the whole body is corrupt. Beware, it is the heart. Therefore: the soundness of the heart implies the soundness of the body. These are from the secrets of the Sharia which the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, drew attention to in this Hadith; because he indicates in this Hadith and in other Hadiths that

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: the outer aspect of the body is linked to its inner aspect, which is the heart, and the heart is also linked to the outer aspect of the body. So it is as if there is a permanent, continuous movement resembling what we used to and still hear, that they are trying to reach the discovery of what they call perpetual motion. Perpetual motion was created by Allah Blessed and Exalted in this human whom He formed and perfected his form. That movement is: if you rectify your heart, the rectitude of your body necessarily follows; and if you rectify your body, the rectitude of your heart necessarily follows. Therefore: Let no one sayas we hear often from some youth who were not raised with an Islamic upbringing, and violated many legal pillars like prayer, for exampleif it is said to them: O brother, why do you not pray? He says to you: The consideration is what is in the heart. As if he says or imagines that it is possible for the heart to be righteous, correct, and sound, while the body does not respond to the legal rulings. This is a matter that is utterly false. So we must notice this truth, which is the connection of the apparent with the hidden, and that the rectitude of one of them implies nothing but the rectitude of the other, and that the corruption of one of them implies nothing but the corruption of the other. Thus: From here we understand why the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, used to command people to gather and join together in the assembly of knowledge, because this outward physical joining affects the joining of hearts and the mutual love that must be realized in the heart of every Muslim, as came in many Hadiths urging love for the sake of Allah and visiting each other for the sake of Allah, which is known to you. The intention is that I wanted to point to this Sunnah which students of knowledge should follow, not to enlarge the scientific circle, but to make it smaller as much as they can, so that some of them are close to others, and all of them are also close to this person who undertakes teaching them and guiding them to what benefits them in their worldly life and their Hereafter.
