text: After this word, I want to remind, as the Exalted said: {And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers} [Adh-Dhariyat: 55]. Every Muslim knows that Islam is built upon two foundations to which there is no third: namely, the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. This is a truth about which no two differ, and about which no two goats would butt heads, as they used to say in ancient times. And so, if this is a truth known to every Muslim, then why did Muslims differ in the past and recently, while all of them say: "I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah"? And the faith of a Muslim is not complete except with these two testimonies: with the good word "La ilaha illa Allah" (There is no god but Allah), and by testifying to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, of Prophethood and Message. But is it sufficient, for a Muslim to be saved in this world before the Hereafter, to say this good word and the second testimony with his tongue while he does not yet understand what is the meaning of "La ilaha illa Allah" and what are its implications? And he also does not know the implications of his saying: "And I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah." We must stop at this point, and I repeat the alert: All Muslims say "La ilaha illa Allah Muhammad Rasul Allah." If it is assumed that anyone refuses, he is not on the path of Islam. Since the matter is so, what is the reason for what occurred in the past and still occurs recently of the difference that Allah Almighty informed about with a general statement, and the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, detailed in some of his Hadiths with detail? The Exalted said: {And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ * Except whom your Lord has given mercy} [Hud: 118 - 119]. The news of Allah cannot be delayed, {And who is more truthful than Allah in statement} [An-Nisa: 122]. This is news from Allah in His Book, summarized: {But they will not cease to differ * Except whom your Lord has given mercy} [Hud: 118 - 119]. The detail of this noble verse is in the Hadith which also you must have heard or

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: you read it often and often, which is his saying, peace be upon him: The Jews split into seventy-one sects, and the Christians into seventy-two sects, and my Ummah will split into seventy-three sects, all of them in the Fire except one. Therefore: This Hadith details His saying, the Exalted: {But they will not cease to differ}. He said: You will differ into seventy-three sects. Then he, peace and blessings be upon him, explained what our Lord indicated by the exception in the previous verse: (Except whom your Lord has given mercy). Who are these who receive mercy? He said in the completion of the Hadith: All of them in the Fire except one. They said: Who is it, O Messenger of Allah! He said: It is the Jama'ah (Group). And in the other narration, which explains and clarifies the first narration, he said: The Saved Sect is the one that is upon what I and my companions are upon. Thus: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, has given us the description of the Saved Sect which is one out of seventy-three sects. The meaning of this is that the Muslim should not be satisfied with saying: "La ilaha illa Allah, Muhammad Rasul Allah"; because this Ummah which will say this good word will split into seventy-three sects, all of them in the Fire except one sect. Therefore: The Muslim must be keen, with all keenness, to know the description of this sect, its creedto know its creed, to know its jurisprudence, to know its behavior, its dealing with one another, its dealing with its opponents, with its enemies... and so on. From where can a Muslim reach the knowledge of these matters related to the Saved Sect? This is the point I want to hover around, and detail the speech in it with some detail; because we said there is no disagreement among Muslims that Islam is "La ilaha illa Allah," but

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: reality bears witness that the fewest of Muslims are those who are keen to know themselves: are they from the Saved Sect or not? How is the Saved Sect known? Perhaps we all knowsome of us know with certainty, but perhaps all of us present know the following versethe Exalted said addressing His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family: {And We revealed to you the Reminder that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them} [An-Nahl: 44]. {The Reminder} meaning: the Noble Qur'an, where the Exalted said: {Indeed, it is We who sent down the Reminder and indeed, We will be its guardian} [Al-Hijr: 9]. The first verse, our Lord Almighty says in it: And We revealed to you, O Muhammad, this Reminder, the Qur'an, so that you only recite it to the people? He must recite it, and had he, peace be upon him, not recited it, we would not have known it nor would it have reached us. But is his duty, peace and blessings be upon him, limited to reciting the Qur'an only to the people, and for them to learn it from him as it happened, or is there another duty our Lord Almighty commanded him to perform? The answer: Yes, where He said: {And We revealed to you the Reminder that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them}. So in this verse, there is what can be pointed to with two words, or two terms. First: In this verse is a clarified matter (Mubayyan), which is the Qur'an. And in this verse is a clarifier (Mubayyin), which is the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. So the clarified Qur'an is the Speech of Allah, and the speech of the clarifying Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, is his Hadith and his Sunnah. Therefore: There is no way to be knowledgeable of what the Saved Sect was upon except by resorting to the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. This is also a fact that none of the Muslims disagree on at all, meaning that the Qur'an, the Messenger, peace be upon him, undertook its explanation. And among the clearest

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Examples of that are that we pray five prayers every day. We do not find in the Noble Qur'an five prayers... we do not find in the Noble Qur'an the details of the Rak'ahs: Fajr is two Rak'ahs, Dhuhr, Asr and Isha are four, and Maghrib is distinguished from all these prayers by being three Rak'ahs. From where did we know these details? From the Clarifier, who is he, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. His clarification, then, is in his Sunnah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. His Sunnah, as the scholars of Hadith mention, is divided into three parts: his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, his action, and his approval. His saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, is known: everything that ran on his tongue, peace be upon him, regarding that clarification: {And We revealed to you the Reminder that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them} [An-Nahl: 44]. So this is his saying, as came in the Hadith of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he was in a gathering where there was a mix of polytheists. This Ibn Amr, may Allah be pleased with him, was the keenest of all Companions on writing, to write what he heard from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, out of his keenness to preserve it. So the polytheists in that gathering raised an objection to him. They said to him: "You write from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, what he speaks in the state of contentment and anger?" As if they were saying: It is reasonable to write what he speaks in the state of contentment, but to also write what he says in this anger? They disapproved of his intense keenness on writing. It was as if a doubt entered his soul, so he hastened to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and mentioned to him what the polytheists said to him. He, peace be upon him, did nothing but raise his finger to his mouth and said to him: Write, for by the One in Whose Hand is the soul of Muhammad! Nothing comes out of it except truth. This is from the Sunnah, his saying, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. The second part is his action; so everything he, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, did contains guidance and light, based on details for which there is no room to mention now. The third part comes: what he, peace be upon him, saw as an action from someone else and then remained silent about it

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and approved it, so this entered into the Sunnah which we should hold fast to; we do not differentiate between his saying, his action, and his approval. Here comes, after this explanation of the Sunnah, an explanation of something that was mentioned in the Hadith of the Saved Sect... Now the situation is natural and praise be to Allah, the atmosphere is good. He, peace be upon him, saidand I hope you remember with me his saying when he was asked about the Saved Sect, he said: What I and my companions are upon. He did not limit it to his saying: What I am upon meaning: what he is upon of the verbal, practical, and approval-based Sunnah. He added to that: and my companions. Therefore: We cannot turn a blind eye to what the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, were upon. Why? If you reflect on the third part of his Sunnah, peace be upon him, which is that he sees someone else doing an action and performing a deed then he approves it, this thing becomes part of the Sunnah. Who was doing this action? It is someone other than him, peace be upon him; it is his companions. Therefore: A Muslim cannot live a correct Islamic life except by knowing the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and knowing what his companions were upon. And from here you know with me the importance of what came in the Hadith of Al-Irbad bin Sariyah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said in it: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, gave us an admonition by which the hearts were filled with fear and eyes shed tears. We said: O Messenger of Allah! Advise us? He said: I advise you to fear Allah and to hear and obey, even if an Abyssinian slave is appointed over you; for whoever among you lives will see much difference. Now connect this saying with the previous verse: {But they will not cease to differ * Except whom your Lord has given mercy} [Hud: 118 - 119].

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: He, peace be upon him, said: For whoever among you lives will see much difference. So upon you is my Sunnah, then he coupled it with and said: and the Sunnah of the Righteous Guided Caliphs after me; bite onto it with your molars, and beware of newly invented matters; for every newly invented matter is a Bid'ah (innovation), and every Bid'ah is misguidance. And in another Hadith: And every misguidance is in the Fire. Thus you find the Hadiths resonating with each other and supporting each other, and all of them and their sum draw our attention to the fact that whoever truly wants to be from the Saved Sect, upon him is to know not only the Sunnah of the Messenger, peace be upon him, but also what his noble companions were upon. This last point is what most Muslims today are heedless of. All of them say: "Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family," and all of them call to following the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, even if they differ in applying this Sunnah; because they differ in the abundance of acquaintance with it in knowledge or the lack of acquaintance with it. But as He said: {But most of the people do not know} [Al-A'raf: 187], most of them do not pay attention to what came in the Hadith of the Saved Sect, and in the Hadith of Al-Irbad bin Sariyah of the command also for something else in addition to the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, which is the Sunnah of the Companions, and especially the Righteous Caliphs among them. Is there in the Noble Qur'anwhich enumerated everything related to the fundamentals of religion and its rulesis there in the Noble Qur'an even one phrase indicating this meaning which I gathered and collected for you from numerous and numerous Hadiths? The answer: Yes; the Exalted said: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the believers' way, We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115].

book_title: Collection of Allama Al-Albani's Heritage in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Research and Islamic Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: We notice here a very, very, very important observation, which is that Allah Almighty could haveand He is the Wise, the All-Knowing, the All-Powerfulsaid, for example: "And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him, We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination," meaning: without coupling to the opposition of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, His saying: {and follows other than the believers' way}. Allah was capable of that, so why then? What is the wisdom of His coupling, Mighty and Majestic, His saying: {and follows other than the believers' way} to: {opposes the Messenger}? I think you knew the secret from the Hadiths we presented to you. {and follows other than the believers' way} The secret is that those first believers are the ones who transmitted to us what they heard from the Messenger, peace be upon him, from his mouth fresh and tender, and they found it applied in his era, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, a practical application. So they are able to understand what Allah sent down to His Prophet of His Book and what His Prophet, peace be upon him, uttered in his wording. They are able to understand that better than everyone who comes after them. How could it not be so, when the matter is as he, peace be upon him, said: The witness sees what the absent does not see (1). Take for example, the Exalted said: {And the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38]. The hand (Yad) in the language is used to mean the palm, and used to mean the forearm with the palm, and used to mean the forearm with the upper arm. Now! How are we to understand the hand in this verse: {amputate their hands}? Just as there is in the verse of Tayammum: {so take clean sand and wipe over your faces and hands} [An-Nisa: 43].

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: How do we understand the hands here? Are they like they are there, or in a broader sense? If we do not return to the Clarifier referred to in the first verse: {And We revealed to you the Reminder that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them} [An-Nahl: 44], we would differ and become confused; that is because the Noble Qur'an was revealed in a clear Arabic tongue, and the hand has these numerous meanings. However, when we return to the Companions and find them transmitting the Sharia of Allah applied by the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and they understood this Sharia correctly, then it is no wonder that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, praised them, saying: The best of people are my generation, and he said: Honor my companions. And he said: Do good to my companions, for by the One in Whose Hand is the soul of Muhammad! If one of you were to spend the like of Mount Uhud in gold, it would not reach a mudd (a measure) of one of them nor half of it. That is because they strove in the cause of Allah, migrated in the cause of Allah, left their homelands in the cause of Allah, accompanied the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and knew the Sharia of Allah, as we said, closely and from near. Therefore: they are as he, peace be upon him, said in some hadiths: They are the people whose companion is not wretched. Therefore: everyone who wants to be from the Saved Sect must not be content only with knowing the Qur'an and the Sunnah alone. For if he is content and able to reach the understanding of the Book and the Sunnah only, even with this limitation (1), he will lose out on being from the Saved Sect, [which is] to be upon what his companions, peace be upon him, were upon. Thus: we can now summarize what has passed of the speech in detail and explanation to build upon this summary a new research.
foot_note: 1. (1) Meaning by returning to the Book and the Sunnah only, without the understanding of the Salaf (Predecessors).

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Every Muslim, after testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, must know that the path to knowing what the Messenger of Allah was upon is the Sunnah and the Companions, or in other words, the Righteous Predecessors (As-Salaf As-Salih); because the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said in the Mutawatir (mass-transmitted) hadith: The best of people are my generation, then those who follow them, then those who follow them. So, the Muslim must become acquainted with what his companions, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, were upon, otherwise, he will go far astray while thinking he is doing good work. The new thing now that I want to expand upon a little is: what is the path to knowing what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was upon in terms of speech, action, and approval, and what his companions, peace be upon him, inherited from him of guidance or guidance and light? What is the path? If a questioner asked us what is the path to knowing the speech of Allah Almighty, the answer, and praise be to Allah, is easy and facilitated: it is the Noble Qur'an. We have no book that Allah Almighty undertook to preserve except this Noble Qur'an, as He said in the previously mentioned verse: {Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian} [Al-Hijr: 9]. So Allah Almighty undertook the preservation of this Divine Speech, which is the Qur'an. He did not undertake the preservation of the Torah, nor the Gospel, nor the Scrolls of Abraham and Moses; that is because His wisdom dictated that these previous laws be a preparation for the Islamic Sharia, after which there is no Sharia. So it was of profound wisdom that our Lord Almighty undertook the preservation of this Noble Qur'an. Thus: the answer to the question 'what is the path to knowing the speech of Allah?' is the Noble Qur'an. But the very, very important question is: What is the way to knowing the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace be upon him, and what his noble companions were upon? Here is the very, very important research; it is what is known among all Muslim scholars as the Science of

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Hadith and the Science of Athar (Traditions). And Allah is Great, Allah is Great. The Science of Hadith comprises two sciences: one known as the Science of Hadith Terminology (Mustalah al-Hadith) and the other is the Science of Disparagement and Praise (Jarh wa Ta'dil). The Science of Hadith Terminology consists of scientific rules that scholars of Hadith collected over time, recorded, classified, simplified, and explained to the people; so that they could distinguish the authentic (Sahih) from the weak (Da'if) hadith. So what is this? It is the second science, the Science of Disparagement and Praise. The Science of Disparagement and Praise revolves around knowing the biographies of the thousands upon thousands of narrators of Hadith and Sunnah. Perhaps you all know something known among the scholars of Hadith as the Isnad (Chain of Transmission). The Isnad is a chain of men taking from one another; it starts with the Companion reporting from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, the Follower (Tabi'i) from the Companion, the Follower of the Follower from the Follower, and so on; until these hadiths were recorded with these chains of transmission in the known books of Sunnah, the number of which, by the will of Allah, exceeds thousands upon thousands. But the most famous of them are the Six Books, which are circulated today in the hands of the scholars of Sunnah. This Isnad is composed of men; these men are numbered, as we said, in thousands upon thousands. Each man among them has a biography in the books of Disparagement and Praise, stating when this narrator existed, when he was born, when he lived, who his teachers were, who his students who took from him were... and so on. Added to that is whether he is trustworthy (Thiqah), just ('Adl), immoral (Fasiq), a memorizer (Hafiz), or having poor memory. All these descriptions and others are also mentioned in this science, the Science of Disparagement and Praise. And all of you, I assume, know that the hadiths found in the bellies of books and circulated on the tongues of people contain what is authentic and what is not authentic.

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: Therefore: If we want to know what he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was upon, and what his noble companions were upon, there is no escape from becoming acquainted with these two sciences and studying them very broadly: Hadith Terminology and Disparagement and Praise. For whoever combines these two sciences is able to distinguish the authentic from the weak. So where are we today regarding this science which enables us to know the authentic from the weak? This knowledge is what connects us to the Saved Sect, otherwise, we will be far, far away, much or little, depending on the knowledge or ignorance of this Science of Hadith and Science of Disparagement and Praise. If you know this truth, then the disagreement that occurred in the past between the Islamic sects, and which continues to this day, one of its greatest causes is the turning awayI do not say of the general Muslims, but I say the turning away of the elite Muslimsfrom studying this science and spreading it, and from presenting its fruits to all Muslims so that they may be as the Lord of the Worlds said in the Noble Qur'an: {Say, "This is my way; I invite to Allah with insight, I and those who follow me. And exalted is Allah; and I am not of those who associate others with Him."} [Yusuf: 108]. Thus: one of the causes of the continuous disagreement is the distancing from studying this science, in short, the Science of Hadith. There is another reason; this was in the past, before scholars whom Allah Almighty subjected to serve Islam by serving the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace be upon him, became available to collect the Sunnah. As for today, this reason has disappeared, and the reason of neglecting the study of this science remains. As for the reason that has disappeared, you must know it; because it entails that you know the reason for the disagreement of Muslim scholars from old times until today in some jurisprudential issues. You all know, Allah willing, that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, had different situations when he spoke. Sometimes he would speak in the mosque, and according to the number of people present in the mosque, there would be

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: memorizers of his hadith. Sometimes there would be some Companions in the mosque, so he would speak and they would memorize from him, whereas the other Companions would not know what he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, spoke of in that gathering around which there were only a few individuals. Similarly, he used to travel, and those travelers who were with him took from him knowledge that those residing in Medina or Mecca or... etc., missed. And so the scenarios multiply, and each of you can be creative in listing them and recalling them in his mind. Examples of this include that he used to live in his house with his family, his wives, and his grandsons, so speech would occur between him, peace be upon him, and his family which is hadith that his Companions did not know at all; those outside the house had no knowledge of it, rather his family and wives are the ones who knew what happened in the house. Therefore: We cannot imagine a single individual from the Companions encompassing knowledge of all the hadiths of the Messenger, peace be upon him. This is an impossible matter; because an individual cannot be the shadow of the Messenger, peace be upon him, wherever he went, wherever he attended, wherever he sat, wherever he traveled, being with him; this is an impossible matter. The intent of all this speech, which is very self-evident, is that the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his familyand we have known that it is his speech, action, and approvalwas scattered among his Companions. So, was there a person in that time who could contact every individual of the Messenger, peace be upon him, and collect from them what they heard and what they witnessed from him, peace be upon him? Imagining this saves you from saying this is an impossible matter, especially if you remember the Islamic Conquests which necessitated that the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, disperse in the lands. So those who were in Mecca, were in Medina, were in Ta'if, were in Yemen; they went east

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and west and dispersed in the lands for the sake of raising the word of Allah Almighty. And as you know, Masha'Allah, the Islamic Conquests reached east to China and west to Spain, which was known then as Al-Andalus. Was it possible then for a person to catch up with these Companions who dispersed in the lands for the sake of Jihad? This is also an impossible matter. However, a nucleus began as a first attempt to collect what some of these individuals possessed by some of the Successors (Tabi'un). They were keen to contact some of the Companions. The one who established the sunnah of collecting from various Companions as much as was easy for him for these Successors was Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him. Abu Hurairah is the Memorizer (Hafiz) who can deserve this title among the Companions of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, even though he did not accept Islam until about two and a half years before his death, peace be upon him. Yet, he narrated the most hadith among the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. Why? He tells us about himself, saying: I used to be content filling my belly with small bites, then after that, I would sit with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and take hadith from him. This is one reason. And he adds to that that his companions, peace be upon him, were busy with deals in the markets, busy with trade; but they are the ones whom the Lord of the Worlds praised by His saying: {Men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer} [An-Nur: 37]. But Abu Hurairah was unique among them in that he was ascetic and satisfied with small bites, then [spent] the rest of the time with the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, as if he knew that his acceptance of Islam was late, so he wanted to compensate his Islam for what he missed of the long companionship enjoyed by the likes of Abu Bakr, Umar, and the first forerunners of the Companions. Therefore, he turned away from the whole world and turned to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. The second thing that made him the Memorizer of the Companions is that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said one day: Who will spread his garment and then memorize everything he hears from me? Abu Hurairah was the first to do so, so he spread his garment,

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: then he folded it. Abu Hurairah said: So I never forgot anything I heard from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, after that. This is the second reason. The third reason, which is the point of evidence, is that he was not content with hearing from the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, only. He used to go to the Companions, Abu Bakr, Umar, and others... and others, and pick up from them what they had memorized from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. Therefore: he is the one who established for the Successors and those after them the collection of hadiths from different narrators. That is why the student of Abu Hurairah's hadith notices that his hadiths are divided into two parts; in some of them, he says "I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family," and in most of them he says: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said." This is due to his precision and honesty regarding what he heard from him, peace be upon him, he says: "I heard the Messenger of Allah saying," and regarding what he heard from others, he does not say: "I heard from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family," but rather says "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said." The reason is that his Islam was late and what he heard from the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was little, so he wanted to make up for what he missed by contacting his old companions, so he collected from them. Thus, due to these three reasons, he was the Companion of the Messenger, peace be upon him, with the most hadith. That is why now those occupied with the Science of Hadith and books of Hadith find Abu Hurairah's hadiths in every book of the Sunnah having the highest precedence in number and quantity. Take for example a very clear example, the Musnad of Imam Ahmad, six volumes. The second volume of it, half of it belongs to Abu Hurairah. Out of six volumes containing the hadiths of all the Companionsthis which Imam Ahmad was able to collect by the method I pointed to, contacting people and collecting hadithsAbu Hurairah's Musnad in Imam Ahmad's Musnad took half of the second volume, meaning: one out of twelve. So Allah Almighty blessed Abu Hurairah with these reasons, and among them [the method] by which a Muslim is enabled

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: to collect the largest possible quantity of the Sunnah. Due to the dispersion of the Companions first, then the Successors, the Sunnah was dispersed. But the Successors began collecting from this Companion and that Companion. If one had limited himself to the hadiths of a single Companion, the quantity would have been small, but he added to it the hadiths of the second and third Companion according to what was easy for him. Then came the turn of the Followers of the Successors (Atba' al-Tabi'in), so the circle of collection expanded. Then came the turn of the Followers of the Successors, among whom were the Six Imams, the authors of the Six Books: Imam Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawood, Tirmidhi, Nasa'i, and Ibn Majah. These, due to their travel to the lands which the first Companions had opened and then the Successors followed them and so ondue to this movement, abundant Sunnah became available to each of them, Masha'Allah. The one with the most of it was Imam Ahmad, may Allah have mercy on him; because he traveled for the sake of collecting Hadith to most of the lands of the world at that time. Imam Shafi'i testified to his memorization, knowing that Imam Shafi'i is one of Imam Ahmad's teachers in Hadith, Tafsir, and Fiqh. Imam Shafi'i is one of Imam Ahmad's teachers, but Imam Ahmad distinguished himself over the scholars of his time by devoting himself completely like Abu Hurairah, so he did not work for the world and its adornment. He roamed the lands and contacted the narrators of Hadith, so he collected thousands upon thousands of the Sunnah. His teacher Imam Shafi'i testified to that for him, saying to him: "O Ahmad: You are more knowledgeable about Hadith than me." The Sheikh says to his student: "You are more knowledgeable about Hadith than me, so if an authentic hadith comes to you, inform me of it or let me know of it, whether it is Hijazi, Levantine (Shami), Egyptian, or... or... etc." He indicates that Imam Ahmad roamed and traveled to these lands and collected of the Sunnah what his Imam Shafi'i was not able to collect. Therefore, he said to him: "You are more knowledgeable about Hadith than me." The point of all this speech is that one of the reasons for the difference of opinion among the four scholars, the Imams

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: The Four [Imams]: Abu Hanifa, Malik, Shafi'i, and Ahmad, is this which I tell you: that the Sunnah was dispersed by the dispersion of its bearers from the Companions, then the Successors. After that came the role of these four Imams. For the first of them, as you know, was Abu Hanifa, may Allah have mercy on him, and he died in the year 150 AH, so he is considered among the junior Successors. However, may Allah have mercy on him, he specialized in Fiqh (Jurisprudence) and did not leave Kufa except as a pilgrim or performing Umrah, so his hadith was little. After him came Imam Malik, where Imam Malik was born in the year Abu Hanifa died, and he resided in the Abode of Migration, Medina Al-Munawwarah. And Medina Al-Munawwarah, as is its reality today, considering it is frequented and intended by performers of Umrah and pilgrims, scholars there are numerous. Therefore, Malik's hadithand he also did not travel or go out to collect Hadithwas more than Abu Hanifa's. Then came the turn of the third Imam, who is Imam Shafi'i. He resided, may Allah have mercy on him, in Baghdad, and Baghdad was the capital of the Abbasid Caliphs as you know, so it was also a haven and refuge for various scholars. So he acquired of knowledge and Sunnah, Masha'Allah. Then he traveled from Baghdad to Egypt, and from here he acquired new material of knowledge, especially the Science of Hadith. So he surpassed the first two Imams, Imam Abu Hanifa and Imam Shafi'i [sic - meant Malik], because he resided a large part of his life in Baghdad in addition to performing Hajj and Umrah, then he spent the end of his life in Egypt, so gathered for him of Hadith what did not gather for the first two Imams. The fourth Jurist Imam came, who is Ahmad bin Hanbal. He did not only surpass the three Imams, but he surpassed masses of Hadith scholars due to the abundance of encompassing the Sunnah. So he was the most memorizing of them for the Sunnah and more knowledgeable than many of the scholars of Hadith about Hadith. For this reason, a scholar like Abu Hanifa would be asked about an issue, so he would look into what he had of the Book of Allah and the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and issue a fatwa based on what he had. If he did not find [a text], he exercised Ijtihad (independent reasoning),

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: and Ijtihad is necessary; because the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said: If a judge judges and exercises Ijtihad and is correct, he has two rewards; and if he errs, he has one reward. But as you understand from this hadith, Ijtihad is prone to correctness and error. One of the other Imams might be asked the same question, and he would answer with an answer from the material of Hadith he possesses which the Imam who issued a fatwa by his own Ijtihad did not obtain. So if you know this historical fact related to the method of collecting Hadith, the confusion will disappear from your minds regarding the cause of the Imams' disagreement. And regarding disagreement, we mentioned earlier His Almighty's saying: {But they will not cease to differ * Except whom your Lord has given mercy} [Hud: 118-119]. And they are undoubtedly shown mercy, so why did they differ? They are excused because they were not able to collect the Sunnah back then. As for today, we are not excused. The reason is that today we can gather the efforts of the Imams who passed and spent their lives in all eras. We gather them by buying their wealth, which is priceless, for a few counted coins. It is the book Musnad Ahmad, six volumes, his scientific life he included in it. You can dedicate only a year of your life at most, and obtain the knowledge of Imam Ahmad which he acquired over years and with great, abundant effort, which is roaming the lands and traveling to them. But the ailment of people today is asceticism (lack of interest) in the Science of Hadith, and turning away from studying Hadith, and contentment that any hadith we find in any book isas that Bedouin said(Khosh Hadith - Nice Hadith). But you know that the hadiths of the Messenger, peace be upon him, contain the authentic and the weak. The Messenger, peace be upon him, had been informed by Allah Almighty in advance that people would lie about him. And they lied about him even during his era, peace be upon him; during his lifetime, there was found one who lied about him. So he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said: Whoever lies about me intentionally, let him take his seat in

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: the Fire. How was this? A man loved a woman, so he went to her family to propose to her. In order for them to respond to him and not reject him, he said to them: I am the messenger of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, to you, ordering you to marry your young woman to me. The people and the guardian of the young woman found such a command strange; because they know that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, is as the Lord of the Worlds described him: {And indeed, you are of a great moral character} [Al-Qalam: 4]. Is it reasonable that the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, sends them an order to marry so-and-so while they do not know him? It is not reasonable, but there might be revelation or something. Therefore: Let us send to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. When they came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah! Did you send so-and-so? He said: No. Catch the man; if you find him, burn him in the fire. But I do not see that you will catch him. And indeed, when they chased him, they found that a viper snake had bitten him and his death was in it. This is the reason for his saying, peace be upon him: Whoever lies about me intentionally, let him take his seat in the Fire. And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Indeed, lies will be told about me; so whoever lies about me... to the end. And other hadiths came so that the Muslim is not deceived to say: I do not intend to lie about him, and thus takes lightly narrating Hadith and attributing Hadith to the Messenger, peace be upon him, without verifying its authenticity. So he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Whoever narrates a hadith while he sees [thinks] it is a lie, then he is one of the liars. Whoever narrates a hadith thinking it is a lie against the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, then he is one of the liars. So, in order for you to know whether this hadith is lied about the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, or not? What is the path? A path of two paths, there is no third, like legal rulings. To know that this is Halal and this is Haram, what is the path?

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: A path of two paths: either you seek knowledge to become a scholar so you know from the Book of Allah and the Hadith of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, the Halal and the Haram; or you are from the general public, in which case His Almighty's saying in the Noble Qur'an is directed at you: {So ask the people of the message [Remembrance] if you do not know} [An-Nahl: 43]. So either you are a scholar, so seek a ruling from yourself, or you are not a scholar, so seek a ruling from your scholar. Ask the people of the message if you do not know. Every science has men, whether this science is religious or worldly. Any human now who wants to build a house does not act from his own head, but brings an engineer, an architect, a builder... And so if he wants to treat himself or treat a patient, he does not treat [him himself] but goes to the doctor and the specialist doctor, etc. Religious knowledge, in its two parts, Hadith and Fiqh, is more deserving that Muslims care about this rule which the Lord of the Worlds laid down in the previous verse: {So ask the people of the message if you do not know} [An-Nahl: 43]. So what is the path to knowing Halal and Haram? We said either you are a scholar, so ask your knowledge, or you are not a scholar, so ask the jurists. What is the path to knowing the authentic hadith from the weak? If you are a scholar, ask your knowledge. If you are not a scholar: {So ask the people of the message if you do not know} [An-Nahl: 43]. People today have not given the Science of Hadith, even in this last aspect, what it deserves of attention. Fiqh, most of them care about their religion to know the Haram and Halal, and therefore people from this angle are still fine. But it is very, very rare to find someone who cares about knowing [the status of] the hadith he hears or the hadith he reads, to ask the people of knowledge if this hadith is authentic or not. Merely hearing or reading, he stops at what he heard or read. Let him remember the threat

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: warning against narrating hadiths except after verifying their authenticity. Therefore: Here too, there must be a summary after that summary. I say: For a Muslim to be upon the Sunnah and upon what the Companions were upon, there is no way to that except by knowing the Science of Hadith. For the Science of Hadith is what informs you of what he, peace be upon him, used to say, do, and approve. And the Science of Hadith is what guides you to what his companions, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, were upon regarding guidance, knowledge, morals, behavior, and the like. So I advise all Muslims in general to care about the Science of Hadith and verification in what they read and what they hear. And I advise their elite to care about studying the Science of Hadith so they can spread authentic hadiths among the people; because these authentic hadiths only are what lead them to know firstly the Saved Sect and to be part of it secondly, otherwise they are in great danger. And this amount is sufficient, especially since I see that slumber has begun to tickle some eyes. In my experience, if we open the door for questions, there might be some movement, wakefulness, and blessing, Allah willing. So whoever has an observation, whoever has a question related to what was previously presented and explained of the scientific approach that Muslims, their elite and general public, must follow, let him prefer and present the question related to what has passed. And if there is no question related to what has passed, we accept any other question related to understanding the religion. (Al-Huda wan-Noor /445/ 46: 19: 00) (Al-Huda wan-Noor /445/ 48: 47: 00)

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: A section from it. The Sheikh: This is an awakening, this is the start of the awakening, but we want to hear a third thing, which is: Allah said, the Messenger said, the Righteous Predecessors (As-Salaf As-Salih) said. Without the third and last statement, a scholar cannot truly be a believer in what came in the Book and the Sunnah. He can never be upon guidance from his Lord in his interpretation of the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, unless he resorts to receiving that from the Companions of the Messenger, and follows the path of the first believers. {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him} [An-Nisa: 115]. Allah did not say immediately: {We will turn him to what he has turned} [An-Nisa: 115], but rather He conjoined with opposing the Messenger, saying: {and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115]. Did Allah say: {and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115] in vain? Far be it from Allah Almighty. So why this sentence? Was it not enough for Allah to say: And whoever opposes the Messenger, We will turn him to what he has turned? Even after guidance has become clear to him? It would have been enough if we wanted to rely only on the Book and the Sunnah. But Allah Almighty, for a clear and apparent wisdom, said: {and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115]. Andpeace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his familywhen he admonishes his companions, he draws their attention and emphasizes to their hearing repeatedly and reiteratively to take his Sunnah and the Sunnah of his companions. And he, peace be upon him, said when describing the Saved Sect that it is the one that is upon what the Messenger was upon only? Rather, he conjoined and said: What I and my companions are upon

book_title: Collection of the Heritage of Allama Al-Albani in Methodology and Major Events
publisher: Al-Nu'man Center for Islamic Research and Studies and Heritage Verification and Translation, Sana'a - Yemen
text: What I and my companions are upon. Also in the hadith of Irbad bin Sariyah, and it is well-known and I have no need to cite it in its entirety, but the evidence from it is: So adhere to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the Righteous Guided Caliphs after me. The secret in this: is that they are the trustworthy transmitters who transmitted to us the application of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, of the texts of the Book and the wordings of his hadiths. Take for example some Qur'anic verses, and among the most important of them is what relates to some legal limits (Hudud). He Almighty said: {[As for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38]. The thief (As-Sariq) linguistically: No one who is an Arab can be ignorant of what 'thief' means. And that any human who stole something, no matter how slight and very small this thing is; he is a thief. Likewise, the hand: {amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38]. The hand is also known. But the thief, as is known, has several forms: he steals a needle, he steals an egg, he steals a chicken, he steals to infinity. All these thefts of all types, the thief is called: a thief. So is the hand of every thief cut? The answer: No. From where do we get this from the Qur'an? The Qur'an spoke generally saying: And the thief. Yes, from the clarification of the Messenger, peace be upon him, where he said: No cutting except in a quarter of a dinar and upwards. No cutting except in a quarter of a dinar and upwards. So whoever steals what is less than a quarter of a dinar, it is not permissible to cut his hand; it would be oppression and injustice against him if his hand were cut. This is clear. But what needs more clarification than this is that when Allah said: {Amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38], we find the hand used sometimes referring to: the arm up to the elbows, and we find sometimes the hand used referring to: the palms only. When Allah Almighty said in this verse {Amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38], what is the hand intended here? Linguistically: whether the thief's hand is cut from the wrist, or from the elbow, or from the shoulder, all of that is a hand. Whoever applies the text of this Qur'an in any of these three ways: the palm, the arm, or the hand entirely from the shoulder, linguistically: has applied the Qur'anic text: a hand, amputate their hands. But is this Sharia (Law)? The answer: No. From the application of the Messenger to this Qur'anic text, meaning: when he cut the thief's hand, he did not cut it from the shoulder, nor from the elbow, but from the wrist. From where did we know this? From the Companions, from those trustworthy transmitters. They are the ones who transmitted to us this Islam with all its details which we pointed to even with a brief word. Therefore, Imam Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya, may Allah have mercy on him, says in his scientific poetry:
Knowledge is: Allah said, His Messenger said ... The Companions said; it is not by camouflage.
Knowledge is not your setting up disagreement foolishly ... Between the Messenger and the opinion of a jurist.
Nay, nor denying the Attributes and negating them ... wary of stripping (Ta'til) and likening (Tashbih).
So what is knowledge? Allah said, the Messenger of Allah said, the Companions of the Messenger of Allah said. This is what I wanted to emphasize to your hearing, repeating it always with the Book and the Sunnah: The Companions. Up to now, few people pay attention to this addition which our Lord pointed to in the previous verse: {and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115]. For the way of the believers in our examplethe examples are many and very manyin our example, the way of the believers is: cutting the hand of the thief from the wrist, and not from the elbow, nor from the shoulder. Whoever does contrary to this has opposed the Messenger and followed other than the way of the believers. text: answering some questionsthe question was earlier: That some scholars say: it is permissible to be employed in usurious banks. We see these scholars whom the questioner refers to, firstly: Did they say: Allah said, the Messenger of Allah said? Leave aside the third addition which is essential, did they say: Allah said, the Messenger of Allah said? The answer: No; because the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, who undertook the clarification of the Qur'an, said the opposite of what those mentioned in the question say: that they are scholars. What did Allah say? He Almighty said: {And cooperate in righteousness and piety, but do not cooperate in sin and aggression} [Al-Ma'idah: 2]. So who doubtsI do not say: who among the people of knowledge doubts? Rather, I do not say: who among the students of knowledge doubts? Rather, is there a Muslim with a mind who doubts that he who works as an employee in the bank helps the bank consume people's money unjustly, and consume what Allah has forbidden? I do not think anyone doubts this fact, otherwise, he would not have the ability to understand the meaning of: {but do not cooperate in sin and aggression} [Al-Ma'idah: 2]. Cooperating in sin is different from committing sin directly. This is a scientific fact known, I do not say by people of knowledge, but by beginner students of knowledge. Here is now for you the clarification of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, related to such a verse: {but do not cooperate in sin and aggression} [Al-Ma'idah: 2]. Consuming usury (Riba) is undoubtedly among the major sins according to any Muslim whatsoever. And that drinking wine or being addicted to it is among the prohibitions; even if he does not drink wine, it is likewise. Do you think if there was no cooperation in evil, would you have been able to find a usurer consuming people's money by way of Riba? No. Would you find a wine drinker if there were no cooperators in evil? The answer: No. And the evidence from the Sunnah explaining the Qur'an: Allah cursed ten regarding wine. text: - peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family: Allah cursed ten regarding wine. The first one he, peace and blessings be upon him, mentioned: its drinker, its drinker. Then he conjoined with that the rest of the ten. He said: its server, the one who asks for it to be served, its presser, the one who asks for it to be pressed, its seller, its drinker, its carrier, and the one to whom it is carried. All these did not drink wine, but they are the cause for the existence of the wine drinker. If, for example, the grape seller did not exist, it would not be pressed into wine, and wine would not exist in the world. Therefore: {but do not cooperate in sin and aggression} [Al-Ma'idah: 2]. Legally cursed is the one who does not drink wine as long as he aids the wine drinker, meaning he prepares the causes for him to be able to drink wine. This is a hadith agreed upon by Muslim scholars as authentic, and it has come from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, through numerous authentic routes. The second hadith, which is at the core of the subject: Allah cursed the consumer of Riba (usury), its payer, its scribe, and its two witnesses. So can a scholar be imagined saying: There is no harm for a Muslim to be an employee in a usurious bank, writing Riba, while the Messenger of Allah says: Allah cursed the consumer of Riba, its payer, its scribe, and its two witnesses? This is not a scholar. He might be a scholar in the sense of: {O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do? * Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do} [As-Saff: 2-3]. I do not imagine a man truly believing in Allah, and truly knowledgeable of the Book and Sunnah, who yet says and issues that unjust fatwa: that it is permissible for a Muslim to be an employee in a bank. Now we have posed the following question repeatedly and the answer was one by consensus. I do not say now these employees, but I say: these foolish ones who are not workers in the bank, but they deposited their money in the bank. If they all agreed to

Those who feed [it]. They might say we deposit and place our money in the bank to protect it, and we do not consume Riba (usury), thinking that they are doing good work. Nay, and nay again. By the evidence that if they withdrew these funds, the banks would go bankrupt. Therefore, those who deposit their money in banks are the cause of the existence of the consumers of Riba. Thus, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, spoke the truth when he said: Allah cursed the consumer of Riba and its payer. So if the one outside the bank is cursed legally because he is the cause of the existence of this bank, then we move to the image directly related to the question: These people dealing with banks still deposit their money in banks. If we assume that these employees in the bank repented and turned to Allah AlmightyI do not say when they heard the fatwa of the Sheikh contrary to the fatwa of that scholar, but I say: when they heard the hadith of the Messenger, peace be upon him. First: The hadith related to them: Allah cursed the consumer of Riba, its payer, its scribe, and its two witnesses. Then the hadith: Ten are cursed regarding wine. They heard these two hadiths and turned [to Allah] and repented and withdrew. What happens to the bank? It will undoubtedly become disabled. Therefore, cooperation in evil is a text in the Noble Qur'an and a very great Islamic principle. It is not permissible for a Muslim to aid a Muslim in evil, let alone aid a disbeliever in evil.

text: Let us say the word about these Namisat and Mutanammisat, meaning: the customer. And the Washimat (tattooers), the Mustawshimat (those asking to be tattooed). The tattooer is known. You find not only women but men also. You find this animal which is the image of a human drawing on his veins and on his skin which Allah created perfectly, making him a well-proportioned human; depicted in the image of a lion, carrying a sword with what, tattooing. So who depicted this? The tattooer (Washim). So he is a Mustawshim: meaning asking for the tattoo from another. Were it not for the tattooer, there would be no tattooed person. So look at how the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, wants to make the Islamic society a society cooperating in righteousness, refraining from evil: Allah cursed the Namisat, the Mutanammisat, the Washimat, the Mustawshimat, and the Falijat, the Mutafallijat (those who file teeth for beauty). This we haven't seen, and we hope not to see it, but we are seeing what is worse than it. It seems that in the past, Satan beautified for some women to change the beautiful, handsome creation of Allah. For as you know, Allah Almighty created in the mouth of every human teeth like set pearls. But Allah's creation does not please her, so she goes to the Falijah. The Falijah, meaning: beautician, barber, takes a fine file and widens between the tooth and the tooth; so it pleases her that the tooth appears from her teeth far from the sides of the two surrounding teeth; so it pleases her that a canine appears for her like the canine of a dog, for example. This is better to her than her teeth being as Allah Almighty created them. This is Al-Falj (filing/spacing), and those are the Falijat and Mutafallijat. Why did he denounce these two types [the actor and the receiver] involved in the evil and the one causing the evil? Because they cooperated in evil specifically in these traits mentioned here. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said at the end of the hadith: Those who change Allah's creation for beauty. In truth, brothers, if the Islamic society walked by this verse only: {but do not cooperate in sin and aggression} [Al-Ma'idah: 2], we would be as our first fathers were, living in glory and majesty, feared by enemies from a month's distance.

However, what I want to remind [you] of in this blessed hour, Allah willing, is the clarification of the difference between the Saved Sect and the other deviant sects, even those among them that are still within the circle of Islam but have strayed from some of Islam, much or little. Our Lord is the One who knows it, knows him, and judges by it: {The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children * But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart} [Ash-Shu'ara: 89]. The difference between the Saved Sect and all those sects is that the Saved Sect refuses to understand Islam, the Qur'an, and the Sunnah through the opinion of so-and-so (Fulan wa 'Allan), no matter how great his status is among Muslims, except through the path of the Messenger, peace be upon him, first, then through the path of his companions, peace and blessings be upon him, thirdly [sic - meant secondly/thirdly in sequence]. Because the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, when asked about the Saved Sect, did not say: "What I am upon" [only], but rather he conjoined to that his saying: and my companions. This means: that the Muslim scholar truly, just as he is keen to know what the Messenger, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was upon of guidance and light in speech, action, and approval, he is also keen to know what his companions, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, were upon regarding good following of their Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. This Saved Sect, this is its merit over the other sects, and this is very apparent in this time, as I will clarify shortly, Allah Blessed and Exalted willing. But before that, I want to remind our listening brothers of a verse in the Noble Qur'an. This verse is considered the text from which the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, launched, or from which he quoted his previous saying: What I and my companions are upon. I mean the saying of Allah Blessed and Exalted: {And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115], He said: {and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination} [An-Nisa: 115]. So the saying of our Lord Blessed and Exalted in this verse: {and follows other than the way of the believers} [An-Nisa: 115] is what he, peace be upon him, clarified in the previous hadith when he said: and my companions.

Therefore, the methodology of one who attributes himself to the Salaf differs from the methodology of one who attributes himself only to the Qur'an and the Sunnah, and interprets it or them as his sheikh or his madhhab interprets, without returning in that to what the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, his companions, and those who followed them in goodness were upon. text: always and forever upon the saying: that holding fast to the Book and the Sunnah is not a correct holding fast unless it is accompanied by following what the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, were upon. Here, I must strike an example that clarifies to us the importance of returning, in understanding the Book and the Sunnah, to what the Righteous Predecessors were upon, from what they transmitted from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, in speech, action, and approval. We take, for example, His Blessed and Exalted's saying: {[As for] the thief, the male and the female, amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38]. Here are two general, comprehensive texts. First: the noun "thief" (Al-Sariq), and the other: "the hand" (Al-Yad). His saying: {The thief} [Al-Ma'idah: 38] includes every thief, even one who steals an egg, a chicken's egg, or a chicken, or the like of what has no value. This, linguistically, is called a thief. However, the verbal clarification of, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, is what prevents us from interpreting this word in this verse upon its absoluteness and comprehensiveness. It prevents us from saying: Every thief, no matter the value of the stolen item, his hand is cut. We say: No, this is not permissible, this contradicts the Qur'an; because Allah says: {[We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message [Reminder] that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them} [An-Nahl: 44]. And he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, clarified the thief mentioned in this verse by his saying: No cutting except in a quarter of a dinar and upwards. Thus: when we read this verse: {The thief} [Al-Ma'idah: 38], we should understand this word in the light of his saying, peace be upon him. {Amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38], here "the hands" (Al-Aydi), as you know, is the plural of hand (Yad). The hand is used referring to the palm, as came in the hadith of Tayammum: That you strike the face of the earth with your palms. And it is used referring to the arm as it is in the hadith of the verse of Ablution in the verse of Ablution. And it is used referring to the whole hand from the shoulder to the fingers. So I wonder, whoever took the generality of the verse: {Amputate their hands} [Al-Ma'idah: 38] and applied the Qur'anic text upon this absolute sense, would he be a follower of the Noble Qur'an? The Answer: It is clear from the previous comment regarding the thief, no; because he opposed the clarification of, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. But the clarification here was from him, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, a practical, action-based clarification, where the hand of

The verses mentioned in the Qur'an as absolute or general are many, very many. It pleases me to suggest to some students of knowledge to collect these absolute or general verses in the Noble Qur'an and clarify what entered them of restriction or specification by what came in the Sunnah, and in the authentic Sunnah; to show the people that there is no room for understanding the Qur'an without the Sunnah of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, and without the clarification of his companions, peace and blessings be upon him, of what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, was upon. I said earlier: The absolute or general verses are many, very many. Take for example the verses that order Zakah, order Prayer, and order Hajj. They cannot be understood except in the light of the Book and the Sunnah. From here, the exit of the sect called today the "Quranists" (Al-Qur'aniyyun) from the circle of Islam and Muslims becomes clear to us, when they said: We are in no need of understanding the Qur'an through the Sunnah. That is due to what I pointed to earlier of the clarification that whoever does not take the Sunnah does not take the Qur'an; because the Qur'an ordered Muslims in more than one verse to seek judgment from Allah and His Messenger, as is known in the well-known verse: {And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day} [An-Nisa: 59]. The research in this is long, very long. I only intended in it to alert to the necessity of every Muslim who is jealous for being of the Saved Sect to pay attention, that he should not be content for himself or for others to say: I am a follower of the Book and the Sunnah, nothing more. He must couple with these two fundamental sources that we know what the Companions of the Messenger, peace be upon him, were upon regarding guidance and light. Thereby, we realize the attribute of the Saved Sect, which is that we be upon what the Messenger of Allah and his companions were upon. This, as I said earlier, is a wide door. But I must bring a new constraint due to the negligence of many Islamic callers regarding it, which is caring for knowing what is authentic of the Sunnah and what is not authentic
